story:
A little about me

I am the artist known online as Christy "Goldenwolf" Grandjean (and sometimes just Goldenwolf)!  I am a mostly self-taught professional artist well known for my anthropomorphic animal characters and unique whimsical style.  My work is quite visible and wide-spread across the internet and I am currently licensed with The Mountain, Inc. (popular t-shirt company) and I have been published in several magazines and other publications.  My art has even been featured on the hit MTV series "Teen Wolf"!

I have always been asked if I had any books of my artwork.  I've never done one before and decided to put together a sketchbook to get my feet wet in the book making process.  I figured a sketchbook is a good place to start as it is easy to put together, and it's always fun to see the drawings and sketches of your favorite artists.  It gives you some idea of their creative process, and it also lets you get a glimpse into who they are.  So this is my first ever art book, a collection of some of my sketches, drawings, and doodles from over the years.  

I need your help getting funded so that I can cover my costs of printing a first run of these sketchbooks. 

The Sketchbook

8.5" X 11" Perfect Bound Paperback
Black and White interior
Glossy Full Color Cover  

60 Pages full of my sketches and drawings from over the years, including many never before seen works!


What I Need, and Perks!

Even though we have far exceeded our initial goal, you can still contribute and get your perks until June 4th!

I would like to do an initial printing run of 300 books, which will cost approximately $800 to get printed via lulu.com.  Once they are printed they will be available on my website, www.goldenwolfen.com, and at the various art shows and conventions I attend throughout the year.

I am offering a few funding tiers with perks for your contribution:

  • $27 - You will receive an unsigned copy of the IGG Special Edition sketchbook and a bookmark with my thanks! (International contributors add $9 for shipping).
  • $40 - You will receive a signed copy of the IGG Special Edition sketchbook, the bookmark, plus an 8.5" X 11" unmatted print of your choice from my website. (International contributors add $9 for shipping).
  • $50 - You will receive a signed copy of the IGG Special Edition sketchbook, the bookmark, an 8.5" X 11" print from my website, and an additional 8.5" X 11" print OR three Wuffies stickers.. (International contributors add $9 for shipping).
  • $75 - You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook, the bookmark, a matted 11" X 14" print of your choice from my website, and a t-shirt from my website.
  • $100 SOLD OUT!! - You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook, an 8.5" X 11" unmatted print of your choice from my website, and a custom sketch in pencil on the inside of the sketchbook!  Two-word descriptions only, such as "Anthro Wolf", "Werewolf", "Tiger Dude", "Dragon", "Fairy", etc.  Allow an additional 6 - 8 weeks for delivery after the sketchbooks are printed. (International contributors add $9 for shipping).
  • $500 - You will receive a signed, IGG Special Edition copy of the sketchbook, the bookmark, and the original colored drawing "Amur Ranger" from the IGG Special Edition!  This original measures 11" X 14" and will be double matted in a ready to frame 16" X 20" mat.  It is done in pencil and watercolor on smooth Bristol paper, and -does not- include any watermarks or copyright marks.  It is signed and dated on the back.

Stretch Goal #1 - Achieved! Limited Edition Sketchbook!

The campaign has reached over $4,000, so I will do a brand new from scratch drawing and color it!  It will be featured in the center of the book and will be exclusive to a contributor-only IGG Special Edition run of the sketchbook.  Everyone that has contributed to the campaign so far will receive the IGG Special Edition Sketchbook, and it will not be available after the campaign!  The open, regular edition sketchbook will not feature this special colored piece, so if you want it, contribute now!  You have until the campaign comes to a close on June 4th to get the IGG Special Edition Sketchbook!

Colored piece for the sketchbook (will not include watermarks)

Stretch Goal #2 - Achieved!  Free Bookmark!

The campaign has reached over $5,000, so everyone will get this nifty bookmark for free with your sketchbook! :D

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in my sketchbook!

Thanks for checking out my funding campaign!
story_txt:
A little about me
I am the artist known online as Christy "Goldenwolf" Grandjean (and sometimes just Goldenwolf)!  I am a mostly self-taught professional artist well known for my anthropomorphic animal characters and unique whimsical style.  My work is quite visible and wide-spread across the internet and I am currently licensed with The Mountain, Inc. (popular t-shirt company) and I have been published in several magazines and other publications.  My art has even been featured on the hit MTV series "Teen Wolf"!I have always been asked if I had any books of my artwork.  I've never done one before and decided to put together a sketchbook to get my feet wet in the book making process.  I figured a sketchbook is a good place to start as it is easy to put together, and it's always fun to see the drawings and sketches of your favorite artists.  It gives you some idea of their creative process, and it also lets you get a glimpse into who they are.  So this is my first ever art book, a collection of some of my sketches, drawings, and doodles from over the years.  I need your help getting funded so that I can cover my costs of printing a first run of these sketchbooks.  The Sketchbook
8.5" X 11" Perfect Bound PaperbackBlack and White interiorGlossy Full Color Cover  60 Pages full of my sketches and drawings from over the years, including many never before seen works!What I Need, and Perks!
Even though we have far exceeded our initial goal, you can still contribute and get your perks until June 4th!I would like to do an initial printing run of 300 books, which will cost
 approximately $800 to get printed via lulu.com.  Once they are printed 
they will be available on my website, www.goldenwolfen.com, and at the various art shows and conventions I attend throughout the year.I am offering a few funding tiers with perks for your contribution:
$27 - You will receive an unsigned copy of the IGG Special Edition sketchbook and a bookmark with my thanks! (International contributors add $9 for shipping).

$40 - You will receive a signed copy of the IGG Special Edition sketchbook, the bookmark, plus an 8.5" X 11" unmatted print of your choice from my website. (International contributors add $9 for shipping).
$50 - You will receive a signed copy of the IGG Special Edition sketchbook, the bookmark, an 8.5" X 11" print from my website, and an additional 8.5" X 11" print OR three Wuffies stickers.. (International contributors add $9 for shipping).
$75 - You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook, the bookmark, a matted 11" X 14" print of your choice from my website, and a t-shirt from my website.

$100 SOLD OUT!! - You will receive a signed copy of the sketchbook, an 8.5" X 11" unmatted print of your choice from my website, and a custom sketch in pencil on the inside of the sketchbook!  Two-word descriptions only, such as "Anthro Wolf", "Werewolf", "Tiger Dude", "Dragon", "Fairy", etc.  Allow an additional 6 - 8 weeks for delivery after the sketchbooks are printed. (International contributors add $9 for shipping).
$500 - You will receive a signed, IGG Special Edition copy of the sketchbook, the bookmark, and the original colored drawing "Amur Ranger" from the IGG Special Edition!  This original measures 11" X 14" and will be double matted in a ready to frame 16" X 20" mat.  It is done in pencil and watercolor on smooth Bristol paper, and -does not- include any watermarks or copyright marks.  It is signed and dated on the back.

Stretch Goal #1 - Achieved! Limited Edition Sketchbook!
The campaign has reached over $4,000, so I will do a brand new from scratch drawing and color it!  It will be featured in the center of the book and will be exclusive to a contributor-only IGG Special Edition run of the sketchbook.  Everyone that has contributed to the campaign so far will receive the IGG Special Edition Sketchbook, and it will not be available after the campaign!  The open, regular edition sketchbook will not feature this special colored piece, so if you want it, contribute now!  You have until the campaign comes to a close on June 4th to get the IGG Special Edition Sketchbook!Colored piece for the sketchbook (will not include watermarks)Stretch Goal #2 - Achieved!  Free Bookmark!
The campaign has reached over $5,000, so everyone will get this nifty bookmark for free with your sketchbook! :DOther Ways You Can HelpI understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in my sketchbook!Thanks for checking out my funding campaign!

story:
UZA is a two level interactive art car, designed to carry close to 40 passengers on many journeys throughout Burning Man. XUZA is also a mobile sound installation and will be hosting many amazing DJ's and  vocalists  at various locations around the Playa.

We are on schedule to complete this build :-) The only speed bump we are facing is the additional funds for lighting and sound.  We have been working in extreme conditions, namely the 115 degree  Las Vegas Summer days. The team has been fierce and enduring the challenge as we all want to bring XUZA to the Playa for YOU!

We already raised $7,000 out of the needed $14,000 through our fundraising efforts so far which has brought  XUZA to where she's at now! We need to raise an additional $6,500 - $7,000,  This campaign is our Hail Mary pass into the end-zone, and listing our goal at $3,500 so we get funded. If we hit the $3,500 we get funded, but still need to raise an additional $3-$3,500 to reach our budgeted goal!!

There are several aspects to this build which are extremely important to us; safety, safety, safety, and of course a jaw dropping, beautiful art car. We are not cutting corners and are building this vehicle to be structural stable as well as mechanical sound.

Your contribution will go to the following key expenses:

Your contribution will go to the following key expenses:

  • Building Materials: Tons of steel which are going to be used for the structure of the rig and ensure safe operation in the middle of this beautiful dust bowl we call home. 
  • Lighting: LED's, LED's and more LED's! Yes XUZA is a 16th century Chariot... but this 21st Century transformation needs to be far more spectacular then that Bucks Rogers buddy "Twiki" We will be investing in two short throw projectors  for the visuals on the entire side of the rig that will be used when XUZA is throwing a party. We will also be incorporating long throw UV Cannons which will illuminate the UV reactive flags as our Flag Spinners are painting the sky.
  • Sound:  Loud doesn't necessarily mean good We understand and respect our neighbors and will be doing our best to minimize "Noise" pollution. We are designing a sound system that is loud enough to engage our party attendees but won't bleed into another party halfway across the Playa and most importantly, we need a generator to run all the power on the rig.   7500w / 1.5 kw.

This campaign means so much to the entire XUZA team!! With your help you will be able to make "the vision" a reality and bring XUZA, complete with all of the bells a whistles, to the Playa this year!  Well not just bells and whistles...we're also talking  about blinky shiny things,  comfy fuzzy things, loud drummy things...and so much more.... oh, the things we have to show you!!!

Everyone please share our info throughout your network as every dollar counts!

Thank you so much and we look forward to sharing  an  EPIC experience with YOU!!!

- Mike C
"Justin Case"Contributions in the $28 Category will receive a limited edition XUZA Laser Cut Wood Pendant




Contributions in the $350 Category also receive an limited edition illuminated Pocket square from http://www.illuminatedcouture.com/


A Note From Mike:

In years past I've always had a tough time readjusting to the default world. My decompression time usually lasted a week or so. After the 2013 burn, I had no withdrawals,  I was so pumped up with excitement to begin this project and It only took a week for me to acquire the vehicle.   I remember trying to explain this "Mayan Temple" to a very close friend as I was telling her how this whole vision came to light and so I  jumped on my computer and started to do a  Google search for images.  It took some time, I mean, doing a search for "Burning Man" and "temple",  you'll get a return of 25 years of the actual Temples but very, very few of this particular art structure.  

We learned the "Mayan" Temple had a name:  "Temple of Kukulkan" and  finally found a picture, a random photographer by the name Arin Fishkin had an amazing album of images from the 2013 burnPhotographer Arin Fishkin's Burning Man 2013 Album  
I was showing the image to my friend and  began to zoom in, reminiscing and admiring the image that Miss Fishkin had captured....and that's when I received the shock of my life......  Miss Fishkin actually captured the MOMENT!!! That 30 seconds of clarity when I became one with the Playa, that moment that I had the vision.  What are the chances?  I am still blown away..... I have yet to meet Miss Fishkin, but when and if I do, big hugs and a huge thank you will be had :-)

As I was doing more research I discovered another "Are you kidding me?" moment.     I've been wanting to attend Burning man for at least 10 years prior to my eventual first burn in 2010, but there was always something that prevented me.   When I finally received a gifted ticket to the 2010 Burn I knew the life I had known would forever be changed!  
This is the first picture that was taken of me when I received my ticket "home"..happy guy huh? :

                                       

What's the Significance? Ready for this? 

The design of the 2010 Burning Man Metropolis Ticket was created by..... Yup......
Arin Fishkin!!!!! 

http://arinfishkin.com/burning_man_ticket_2010.html


......... just another "power of the Playa" moment. 

-Mike C
"Justin Case"

story:
Short Summary

We are the members of Urban Poets Society. Our youth are aspiring artists, poets, and public speakers or just community helpers of some kind. For the last 8 months we have been holding open-mics and other shows throughout the Tri-Cities and surrounding areas. 

We've been invited to Spokane, Wa by Unity in the Community (an multi-cultural arts and community event that takes place annually at River Front Park) on August 16th to perform on their main stage and accept a community honor! 

We decided to reward our core group of 16 youths by making this a 2 day summer youth retreat! 

Day 1: We will go to Silver wood theme park, then to the IMAX Theater to watch the new Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles movie, and then we will all have dinner together! We will stay the night at a hotel there in Spokane on August 15th.

Day 2: We will rise and have breakfast together. Meet for a team building activity. and then go to River Front Park for Unity in the Community. Perform on main stage and accept community honor! We will also have our own booth there at the event to promote UPS and help start a chapter there in Spokane!

Donating to this cause will create a title wave of inspiration in our community and theirs!!

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding for gas, food, hotel rooms, Silver wood tickets, and IMAX Theater tickets for 16 youths and 4 chaperones.

We are organizing 4 car washes and selling t shirts to make this happen! 

Here is the breakdown of expenses:

4 cars to transport 20 people: $290.00

KOA Campsite for 20 people on night 1: $100.00 (granted)

Lunch for 20 people at Timber Creek Buffet on August 15th. 200.00

Dinner for 20 people for the night of August 15th: $180.00 (granted)

Silver wood group tickets: $440.00

IMAX Theater tickets for 20 people: $300.00 (granted!)

Pop corn, snack and drink allowance: $200.00 

Here are the perks!

$15 gets you a car wash! (dates will be announced, only available to locals)

$25 gets you a Urban Poets Society shirt with the logo on front, creed on back!

$25 gets you an I am a Poet shirt with logo on the front!

$100 gets you the car wash, Urban Poets Society shirt, and a bottle of wine from my friend Andy Perdue! (only available to locals due to shipping of wine laws)

This campaign will run until July 31st. Extra funds that we receive will go towards Urban Poets Society promotional materials and equipment to enhance our shows and our message! 

*We have already received a $100 donation and $300 for our IMAX movie tickets so we only have $1900 more dollars to go!! 

The Impact

Our youth are aspiring artist, poets, and public speakers or just community helpers of some kind. Most of them really never go on summer vacations let alone to be honored for their efforts in the arts and community. Needless to say this experience will enhance their lives tremendously and create a title wave of inspiration in our community as well as Spokane's community! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everybody is in a position to donate but you can still help by helping us spread the word! Please share this fundraiser on all of your social media networks to help us make this happen!! Thank you so much!!

    Urban Poets Society

story:
SUMMARY

Frog Wing is installing an 8-foot tall Molecule-orb in Jixiang Village!

You can participate by contributing to this fundraiser, or passing it along to others who might be interested!

————————————

MORE INFO:

Dodecahedrons have long been considered symbols of the Universe and depictions of the Divine, by various nations and cultures all over the world. 

Lijiang Dongba identify Frog’s dodecahedral Molecule-Orbs as meditation tools that connect and resonate with higher realms. Pentagonal faces recall the five elements, while twelve faces reference the signs of the Zodiac. The Orbs also symbolize blessing and protection, bestowed from the giver and onto the receiver. 

The installation of a large dodecahedron in Jixiang Village takes form as a gift- from Frog, WuZhimi and supporting Dongba, and all those who donate to the cause. Rather than gifting individuals with singular molecule-orbs each, installing a large-scale dodecahedron allows all villagers and passersby to contemplate and enjoy the beauty of this particular platonic solid, up-close and in-person. 

We plan to hold a community Opening Event after the Orb is finished- tentatively synchronized to Summer Solstice (June 21st). Accompanying installation, three local Dongba shaman-priests will be present to conduct a blessing ritual for Lashihai lake valley and Jixiang Village (recipients of the Orb).

After the ritual is complete, the Jixiang Orb and its installation will be archived as Dongba-endorsed object and ritual event. A steel placard bolted into a cement base features short prayer inscribed in English, Chinese, and Naxi Dongba pictograms. This serves to bring Lashihai and Jixiang Village good luck and fortune in the future, as well as ward off malevolent spirits.

———————

Impact

The Jixiang Orb is a large-scale steel sculpture. Dongba intention suggests that it also provides blessing and protection for its receivers. We hope that these intentions will eventually manifest in tangible, valuable ways.

In the past decade, outside developers have constantly sought to profit off Lashihai’s natural resources. After seizing acres of land from local farmers with little-to-no compensation in return, government-approved operations move in and capitalize with get-rich-quick schemes. Following the awkward peach fields (2006-2008), there have been plans to raze the villages and turn them into golf courses (2009: thankfully canceled), construction of a luxury resort by the lakeside (2012), and most recently, the development of an entire horse-racing track as a short-term scam operation (2015). 

Dongba practice continues on today in Lijiang, as living proof of their ancient heritage. Although the Naxi peoples in Lashihai may have lost their Dongba traditions since the Cultural Revolution, others in the hills and mountainous areas have retained it; They now bring it back to the cities in a renewed, modern effort of preservation. Dongba culture is evolving with its peoples, adapting to Lijiang’s globalized climate. Participation of local Dongba priests in the installation of the Jixiang Orb promotes Dongba religion returning to Lashihai through an officially sanctionable activity, as well as leaving lasting physical proof for future reference. Crowdsourced funding online adds an extra element of connectivity- It highlights that local people have community support that extends beyond the geographical boundaries of Lashihai lake valley. This can be valuable as leverage for commercial and political exchanges in the future. 

So, in addition to raising funds for the construction of a giant holy steel ball, you will be contributing your vote to protect Lashihai lake valley and its inhabitants from potential future bullying by corporate entities, foreign investors, government developers and the like.

And yes, you will also be helping to build a really big version of those little molecule-orbs! By expanding the scale and scope by which pieces are made, Frog is adding new connections and skills to the toolbox- gifts that will be retained and translated in an artist's overall career.

When finished, the Jixiang Village Orb becomes a repository of energy. Its presence serves as a physical representation of group support for community cooperation, empowerment for farming populations and indigenous tribes, and the belief that global friendships can strengthen and empower communities on a grassroots level. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $1600 to fund the complete operation, and this is how funds will be distributed:

$1000: cost of materials, labor, transportation, and installment of the orb, its base, and final placard

$200: to host a community gathering and invite local Dongba for blessing/ protection ritual on Opening Day

$200: to seek official recognition and endorsement from Lijiang organizations and groups (such as the Dongba Research Institute), as an effort to protect Lashihai and its land from foreign developers and commercial investors in the future

$200: to cover fees, materials/ labor for perks, shipping/handling, and miscellany (such as transportation costs and other human needs that arise during the project duration)

——————————

In exchange for your donation, you receive a postcard of thanks in the mail, and your name added to the list of contributors. List of names will appear on a permanent plate at base of Orb (optional), and possibly in future events that this piece is referenced in (at least one coming up later this year, in NYC). 

If you donate more than $10, you will also receive other tokens of appreciation, in the form of art objects made by Frog Wing (/Wu Zhimi). 

——————————————————

Other Ways You Can Help

Please forward this campaign to others who might want to support Jixiang Village, Dongba culture, Lijiang Studio projects, and/ or Frog Wing’s work! Thank you!

——————————
In exchange for your donation, you receive a postcard of thanks in the mail, and your name added to the list of contributors. List of names will appear on a permanent plate at base of Orb (optional), and possibly in future events that this piece is referenced in (at least one coming up later this year, in NYC). 
If you donate more than $10, you will also receive other tokens of appreciation, in the form of art objects made by Frog Wing (/Wu Zhimi). 
——————————————————
Other Ways You Can Help
Please forward this campaign to others who might want to support Jixiang Village, Dongba culture, Lijiang Studio projects, and/ or Frog Wing’s work! Thank you!

story:
Who we are...

s+s project©, founded 2009, is a non-profit, nomadic cultural space located in Chicago, IL that exhibits the work of non-conventional, often marginalized communities in select alternative spaces.

We are working artists and curators creating exhibitions with the support of individual donors and patrons, but mostly with the financial support of a small, artist-led curatorial board that is at the core of s+s project.

We are artists, teachers, food servers, bartenders, retail associates, mechanics, office assistants, nannies and people that work in alternative economies...pretty much all in the same boat that seek opportunities to create rich, meaningful cultural exchange outside of standard academic practices or corporate influences.

We want to lead by example and demonstrate to Chicago and beyond that a self-produced, alternative exhibition model is one still to be valued.

Your donation to HOMOCCULT 2.0 - MEXICO CITY will help strengthen this mission and help us continue this dialogue in a new context.


Director- Sofia Moreno, www.sofiamoreno.com
Curator- Jonathan Sommer, www.jonathansommer.com


www.ssproject.org


Project Summary...

s+s project©  presents “HOMOCCULT 2.0 MEXICO CITY”, a group exhibition of international artists engaging in queer interpretations of majick, ritual and the occult through visual, video and performance practices. 

In this it’s second iteration, “HOMOCCULT 2.0 MEXICO CITY” provides an exhibition again anchored by a group of queer experimental films curated by NYC artist Daniel McKernan.

This time, in conjunction with a curated selection of visual and performance art from both American and Mexican contemporary artists, s+s project seeks to provide a distinct platform for a collaborative understanding of American and Mexican expressions of queer and the occult by exhibiting at:

ARTSPACE MEXICO


and
Fundación del Centro Cultural del México Contemporáneo


Two nights of private screenings of McKernan’s curated short films “HOMOCCULT & OTHER ESOTEROTICA - VOLUME 1 & 2” will be aligned with an exhibition of visual and performance- based artwork curated by Jonathan Sommer & Sofia Moreno of s+s Project (CHICAGO) and Antonio Zaragoza of Perras De Museo (MEX).

“HOMOCCULT 2.0 MEXICO CITY” seeks to establish a dialogue between physically distant, but intellectually similar art practices of select artists to produce a formidable international voice for queer artists working in themes of majick, ritual and the occult.

Click the link below for the official HOMOCCULT & OTHER ESOTEROTICA trailer:
https://vimeo.com/38449832


The Artists...

Performance - Mexico City
Erika Bulle
Nadia Granados
Perras de Museo
Felipe Osornio Lechedevirgen Trimegisto


Performances - US
ANTIBODY (Adam Rose + April Lynn) (CHI)
Efren Arcoiris (CHI)
Rosé Hernandez (CHI)
Keijaun Thomas (NYC)
Caleb Yono (CHI)
Sara Zalek (CHI)


Visual - Mexico City
Asher Asher
Aldo Dowerman
Cristhian Diaz
Mipanocha Rurru 
Fabian Chairez
Tania Chavez
Tsade Trigo
Felix d'Eon
Medusczka Gorgona

Visual - U.S. + Abroad
Parker Bright (CHI)
Elijah Burgher (Berlin)
Jos Howard Demme (CHI)
Serena Jara (NYC)
David Nasca (CHI)
Erik Peterson (CHI)
Daniel McKernan (NYC)
Orlando Estrada (NYC)
Meg McCarville (CHI)
Armando Lozano (CHI)


The Budget...


In Three Parts...AIRFARE, ACCOMMODATIONS, OPERATIONS:

  • PAY FOR AIRFARE for FOUR ARTISTS ($2,000) to travel, perform and stay in Mexico City that would otherwise not be able to contribute their performance work in the exhibition "HOMOCCULT 2.0 - MEXICO CITY".

    • Approximately three Chicago-based performance artists and one NYC-based performance artist will be participating in this exhibition and traveling to Mexico City in June 2016, but need to be funded!

      • Chicago artists: Rosê Hernandez, Efren Arcoiris, Caleb Yono
      • NYC-based artist: Keijaun Thomas


  • PAY FOR ACCOMMODATIONS ($750) for artists arriving in Mexico City as early as June 6, 2016 and leaving as late as June 30, 2016.
    • Artists will utilize this time to install work/perform their work for HOMOCCULT 2.0 exhibition openings on June 9,10 & 11 at Fundación del Centro Cultural del México Contemporáneo and June 16, 17 & 18 at ARTSPACE MEXICO.
    • We have a really beautiful, large Air bnb reserved that will comfortably sleep all traveling artists and need your help to finish funding.


  • SUPPORT ADDITIONAL OPERATIONAL COSTS ($250) that include
    • Professional photo + video documentation of the exhibition at both locations.
    •  Administrative exhibition support.
    •  And a modest "Sick Day" budget in the event of unforeseen health issues that arise while traveling in Mexico.



    Risks & Challenges

    s+s project is part curatorial endeavor/part performance art practice that resists popularly accepted ideas of art-making found within the canon of art history.  We want more than what history has told us to be "good art". We seek to build the art world we want to live in and be accepted by.  s+s project believes this is attainable only by engaging in risks and creating new challenges.

    We find it essential to share the experimental work of artists from the U.S. and Mexico and view HOMOCCULT 2.0 - MEXICO CITY to be an elemental site for production of new dialogues with performance art.

    Previous s+s project exhibitions are testament to our DIY curatorial methodologies and artist-led approaches that some may interpret as unorthodox, but what we confidently identify as culturally necessary.

    Past collaborators become quick friends and family that we welcome and continue to work with for successful future projects.

    Besos & Gracias
    <3
    s+s project


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Don't miss our fundraiser party "MALA NOCHE"!!! This April, 22nd in collaboration with TRQPiTECA!!! 21+. see details below.


    VIDEO SCREENING PARTY OPENING (7PM-9PM) WITH B!TCH3Z DRINKING PROJECT SPECIALTY COCKTAIL + JUNIOR'S SPECIALS.

    TRQPiTECA (9PM-2AM) + PERFORMANCES LATE (START 12AM) WITH A$$PUSSY + BON BON + SPECIAL GUEST ZEMMOA (CDMX)!!!

    DJ'S CQQCHiFRUIT + La SPACER PROVIDING THEM SOUNDS TO MAKE YA PUSSY POP, DROP/ LICK IT DON'T STOP!

    FINE ART RAFFLE (PARTICIPATING ARTISTS FROM HOMOCCULT 2.0 GRACIOUSLY PROVIDING WORK) THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT!
    $2 per ticket
    $6 for 4 tickets
    $10 for 6 tickets

    Where:
    Junior's Sports Bar 2058 W Cermak, Pilsen, Chicago
    When:
    7pm-9pm "MALA NOCHE" curated video art screening by s+s project
    9pm-2am "MALA NOCHE x TRQPiTECA" with performances by A$$PUSSY + BON BON and SPECIAL GUEST ZEMMOA (CDMX)!!!

    How Much Is It:
    $5 suggested donation - grants you admission IS DA TRQPiTECA STANDARD :)
    $10 suggested donation - grants you admission + tequila shot 
    $15 suggested donation - grants you admission + tequila shot + three raffle tickets

    What is "TRQPiTECA"?:
    T R Q P i T E C A

    The oasis at the crossroads between paradise and the underground. TRQPiTECA celebrates the natural evolution of House & Techno grooves with Florida's Bass, Tropical Percussion, and a splash of Island Rhythms!

    Every last FRIDAY of every month at Junior's in Pilsen, Chicago we lovingly curate live performances, video art, and booty shaking music by local and international artists werQing with TRQPiCaL aesthetics.

    Since January 2015, TRQPiTECA is a night that celebrates the dance music of tropical cultures, and is also an intentional space for rhythm loving creatures of all expressions to come together on the South of Side of Chicago. PLZ COME PREPARED TO RESPECT THA SPACE, RESPECT EACH OTHER, AND MOVE YOUR BODY-SOUL!!!

story:
Why This OR That

We are traveling across the US and next the globe to raise awareness for Off The Wall Graffiti, collaborate live with local artists and to film artists in conversation about their This OR Thats with local student filmmakers. It's a happening, a charity and a movie.

WHY This or That?

I raised two children, now 21 and 19. I gave them everything equally just like all parents. But one just kept messing up. Now she may have absolutely needed to mess up because that is what she agreed to do in her life, well before she was born - another blog post - but what has come up since her misbehaviors is far too compelling and far too common for me to ignore. She was hiding things that had happened to her and shaming herself for them by misbehaving. Throwing her self under the bus, only she did it in very active ways.

What also kept coming up were people who wanted me to punish her for any wrong doings. She would act out and get in trouble. A lot. Of course she was in therapy, of course our family life was all over the map for it. But what never felt right was punishing her for her out bursts.

I could see her pain but I didn’t have access to it and she WAS being punished. Both by the unwitting consequences of her actions at school, or her broken friendships. Why would I add grounding to that to “teach her a lesson?”

The whole dynamic of this cause and effect/damnation never seemed to work. ANYWHERE. The spiral of self-destruction would quicken perhaps but not disappear.

We have heard - channel that aggression - channel your energies - channel your words into positive - work it out. These things do give way for a shift in behavior, but it wouldn’t stop it.

Fundamentally, stopping the punishment and starting the listening right when the THATs start to happen, that might stop something. 

If the punishments stop but the listening starts - a paradigm would shift.

I don’t know why people create but I do assert that we are all creative. We are all expressive beings. We all work inside a creative context and when that creative context is blocked or told no or directed negatively, our natural flow of expression gets gnarled up and redirected, over flowed and pushed out of us. Then we get punished.

Maybe if we hear about that happening on a global scale and get to hear and see the consequences of THAT and the beauty of THIS… we will have a deeper understanding to misbehavior and the beginnings of listening.

We would hear - “mommy, he touched me here.” We would hear - “that big brother you had me sign up for is drinking at the park.” We would hear - “my sister scratched me because I took her drink, but she pushed me the other day and embarrassed me in front of my friends.” Real cuts to the core stuff that if heard, we might create a context for self-expression that doesn’t get gnarled, but flows. And art gets made, more and more and more.

Thanks, Maura

offthewallgraffiti@gmail.com

story:
Middletown Art Center will be a vibrant cultural hub that integrates art education, art exhibition, and cultural enrichment in central Middletown – the Gateway to Lake County.

MAC will fill a need for art and culture in a rural county that is lacking in such opportunities for residents and artists alike. It will provide a unique cultural environment in which people of all ages, abilities, and levels of artistic experience can feel free to imagine, express, create, and welcome the visual arts into their lives. Through art, MAC will enhance participants' creative, intellectual and personal growth and sense of well-being.  It will contribute to sustainable cultural and economic development in our region and promote engagement and investment in our small towns, our businesses and our communities – so that together, we thrive!

Art Resource: The Center will be an art resource for community members and artists.  We will offer a broad range of art classes, workshops, events and activities for all ages - children, teens, students, adults & seniors - in a variety of media from traditional to digital. Teaching and exhibition opportunities as well as professional services such as portfolio review, consulting and marketing will be available to artists. For membership info please visit our website.

Location:  MAC is located at the junction of Hwys 175 and 29, in a 2400 sq ft interior space requiring renovation. It will become exhibition space in the front, and education space in the back. The lot adjacent to the road will be beautified and showcase outdoor sculptures, providing an energized and attractive cornerstone for our community.

Premiere ~ Opening Reception 3/28/15

Your contribution will help us make this vision a sustainable reality! We are looking to generate capital to renovate and prepare our gallery and classroom space for opening. To close our funding gap we need to raise $10,000. This will fund:

  • $ 800 - Patch walls Funded through this campaign!
  • $ 900 - Floor revitalization: patch, sand, stain, seal
  • $1200 - Paint walls, ceiling   Donated!
  • $4500 - Lighting  - gallery LED system + classroom lighting
  • $ 300 - Revitalize restroom
  • $ 700 - Doors 
  • $ 550 - Security System (setup)
  • $ 450 -  Utilities start up (electricity, phone, internet) Funded here!
  • $ 600 - Insurance (first 2 months)
       $10,000 - total 

We are trying to match funds raised offline that will be used for other start up costs like furniture, and rent. Won't you please give us a hand?

Additional donations will be used towards funding other improvements such as an energy efficient heating/cooling system.

Your help at work!

Below: The space in process! Big Thanks to indiegogo donors for funding drywall, to Stephen Hebert Painting for donating crew, and to Richner Painting for donating low VOC paint!

 Now!


The facade has been painted too! Thanks to Stephen Hebert Painting and crew and your donations towards materials!


Who is behind this exciting new community and culture venture?

Six Fine Art professionals are working hard, dedicating their talents and time to open MAC at the end of March 2015 – John Hanses, Lisa Kaplan, Kristina Della Valle, Renata Jaworska, Sariah Reeser, and Francesco Cafiso. Learn more about each of us in the Team section.

Your donation is tax deductible! Middletown Art Center is a sponsored project of EcoArts of Lake County, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the visual arts, visual art education, and ecological stewardship for artists, residents, and visitors to Lake County, CA. Learn more here! Rest assured, as a non-profit we will receive funds contributed even if we do not meet our target goal.

MAC will become the vibrant cultural gem it is designed to be with your support! Through YOUR giving, together with the generosity of friends, family, community and random acts of kindness, Middletown Art Center will flourish!

Please share this wonderful project with others! All contributions large or small go far to help Middletown Art Center significantly expand the art and cultural life of beautiful Lake County! 


What do the art perks look like?

Digital Prints or Art Card.
If you have an image preference, please specify at checkout or email us at MiddletownArtCenter@gmail.com with your choice.  Thank you!

Postcard ($10 level)
5 x 7 Art card ($20 - $25 level)
Digital Print 8.5 x 11 ($50 level)  11 x 14,   ($100-up levels)

1. Sariah Reeser - Frozen


2. Sariah Reeser - California Winter Rose, or 'Solidarity'


3. Lisa Kaplan - Planting

(Mud and digital painting available as digital print)



Numbered etchings 11 x 14, by Renata Jaworska (8 available @$350 level)             Please specify your choice by number when you check out



Sculptural Object by Renata Jaworska
($1000 - $5000 level)



Limited Edition prints by John Hanses
15 available of each image in each size
Please specify your choice by name when you check out
($500 11 x 14 - $1000 20 x 24 - $5000 30 x 40)

  

China Camp


    

Lost Coast


                                      

Shinto Shrine, Kyoto, Japan


THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT!

story:
Short Summary

Seesaw Theatre was founded under the name "Theatre Stands with Autism" in 2012 by Northwestern University seniors Melanie Gertzman and Anna Marr. TSWA was founded with the belief that theatre is a basic human right and denying anyone access because of ability status is unacceptable. Rather than merely accommodating audiences with special needs, Seesaw Theatre produces multi-sensory theatrical experiences for small audiences where each guest is accompanied by their own "adventure guide" who plays with them throughout the production, creating an individualized experience.

What We Need & What You Get

We invite families and school groups to our shows free of charge which is why we look to donors to help support the costs of creating our productions. Help support the costs of creating our productions. This can include up to $4000 per production for lights, set materials, costumes, props, sound, PR, and advertising so we can put on the best show we can for as many people as possible! Additionally, we spend up to $1000 per year bringing programming to various local organizations.

The Impact

At Seesaw Theatre we believe that theatre should be more than just sitting in your seat watching actors have all of the fun. Over the past two years we have invited more than 60 adventurers and their families to come into a whole new world where you can see, hear, smell and feel every detail. We do this by devising a multi-sensory theatrical experience where getting up and joining in isn't just allowed, it's encouraged.

We do this by devising a multi-sensory theatrical experience where getting up and joining in isn't just allowed, it's encouraged.

story:
There are two things that make me very happy in life: creating art and helping people out.

Art for Good - an idea that promotes access to original art for EVERYONE (something I strongly believe in) - combines both. It brings quality art to low income homes, while allowing a dedicated artist (me) fulfill her mission of creating work that is meaningful and inspired.

In thinking about the project, a natural place to launch seems with families moving into Habitat for Humanity houses. I've learned that Fort Collins Habitat for Humanity will be building four houses in 2014. I plan to create a piece of art for each of the four families. I am in no way, shape or form, affiliated with the organization, but feel that starting with these homeowners is a great fit for getting this project off the ground. 

 

Everyone deserves access to art! Help me bring happiness to these families while also supporting the work of the artist. If this project is successful, I hope to expand on the idea in the future, reaching out to other organizations and people who might benefit.

How your money helps

  • The $900 raised will go toward covering my supplies, time spent interviewing families, a reduced price cost for my work and the cost for donor recognition paintings and rewards (see details in perks categories.) 
  • Your support of this project benefits families in the Fort Collins community as well as the arts. 
  • If my goal is not reached, your money will be refunded. Funds will be collected through Paypal, but you do not need a Paypal account to give and can sign in as a guest.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to support this program, let people know that you think it is a worthy cause by sharing this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Thank you!

I am not affiliated with Habitat, therefore your contribution is not tax deductible as it is not directly supporting Habitat or its core programming.

 

micahrichardson.com

Micah's Facebook Page

story:
The Richmond Tarot Project is a photographic exploration and reinterpretation of the Tarot deck. Tarot cards have been used in divination since the mid-1700s and continue to this day to have strong cultural (and counter-cultural) significance. In fact, throughout their history the Tarot deck has enjoyed acceptance in a variety of communities from occultists, gypsies, and Freemasons to academics, Protestant clerics, and Catholic-Italian grandmas.

 

 

Because they represent archetypes of the human experience, the twenty-two Major Arcana ("Greater Secrets") of the deck were selected as our framework. And because one of us just returned to Richmond after living for a while in New York City and is really feeling the RVA love, we decided to shoot in iconic Richmond locations using only Richmonders as models. Over the past three months, we have cast, designed, shot, and edited over half of these cards. You can see the first seven online here.

We're so happy and honored to have been asked to show the final project at Gallery5 in October, with the opening reception taking place (First) Friday, October 4th!

This is where you come in. We're raising this money to help offset the cost of printing each of the final pieces at the size and quality that would do them justice. We will also be using some of the funds to purchase props, costumes, backgrounds, and other materials for use in the final cards that we're shooting in the coming weeks.

We never would have had the courage to start this project or even see ourselves as artists if it wasn't for our friends and community. Thank you all so much for your support and love throughout this--and we'll see you October 4th!


Warm wishes to all of you,

Carly (Photographer) & Emaleigh (Art Director)

story:
The Nashville Rollergirls Are...

Currently ranked #33 worldwide by the Women's Flat Track Derby Association (WFTDA), the Nashville Rollergirls All Stars are heading to Asheville, NC in just a few short weeks for WFTDA Division One Playoffs... but we need your help to get there! If you missed the silent auction at our August 17 game at Municipal Auditorium, you still have a chance to support your favorite rollergirls. 

How Much Could It Cost To Play Roller Derby Anyway?

The Nashville Rollergirls are an all-volunteer, skater-run 501(c)3 non-profit organization, and skaters have to pay out of pocket to play and travel. Roller derby is an expensive sport! Did you know that it costs:

  • $100 for each skater to get a set of blue and white team jerseys
  • $50 for a shiny team helmet painted in NRG blue
  • Anywhere from $300-500 per person to travel to each game out of state

Not to mention, every skater pays more than $400 in dues each year to help keep the lights on in our practice space, and a full set of skates, knee pads, elbow pads, wrist guards, mouth guard, wheels and bearings can add up to over $700 per skater. The expenses definitely don't stop there, but you get the idea!

How Can I Help Out?

Donations of ANY size are appreciated, and we have some special perks lined up for donations of $25 or more. 

  • Donate ANY amount and receive our undying love and support for all time! 
  • Donate $10 and receive a shout-out on our Facebook and NashvilleRollergirls.com
  • Donate $25 and receive everything above, plus two NRG stickers and a koozie
  • Donate $50 and receive everything above, plus a ticket voucher good for admission to any single game in 2014 at Municipal Auditorium (dates still TBD)
  • Donate $100 and receive everything above, plus an autographed All Star team photo
  • Donate $250 and receive everything above, plus a limited edition 2013 season ticketholder t-shirt
  • Donate $500 and receive everything above, plus a 2014 season ticket
With your help, the All Stars will dominate the competition in Asheville!

story:
WHAT ARE WE BUILDING

The project includes a 12 foot archway that will serve as the entrance to our camp. It incorporates 36 handmade hearts, all cast from a master mold.  Each one is a uniquely decorated by different members of our community. The hearts will be portable and when they are home, they will illuminate the walkway into our camp. Their lights will slowly pulse to the beat of a human heart.  Our piece of art will create a transition from the greater Burning Man community and to the intimate community of Afterglow that we are known for.

When the hearts are removed from the pathway, they are mounted on our bicycles. When we go out as a group, we can travel through the playa and the streets of Burning Man together, guided by our beating hearts and moving through the Playa emanating the message that we can all spread love.

WHY HEARTS

We're making art with hearts. Not the kind of hearts you see on a Valentine's day card, but real anatomical hearts.  To us, the anatomical heart symbolizes the love and vitality of our community, the “blood & guts.”  It is the most important organ of the body.  Its beat keeps rhythm for the rich, complicated friendships between the people in the community. This is why our camp’s symbol has become the anatomical heart.  And of course, it was our beautiful community of friends and family that inspired this art project!

WHO WE ARE

Camp Afterglow is a group of friends and family from the Berkeley area who come together to enjoy music, performances, social activism, and body movement and play.  Since 2010, we have brought the same joys to share at Burning Man.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

  • The playa has limited resources.  That is why we will be constructing the arch at home first. Then we will partially disassemble it for shipping.
  • Electronics and playa don’t mix. The dust in the desert is notorious for shorting out electronic circuits. Throw desert heat on top of that and you have a recipe for disaster. With 36 individual hand-made circuit boards, it is inevitable some of them will fail at some point. As a safeguard, we will build spare components.

One of the great things about this particular project is its ability to expand and contract while still maintaining the integrity of our original vision. If we do not reach our funding goals we will still have beautiful hearts that light up, but may have to abandon the programmable realistic heartbeat.  Also, depending on funding, we may or may not be able to fully illuminate the archway.  There are many different levels of awesomeness we can achieve for this project and it will all depend on your generous donations.

EXPENSES:

HEARTS

Casting materials $600

PVC $150

Mounting brackets $50

Lights and components $600

Total for hearts $1400

 

ARCH AND PATH

Plywood $200

2x4 $150

Hardware $50

Lights $200

Total for arch $600

 

PROJECT TOTAL EXPENSES $2000

What we are asking for will be enough to fund the root elements of our vision - the arch, the hearts, lights and electronic components. We are not including labor, shipping and transportation expenses. But if we receive more funding, we will be able to expand our vision and improve upon the project with more advanced (and, of course, higher quality) energy efficient lighting, sound elements, rechargeable batteries and power generator.

story:
Hello!

My name is Sarah Duyer and I am a ceramic artist and illustrator based in San Francisco, CA. 

I was fortunate enough to be offered a work-study scholarship to attend a workshop at Penland School of Craft this summer where I will be taking a 2-week class on ceramic surface design. While the scholarship is very generous and covers my room and board and part of my tuition it will still be difficult for me to afford the remaining costs. 

In the 10 years that I've been working in clay I've had many teachers and mentors tell me about their time at Penland and every one has expressed just how transformational and influential their experience was on their work. Since graduating from the University of Delaware with my BFA in 2012 I have continued to develop my own artistic style and gain experience in a variety of different studio settings. I feel I would greatly benefit from being back in a classroom and building on the knowledge and experience I have and am excited to learn new skills and meet other artists who share my love of clay.

 

What We Need & What You Get

While the work-study scholarship does cover a significant amount of the cost to attend I need help raising the rest. I am responsible for covering the rest of my tuition and travel expenses and taking into account that I would need to miss two weeks of work (without paid time off) the financial burden is more than I can comfortably cover on my own. 

My estimated expenses for this project are:

  • Tuition: $650
  • Travel: $900
  • Materials and production costs: $500

In addition to the direct costs of attending I have to consider the loss of income for 2 weeks (from both my day job and my own small business) and the cost of covering home and studio rent while I'm away. 

Instead of creating a page for donations I wanted to have handmade rewards available for those who help me fund my trip!

Here are some of the rewards that I am offering:

  • Sticker sheet with 7 die-cut stickers 
  • "Cute Butt" trophy enamel pin
  • Ceramic trophy or pot magnets 
  • Custom ceramic trophies (available in small and large)
  • Custom ceramic lighting

 

For pictures and details of each reward tier check out the sidebar.

The Impact

From what former Penland students have told me attending a workshop is an invaluable experience for an artist at any point in their career. I see ceramics as a lifelong learning experience and, while I have worked in clay for nearly a decade, there are so many aspects of the medium I have yet to explore. 

In the workshop that I'l be attending I will be learning new techniques for surface design and gain experience in firing a salt kiln. I have been developing my work on my own since graduating but I am excited to be a student again and be able to incorporate what I learn at Penland into my own studio practice. 

Risks & Challenges

I have already paid my deposit for the workshop so I am 100% committed to attending Penland! I would have attended with or without your help but contributing to this campaign would help prevent me from taking on more debt.

I have a dedicated studio space in San Francisco and shouldn't have a problem fulfilling all the reward tiers, though the custom ceramic pieces will likely take longer to complete. Sticker sheets have already been made and production time on enamel pins is only a few weeks so those items would likely ship soon after the campaign ends. Ceramic pieces will likely ship 1-3 months after my Penland session, depending on the complexity and my workload between now and then.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to support my work I do have an online store and Etsy. I am also open to commissioned works, if you have an idea for a custom piece you'd like to discuss you can email me at info@sarahduyer.com.

If you are unable to support me financially telling people about this campaign and my work helps a lot. You can share this page via social media or just tell your friends!

 

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Notre quotidien est envahi par les nouvelles technologies. Nous sommes distraits par nos smartphones et nous en oublions parfois notre environnement, intérieur et extérieur. En dépit des aspects positifs et des progrès indéniables générés par ces outils de communication, nous ne pouvons ignorer les conséquences négatives. Nous avons décidé de travailler sur la “surabondance” d’information, la distraction et l’isolation sociale.

AloneTogether est une production en soirée qui tente d'explorer et de repenser la relation entre la technologie et l'humanité en utilisant de multiples formes d'art. A travers la danse et le corps nous souhaitons mettre en opposition: la surabondance d’information, la distraction, et l’isolation sociale provoquées par les nouvelles technologies et l’Homme connecté à son environnement, à la nature et à lui- même. Cette performance artistique sera accompagnée de street art et de musique live.

We increasingly often walk through this world with our heads down, immersed in a technological realm and increasingly disregarding our (real and immediate) surrounding. We fall prey to the illusion of companionship, gathering thousands of Twitter and Facebook friends, and confusing tweets and wall posts with authentic communication. But this relentless connection leads to a deep solitude.AloneTogether is an evening filling production that tries to explore and rethink the relationship between technology and humanity in using multiple artistic art forms. Through dance, street art, and live music the production will point out the opposition between overabundance of information, distraction, and social isolation caused by new technologies and the human being connected to his environment, to nature and to himself.
 

         WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Pour financer cette production artistique significative et innovante, notre objectif est de récolter 1000 €. En décidant de devenir donateur de AloneTogether, votre contribution soutiendra directement le financement de la réalisation artistique. Comme l'indique le graphique ci-dessous, votre don facilite et assure les cachets des artistes, les locaux de répétition, la location de salles, la communication et les tentatives de diffusion. Quelle que soit l'ampleur de votre contribution, elle sera dépensée avec soin pour faire une différence significative dans cette production et pour toutes les personnes impliquées.

To fund this meaningful and innovative artistic production we aim to raise €1000. By deciding to become a donor of AloneTogether, your contribution will directly support the financing of the artistic realization. As the graph below indicates, your donation facilitates and ensures artists fees, rehearsal space, venue rental and communication, and outreach attempts. No matter the scope of your contribution, it will be spent with care to make a meaningful difference to this production and all involved.

 

En guise de récompense pour votre soutien, nous avons préparé des avantages vraiment intéressants pour chaque niveau de contribution. Il s'agit notamment d'un wallpaper de téléphone surprise, de billets pour le spectacle lui-même, d'une série limitée d'un jeu de cartes postales et d'un tote bag. Et, bien sûr, nous remercierons tous avec respect et nos meilleurs vœux !

As a reward for your support, we prepared some really great perks for every level of contribution. These include a surprised wallpaper, tickets to the performance itself, a limited series of a postcard set and a tote bag. And, surely, we will thank each and everyone with respect and our best wishes!

SOME OF OUR ARTIST

Nos danseurs: Marion Agosta et Frédéric Jean-Baptiste

Frédéric Jean-Baptiste a commencé la danse à 22 ans. Ce n'est qu'après deux années de cours intensifs, qu'il intègrera la Comédie Musicale "Roméo et Juliette " en 2000 et qu'il fit son entrée dans le monde du Spectacle. De fil en aiguilles, Frédéric travaillera à la télévision avec REDHA, Mia FRYE, Bruno VANDELLI, Laura TREVES, Bill GOODSON, HI-HAT pour ne citer qu'eux.
Diplômé d'Etat en danse jazz (2003), Frédéric se découvre une réelle passion pour l'enseignement. Il enseigne le Jazz depuis 10 ans aujourd'hui. Jazz qu'il définit et qu'il nourrit avec les danses "urbaines" comme "New-Jazz". Car, il garde l'énergie et la technique "jazz" en l'enrichissant" d'influences street jazz, de Voguing, de Newstyle et de Hip hop ,le tout .... avec du travail de sol, qu'il affectionne tout particulièrement.

https://www.instagram.com/fredericjeanbaptiste/
www.fredjeanbaptiste.com

Marion Agosta est une danseuse professionelle aux influences moderne et street jazz. Elle aime s'enrichir de nouveaux styles et explorer divers univers.

https://www.instagram.com/marion_ag/

Our dancers: Marion Agosta and Frédéric Jean-Baptiste

Frédéric Jean-Baptiste started dancing at the age of 22. It was only after two years of intensive courses that he joined the "Romeo and Juliet" Musical Comedy in 2000 and made his entry into the world of the Show. From needle to needle, Frederic will work on television with REDHA, Mia FRYE, Bruno VANDELLI, Laura TREVES, Bill GOODSON, HI-HAT to name but a few.
As a graduate of the State Diploma in Jazz Dance (2003), Frédéric discovered a real passion for teaching. He has been teaching Jazz for 10 years now. Jazz that he defines and nourishes with "urban" dances like "New-Jazz". Because, he keeps the energy and technique "jazz" by enriching it" with street jazz, Voguing, Newstyle and Hip-hop influences... all with soil work, which he particularly likes.

https://www.instagram.com/fredericjeanbaptiste/
www.fredjeanbaptiste.com


BUST the DRIP est un artiste français issu de l’univers de la danse. Formé au hip hop, il fait partie du groupe Fush Wong.
Ce sont les vibrations de la musique qui l’animent. Recréant le mouvement des corps, il associe le geste à la projection de peinture. Inspiré autant par Pollock, que par Mode2, sa manière de peindre est extrêmement gestuelle, énergique ; à la fois technique et instinctive. Ses compositions mêlent spray, acrylique, crayon... Il parle de sa peinture comme d’une chorégraphie de traits et de traces. La couleur prend forme, les fréquences dessinées donnent le rythme. Calé sur ses vibrations, l’artiste renvoie son tempo sur son support.
https://www.instagram.com/bust_the_drip/

WHEN? WHERE?

La Bellevilloise, 19-21 Rue Boyer, 75020 Paris.

27/10/2018, start at 19:00 PM.

 

WHO ARE WE?

Nous sommes quatre étudiantes en MBA Arts and Cultural Management au sein de l’IESA arts & culture et de PSB (Paris School of Business). Nées autour des années 90, nous avons été directement impactées par la révolution numérique et l’essor des nouvelles technologies. De ce fait, nous avons été spectatrices de l’impact des nouvelles technologies sur nos vies sociales et nous avons décidé d’aborder ce sujet sous un angle plutôt critique.

Our international team consisting of members from China, France, and Switzerland, all born around the 90's. We were directly affected by the evolution and rise of technological, web-enabled devices. However, we are not only directly involved, but also close observers of how especially our social life is affected by these devices. And as we all share a rather critical perspective on current developments nurtured by the societal usage of technological devices, we strongly feel about reacting on this.
 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Toute sorte d'aide fait une énorme différence ! Vous pouvez collaborer avec nous de bien d'autres façons que l'argent ! Veuillez consulter nos pages Facebook et Instagram, @alonetogether.paris. Partagez notre campagne et diffusez le message et les objectifs ! Toute forme de collaboration est très appréciée et appréciée. 

Any and all kinds of help make a huge difference! You can be a collaborator with us in more ways than just money! Please like our Facebook and Instagram pages, @alonetogether.paris. Please share our campaign and spread the message and the goals! Any form of collaboration is highly valued and appreciated. 

FOLLOW US!

           https://www.facebook.com/alonetogether.paris/
           https://www.instagram.com/alonetogether.paris/

 

SEE YOU THERE!
story_txt: SHORT SUMMARYNotre quotidien est envahi par les nouvelles technologies. Nous sommes distraits par nos smartphones et nous en oublions parfois notre environnement, intérieur et extérieur. En dépit des aspects positifs et des progrès indéniables générés par ces outils de communication, nous ne pouvons ignorer les conséquences négatives. Nous avons décidé de travailler sur la “surabondance” d’information, la distraction et l’isolation sociale.AloneTogether est une production en soirée qui tente d'explorer et de repenser la relation entre la technologie et l'humanité en utilisant de multiples formes d'art. A travers la danse et le corps nous souhaitons mettre en opposition: la surabondance d’information, la distraction, et l’isolation sociale provoquées par les nouvelles technologies et l’Homme connecté à son environnement, à la nature et à lui- même. Cette performance artistique sera accompagnée de street art et de musique live.We increasingly often walk through this world with our heads down, immersed in a technological realm and increasingly disregarding our (real and immediate) surrounding. We fall prey to the illusion of companionship, gathering thousands of Twitter and Facebook friends, and confusing tweets and wall posts with authentic communication. But this relentless connection leads to a deep solitude.AloneTogether is an evening filling production that tries to explore and rethink the relationship between technology and humanity in using multiple artistic art forms. Through dance, street art, and live music the production will point out the opposition between overabundance of information, distraction, and social isolation caused by new technologies and the human being connected to his environment, to nature and to himself.          WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GETPour financer cette production artistique significative et innovante, notre objectif est de récolter 1000 €. En décidant de devenir donateur de AloneTogether, votre contribution soutiendra directement le financement de la réalisation artistique. Comme l'indique le graphique ci-dessous, votre don facilite et assure les cachets des artistes, les locaux de répétition, la location de salles, la communication et les tentatives de diffusion. Quelle que soit l'ampleur de votre contribution, elle sera dépensée avec soin pour faire une différence significative dans cette production et pour toutes les personnes impliquées.To fund this meaningful and innovative artistic production we aim to raise €1000. By deciding to become a donor of AloneTogether, your contribution will directly support the financing of the artistic realization. As the graph below indicates, your donation facilitates and ensures artists fees, rehearsal space, venue rental and communication, and outreach attempts. No matter the scope of your contribution, it will be spent with care to make a meaningful difference to this production and all involved. En guise de récompense pour votre soutien, nous avons préparé des avantages vraiment intéressants pour chaque niveau de contribution. Il s'agit notamment d'un wallpaper de téléphone surprise, de billets pour le spectacle lui-même, d'une série limitée d'un jeu de cartes postales et d'un tote bag. Et, bien sûr, nous remercierons tous avec respect et nos meilleurs vœux !As a reward for your support, we prepared some really great perks for every level of contribution. These include a surprised wallpaper, tickets to the performance itself, a limited series of a postcard set and a tote bag. And, surely, we will thank each and everyone with respect and our best wishes!SOME OF OUR ARTISTNos danseurs: Marion Agosta et Frédéric Jean-BaptisteFrédéric Jean-Baptiste a commencé la danse à 22 ans. Ce n'est qu'après deux années de cours intensifs, qu'il intègrera la Comédie Musicale "Roméo et Juliette " en 2000 et qu'il fit son entrée dans le monde du Spectacle. De fil en aiguilles, Frédéric travaillera à la télévision avec REDHA, Mia FRYE, Bruno VANDELLI, Laura TREVES, Bill GOODSON, HI-HAT pour ne citer qu'eux.Diplômé d'Etat en danse jazz (2003), Frédéric se découvre une réelle passion pour l'enseignement. story:
Short Summary

My Senior Thesis Exhibition Show will be based on the ideas and work I have been creating and exploring for around 2 years now. My work deals with a metaphysical self-awareness through relationships and connections with others and the environment. I use sculptural wearables, live models, video, performance, and interactive objects to convey these ideas. 

While attending Montserrat College of Art full-time, I also work three part-time jobs. This means that my time is limited and precious. My Senior Thesis Exhibition show will be happening sometime after March and in order to produce the work I need in time, I am looking for some help with purchasing materials. More importantly, because much of my work relies on models and performers, I want to be sure to pay the people who work for me. This way, I can guarantee their commitment to my show and be sure to compensate them fairly. And lastly, I am asking for your help so that I can have my Senior Thesis show professionally documented. This work will be what I use to propel myself as an artist once I graduate. I will need quality photos and videos (for performance) to use for my website and professional applications once I leave school. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

Any financial contribution that you can provide will go directly to one of these three things:

  1. Materials: I use a lot of fabric, wood, and lighting in my work. These materials can become quit costly. Your contributions will help me get the quality materials I need in order to create my best work for my show. 
  2. Models & Performers: As of now, I am looking to hire around 5-8 performers and models to do two performances, and model two or three wearable sculptures for the duration of the show. I Intend to offer each performer $50.00 and each model $25.00 for their time. 
  3. Documentation: I intend to hire somebody to take photographs and video of my work during my senior show. Having quality documentation will help me propel myself as an independent artist once I graduate. 

Depending on your contribution to my campaign, you will have a few "perks" to choose from!

Risks & Challenges

With big projects and ideas comes lots of planning, lots of failing, but most importantly, lots of learning. Taking on a project that requires so much fundraising, planning, and work outside of the actual conceptual challenges, my other work-heavy courses, my three jobs, and well, everything else life throws at us, will not be an easy feat. But I intend to graduate with a bang and create the work I have been running towards for quite some time now. Even if this campaign does not reach it's goal, or I run into other issues along the way, any funds I receive will go directly towards everything listed above and I will still give 110% effort and energy to putting on the best show possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that you have your own things to pay for, and that there are a lot of worthy causes out there, so anything you can contribute is helpful (that's what crowdfunding is all about anyway!) But if you cannot donate today, there a couple other things you can do to help, which are just as appreciated:

  1. Share my campaign page: Maybe somebody you know is a lover of the arts and would like to contribute!
  2. Follow me on instagram: @roisingilligan If you're interested in what I am doing, I am keeping an active presence on instagram during the semester, and afterwards!
  3. Perform for me: I am always looking for committed performers and models for my work. No experience necessary, just contact me at roisin.gilligan@montserrat.edu with the subject: Performance Interest, and let me know that you're interested and I will add you to my performer list!

And that's it! If you have any questions about any of this or are simply interested in learning more about my work, please feel free to shoot me an email at roisin.gilligan@montserrat.edu

THANK YOU!

story:
Je suis une acrobate professionnelle diplômée de l'École de cirque de Québec (2016).
J'ai un contrat qui débute en avril pour lequel j'ai besoin de mon propre agrès: des pieds de corde molle. 

Mon budget de jeune artiste est présentement limité, 
c'est pourquoi je lance ce "crowdfunding'' qui couvrirait la moitié de la somme totale pour faire fabriquer mon agrès.
Cela pourra me permettre d'élargir mes possibilitées de contrats et de lieux de performances à long terme.

Vous contriburez non seulement à ma carrière professionnelle, mais aussi à ma joie de performer ! 

Autant les petits que les grands dons seront infiniment appréciés. 

Un gros merci d'avance !

- Arielle  Lauzon

Pour en savoir plus sur mon cheminement professionnelle, visitez notre site web et suivez-nous sur les réseaux sociaux:
https://www.arielleetlouis.com/ 

FB: Arielle & Louis - Artistes de Cirque
Instagram: arielle.louis.circus

story:
We have just finished production for our new TV pilot "Tap House". It tells the story of a local Toronto bar and its colourful staff, regulars and drop ins. We have rounded up a cast of Canada's finest working actors and crew members. Our team will feature lead and recurring actors from shows/movies like Suits, Superbad, The F Word, Helix, This is the End, Orphan Black, Bitten and Reign to name a few.  Shooting has finished and now we need your help to wrap this puppy up! Be a part of this innovative new show and help us create TV magic. 

 

Written by Jordan Hayes and Alexandra Pearse

Directed by Ricky Mabe and Max Topplin

Staring: Noah Reid, Jordan Hayes, Martha Maclsaac, Tiio Horn, Michael Musi, Kristian Bruun, Steve Lund and Jonathan Keltz

story:
.

I am T.H. Johnson, whose interest as the CEO of Texas Gulf Atlantic and its Entertainment Division, is to present quality motion pictures and documentaries to the public that rarely, if ever, are told.  Consider one of our major upcoming projects, "The Music Maker", it is a biographical movie, that I personally witnessed as a radio advertising executive in Minneapolis in the mid-1970s.  The story centers around a fascinating character and how his idea to make this unlikely frigid northern US city of Minneapolis, and its unlikely minority community, into a music production center starting with his first progeny of his company, the artist known as Prince.   

The foundation of this movie is music, it is the progeny of other templates that were musically driven like Saturday Night Fever or Superfly, the latter returned approximately 100 to 1 for each dollar of initial investment.  $30 Million Dollars was the return for its $300 thousand dollar budget.  That was a remarkable return for such a low budgeted movie.  However, its musical soundtrack Superfly produced by Curtis Mayfield generated a return of  300 to 1 for its music and grossed over $30 Million Dollars itself.  The Movie Maker is simply one of several in this genre that utilized the same template for success, including the original SHAFT starring Richard Roundtree in 1971, academy award winning soundtrack by Isaac Hayes that produced respectable ROI profits.  We also have the motion picture PURPLE RAIN whose movie ROI was approximately 11 to 1, and its original musical soundtrack in 1984 by Prince returned an astounding 2000 to 1 ROI in gross profits with a return over the years of approximately $150 million in album sales.  The Grand Daddy of them all was SATURDAY NIGHT FEVER whose movie gross and music soundtrack album gross returned equal amounts of approximately $350 million dollars a piece for a grand total of approximately  $700 million dollars.   The estimated investment for production was approximately $10 Million Dollars by RSO (the Robert Stigwood Organization) label and production company.  The Music Maker we predict can and will do the same.

We also have a strong interest under the TGA umbrella in producing exciting documentaries as well.  Consider the story based on true events in  the infamous OJ Simpson case, in a 2004 documentary entitled SERPENTS RISING: An Independent Investigation of  the infamous OJ Simpson case, (www.serpentsrising.com)  and the alleged evidence that culminated in the "Trial of the Century" back in June of 1994 through October of 1995.    The revelations of several independent investigators reveal several unknown things about a cover up in this infamous trial when all these heretofore unknown investigators working over the last 20 years are brought together.   In order to promote a popular narrative of OJ Simpson's guilt, sworn court officers on both sides of the table would enter an unholy alliance to conceal other documents that pointed away from Mr. Simpson, using a friendly judge to aid and abet the suppression of these documents.  Though we have gained access to these documents, they officially remain sealed and off-limits to the public, sealed by the same judge per the request of the District Attorney's office on at least three occasions over three years.  Those sealed files would provide a strong public argument that Mr. Simpson was not involved in the murders for which he is charged and that authorities knew this from the very beginning.  This is the basis of the subsequently planned title of the documentary whose working title is LEGACY OF DECEPTION, taken from and named after the most important book and thriller concealed from the public on the subject of corruption in the Simpson case, written by Denver author Stephen Singular.

We are attempting to raise  a significant portion of the $15 million dollars to fund the production of these projects at a top level, requiring quality directors, and actors.  However, we believe that these movies will do well in making a profit in the domestic and international marketplace.   Raising capital to produce anything is always a challenge, but there are ways to put all financial incentives together to reach our goal.   So even if we do not get all the way to our goal by contributions, we can potentially leverage what we do have combined with debt capital.  

We also have an incentive on one of our films to receive at least 1/3 of the cost by check rebated back with the success in receiving a film tax credit from the State of Kentucky if we choose to produce the movie "The Music Maker" there. 

IN RETURN______

Your help with your contribution to our success in our objective, will allow us to give 25% of our net profits back to the public to help fund health insurance for those in our society regardless of race, creed, or color, who cannot afford such insurance.   We believe that everyone in our society is entitled to have access to adequate health care, though many do not because they have no insurance and thus cannot afford either adequate medical or dental care.  

 If we ultimately are unable to reach our goal we will still donate the predominant portion of the funds to non-profit organization(s) that are committed to helping families in need of social and financial emergency services.
