Johnson, whose interest as the CEO of Texas Gulf Atlantic and its Entertainment Division, is to present quality motion pictures and documentaries to the public that rarely, if ever, are told.  Consider one of our major upcoming projects, "The Music Maker", it is a biographical movie, that I personally witnessed as a radio advertising executive in Minneapolis in the mid-1970s.  The story centers around a fascinating character and how his idea to make this unlikely frigid northern US city of Minneapolis, and its unlikely minority community, into a music production center starting with his first progeny of his company, the artist known as Prince.   
The foundation of this movie is music, it is the progeny of other templates that were musically driven like Saturday Night Fever or Superfly, the latter returned approximately 100 to 1 for each dollar of initial investment.  $30 Million Dollars was the return for its $300 thousand dollar budget.  That was a remarkable return for such a low budgeted movie.  However, its musical soundtrack Superfly produced by Curtis Mayfield generated a return of  300 to 1 for its music and grossed over $30 Million Dollars itself.  The Movie Maker is simply one of several in this genre that utilized the same template for success, including the original SHAFT starring Richard Roundtree in 1971, academy award winning soundtrack by Isaac Hayes that produced respectable ROI profits.  We also have the motion picture PURPLE RAIN whose movie ROI was approximately 11 to 1, and its original musical soundtrack in 1984 by Prince returned an astounding 2000 to 1 ROI in gross profits with a return over the years of approximately $150 million in album sales.  The Grand Daddy of them all was SATURDAY NIGHT FEVER whose movie gross and music soundtrack album gross returned equal amounts of approximately $350 million dollars a piece for a grand total of approximately  $700 million dollars.   The estimated investment for production was approximately $10 Million Dollars by RSO (the Robert Stigwood Organization) label and production company.  The Music Maker we predict can and will do the same.
We also have a strong interest under the TGA umbrella in producing exciting documentaries as well.  Consider the story based on true events in  the infamous OJ Simpson case, in a 2004 documentary entitled SERPENTS RISING: An Independent Investigation of  the infamous OJ Simpson case, (www.serpentsrising.com)  and the alleged evidence that culminated in the "Trial of the Century" back in June of 1994 through October of 1995.    The revelations of several independent investigators reveal several unknown things about a cover up in this infamous trial when all these heretofore unknown investigators working over the last 20 years are brought together.   In order to promote a popular narrative of OJ Simpson's guilt, sworn court officers on both sides of the table would enter an unholy alliance to conceal other documents that pointed away from Mr. Simpson, using a friendly judge to aid and abet the suppression of these documents.  Though we have gained access to these documents, they officially remain sealed and off-limits to the public, sealed by the same judge per the request of the District Attorney's office on at least three occasions over three years.  Those sealed files would provide a strong public argument that Mr. Simpson was not involved in the murders for which he is charged and that authorities knew this from the very beginning.  This is the basis of the subsequently planned title of the documentary whose working title is LEGACY OF DECEPTION, taken from and named after the most important book and thriller concealed from the public on the subject of corruption in the Simpson case, written by Denver author Stephen Singular.
We are attempting to raise  a significant portion of the $15 million dollars to fund the production of these projects at a top level, requiring quality directors, and actors.  However, we believe that these movies will do well in making a profit in the domestic and international marketplace.   Raising capital to produce anything is always a challenge, but there are ways to put all financial incentives together to reach our goal.   So even if we do not get all the way to our goal by contributions, we can potentially leverage what we do have combined with debt capital.  
We also have an incentive on one of our films to receive at least 1/3 of the cost by check rebated back with the success in receiving a film tax credit from the State of Kentucky if we choose to produce the movie "The Music Maker" there. 
IN RETURN______
Your help with your contribution to our success in our objective, will allow us to give 25% of our net profits back to the public to help fund health insurance for those in our society regardless of race, creed, or color, who cannot afford such insurance.   We believe that everyone in our society is entitled to have access to adequate health care, though many do not because they have no insurance and thus cannot afford either adequate medical or dental care.  
 If we ultimately are unable to reach our goal we will still donate the predominant portion of the funds to non-profit organization(s) that are committed to helping families in need of social and financial emergency services.

story:
STORY

In any ecosystem, every being has a province. Survival, abundance, and harmony depend on everyone doing what they are uniquely inspired to do, without reservation or apology.  Likewise, as humans, we've each chosen different expressions of the Whole and bring different gifts to our collective experience. 

What are yours?

Prairie Majesty Oracle is a novel tool for your private exploration of that question. 

 

The prairie holds a promise of peace and of power, just like you. Come for a walk under the summer sky and let your fingers trail the grasses and wildflowers. Listen to the birds, the insects, and the wind. There's nowhere to hide from the Sun, nor any need to do so. 

  • Let's take our power back in the way that feels authentic to each of us. Let's use it to fulfill what our individual souls want to do/be/create! This benefits everyone. 
  • Let's continue abandoning old ideas around external authority and power abuses that foment oppression, inequality, and scarcity. 
  • Let's replace it with honoring (celebrating!) the Knowing and intrinsic value of each individual, sovereign in and unto themselves. We each have the divine right to decide for ourselves how to live. 

 

Prairie Majesty Oracle encourages us to find and follow our inner map. Sometimes this is going to feel like new terrain. Don't forget to explore the frontier with a spirit of adventure--and without all the colonial, territorial, hierarchical bullshit.

The first 44 cards in the deck are Category Cards. They are evenly divided into fourtypes of actions.

'

Each Category Card features a flora, fauna, or elemental being, along with a verb reminiscent of an action they take in the wild. We also included an open-ended question prompt on the cards themselves. This invites and anchors a fresh perspective in working with that energy. 

The final four are Celestial Cards: Sun, Moon, Star, and Sky. These cards suggest the movement of the energy flow in a spread. They help you see overarching themes in how the other cards fit together.  

You can mix the Celestial Cards with the Category Cards while shuffling and trust that one or more will pop up when/if needed. Or, you can set them aside while drawing a spread, and then choose one Celestial Card for an extra layer of interpretation and understanding.  

Here are our plans and goals. If anything changes, we will exercise our best discretion to match the quality as closely as possible. And, of course, we will keep you informed!

3.5 x 5 inch cards, 350 gsm card stock with matte UV coating. 

If we meet our first stretch goal, the cards will have rose gold gilded edges! This honors the Black Hills, where mixed grass prairie grows and many of the creatures in our deck live. The Black Hills are one of a few places in the world where rose quartz naturally occurs. Kara's time living there served as inspiration for creating this deck, along with the grasslands in beautiful Iowa.

 Full color, bound guidebook, 140 pages. Inside the guidebook, you'll find insights on using the deck, original spreads to try, and in-depth descriptions for possible card meanings. 

 Lid and bottom box with thumb notches on the sides for easy opening. The guidebook and deck will be nestled inside, waiting to roam the prairie with you. 

Anthony Alexander is a writer and part-time attorney. He works with animal messengers in the guided meditations and workshops she offers in the local area. His previous oracle decks and poetry are also sourced in our connections to each other and the world around us, seen and unseen.

story:
Calling all humans, aliens, and all other sentinel beings!

We need your help getting our flying saucer to Burning Man.  We are a colony of conscious expanding creatures hailing from the greater Lake Tahoe-Portland-Salt Lake City-Florida region of Earth who have a strong passion for creating.  However in a parallel world, we are actually aliens from an underwater planet called Tahoepia.  Earlier this year, we were able to find a 1984 Dodge dually flatbed truck that is perfect for transorming into an art car.  Therefore, we brought back this Earth transportation device to the Laughing Orgasmic Galactic Information Committee (LOGIC) located here in Tahoepia to see what we should do.  

The heads of LOGIC decided that to absolutely blow people's minds at Burning Man, we needed to convert this '84 Dodge into a LOGIC approved flying saucer.  LOGIC named this vehicle the S.S. Carcharius (Latin for Great White Shark). For this to be LOGIC approved, we have to extend the bed in all directions to make room for dancing Burners, construct a bar to quench the thirst of the desert dwellers, create sonic bliss for the aliens to shake their booties all night long to, laser-cut medallions, and of course purchase some shooting-star-bright LED's to spin the aircraft at night.

Our goal is to shower people with love and laughter while on board the S.S. Carcharius.  Our ship will be a steady flow of good vibrations portaling the spirit of Burning Man to all on board.  We will share our love, heart, souls, and lives with all beings who come into contact with the ship.  The positivity will therefore transpire back out of Burning Man back into the "other" world and have a butterfly effect on all.

The Dollars Broken Down

The Dodge itself cost us $950 but we here in Tahoe were able to split that about 6 ways, so don't worry about that.  We also were able to weld most of our frame/platform out of free scrap metal we picked up around town.  And a big thanks to Andy Warren for providing a PA/Soundsystem.

However, we need funds for:

Wood - $200

Aluminet (Fabric to shape body) - $700

LED's - $700

DJ Equipment - $500

Pendants - $540

 

Gifts for giving!

$25 will get you a big ass hug from me the next time I see you and a warm squishy feeling knowing that you contributed to thousands of laughs and smiles. It just might also get you a S.S. Carcharius trinket of some nature (beer coozie, pin, sticker).

$75 will get you either a S.S. Carcharius pendant (if going to BM) or a S.S. Carcharius T-shirt if not attending.  Having either of these two objects on your person will surely make you feel a sense of joy and could be the beginning of many intriguing conversations.

- Campmates - This is what the LOGIC (Laughing Orgasmic Galactic Information Committee) is requesting as a minimum donation.  This ensures that you receive your S.S. Carcharius laser-cut pendant, which is your Tahoepian Alien Identification on board the vessel. This will guarantee your VIP experience on board the S.S. Carcharius.  If for some reason you cannot afford this, please start your very own Indiegogo project.  Just kidding, do what ya can and we'll still love ya.  You'll just have to do somehing on the playa to EARN your pendant.  Chuckle Chuckle.

$150 will get you the pendant and the T-shirt.

$300 will get you a custom designed S.S. Carcharius flying saucer hat as well as the pendant and T-shirt

$500 gets you all of the above plus the S.S. Carcharius orinal painting seen above. This radical piece is on a 24"x24" canvas and will bring good alien energy to your home.  You will also be granted the power to tell every person who camps with us to do ONE funny thing while on board the S.S. Carcharius. The possibilities are endless with this one and we would be absoulutely honored to grant someone this power.  Think about it...

All donations will be documented and I will be having everybody email me their information to make sure that they receive whatever perk they have coming to them.  And remember, we all get what's coming to us in the end (:

Other ways to help

Please share this with everybody! Facebook, Twitter, Ask Jeeves, etc.  

 

We love you and thank you for your particpation in the S.S. Carcharius. 

 

Campmates

This is your opportunity for the current non-Tahoepia residents who will be camping with us to support this magnifcent journey to the desert on one gorgeous spacecraft.  Please try to donate at least $75.  This will ensure that you receive your S.S. Carcharius pendant.

story:
“Keep Close to Nature's heart...and break clear away, once in a while, and climb a mountain or spend a week in the woods. Wash your spirit clean.” -John Muir


I'm Sarah Bisceglie, a multi-disciplinary visual artist currently residing in Bushwick, Brooklyn, NYC.

Please help me start "Nature Center", a beautiful woodland retreat in the Catskills. The space will primarily serve NYC artists, thinkers, writers, and creatives who want a break from city life, an opportunity for collaboration, and to spend time finding inspiration from nature. Here, anyone can use the ample space to work on a project or host a workshop, forum, or retreat. It will be housed in a 1938 architect-owned Bauhaus chalet on a 14-acre woodland lot. There is a huge, open room perfect for meditation groups, yoga retreats, art workshops, or any other creative community endeavor. Let me share my vision of nature for everyone with you. 

In order to make this dream come true, I need your help. I need at least $6,300 by my birthday (March 2nd) to cover preliminary expenses.

First and last month's security $3,600)

A few months' worth of utilities-wifi, heat, and electric ($700) 

Initial maintenance ($300) 

A cord of firewood ($200) 

Miscellaneous supplies-furniture, yoga mats, sheets, blankets, futon, small efficient washing machine, dishes, silverware, cleaning supplies, driveway salt, shovel, rake ($1,500)


By contributing to the founding of Nature Center, you are making nature accessible to creators. In return, I invite you to share this space with us. I invite you to come visit, create, spend time in the woods, host a workshop. If you live too far away, but want to support us anyway, I will send you a piece of art work crafted with gratitude and love.

I thank you for your encouragement and support, and please pass this along if you believe in it!

Thank you,

Sarah

story:
Short Summary:

My name is Naki Akrobettoe, and I am a spoken word poet & recording artist. I hold a Bachelor of Arts & Science degree from The University of Toledo in Creative Writing and recently began my graduate journey to obtain my Master of Fine Arts degree in Poetry at Ashland University. My love for language, words, and performance poetry quickly evolved after my introduction to the poetry mecca of Columbus, Ohio called “Snaps & Taps”. It was there at the age of 17, that I was introduced to the world of live poetry readings and I mustard up the courage to get on stage. From that moment forward, I always felt that the stage was my pulpit and means to use my poetry as a way to heal and inspire my audience.  I have had the opportunity to perform with mainstream artist such as DWELE, Talib Kweli, M.anifest, as well as share the same stage as the world renowned poet, Nikki Giovanni. 

I attribute much of my growth and success to studying the late great artist and writer’s who came before me and left their own imprint upon the hearts of this world. Their contribution through their creativity  and artistry simply represents: “A Timeless Miracle”.

 

“A Timeless Miracle” Campaign is raising funds in order to provide the following:

  • digital access to both the album and documentary

  • for those who still love a “hard copy” will receive a special designed cd & DVD

The Impact:

My intentions for my poetry and this project in its entirety is to leave a legacy of inspiration on this Earth. My words and art are the definition of something that is timeless. Most importantly it serves as a guide for my children and others to seek their own passion and gifts. Each day  that we wake up with the ability to create in our lives, is a miracle especially when we are operating in our gifts and talents.

The album & documentary will reveal the behind scenes of the album recording which a complete miracle in its creation. With the help of my fellow artist friends, Cedric Easton, Brandon Chapman, Christopher Brown, Carlton Pope, and Danny Aguiar who understood my vision, we set out to capture my poetry laced over their live instrumentation accompanied with the vocals of the amazing singer Renee Dion. The beauty in all of this is that we never rehearsed once! And every track was record in one take!!!! The ability to improvise and creatively inspire each other in the same room without prior meeting is a blessing in itself and my hope is that everyone has the opportunity to not only be enriched by the music created but by the detailed documentation of the visual.

What We Need & What you Get:

Any contribution made to “A Timeless Miracle” will lower cost for creating and printing promotional & marketing materials as well as the copyright documentation for the music and writing. While the funding goal for this Campaign is set at $3,500, all amounts above and beyond this goal will be designated to any additional expense and events.

  • If you donate $10+, you get your name list on the official Nakispeaks.com sponsor/donor page.

  • If you donate $20+, you reserve a personal copy of my book 30/30/30 April 2014

  • If you donate $40+, you reserve your very own copy of “A Timeless Miracle” CD + Digital Download

  • If you donate $75+, you will receive a personalized poem about yourself by me, Naki!

  • If you donate $100+, Gain VIP Access to “A Time Miracle” Launch Party!

  • If you donate $200+, Get your very own exclusive copy of “A Timeless Miracle” commemorative poster

  • If you donate $400+, Be the first to own exclusive documentary DVD

  • If you donate $750+, Receive a private (in-home) LIVE PERFORMANCE from Naki and the IKAN band!

Other way you can help:

Every dollar received towards the campaign for “A Timeless Miracle” will indeed help. However, if you are unable to contribute/donate funds at this time, please help me spread the word about this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube, LinkedIN, Tumblr etc. Also note, when sharing on social media to please sure to use the following hashtags: #aTIMELESSmiracle #FundATM2014 #ATM2014

If you have any questions concerning this campaign. or would like to submit your own  “A Timeless Miracle” creative visual or video, please contact me via e-mail  at nakiakrobettoe@gmail.com.

story:
Hey everyone for those of you that don't know me I'm lithiumrainbow a unsigned model based in Ohio. (www.facebook.com/iamlithiumrainbow) I'm young and in college so you can imagine money is already tight. My hopes in this is to raise some money so I can expand my modeling wardrobe and keep creating art that people know and love. With your donation you're not only helping me with something I love but you'll add continuous smiles on the faces of my lithians which are what my followers identify as. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and possibly helping me out! 

Here's a list of things that I'd like to buy with the donation money; http://www.amazon.com/gp/registry/wishlist/3EX4... 
if you're interested in contributing to a certain item just let me know 

All photos used in the campaign are credited to Aaron Rhoades Photography

story:
Lighting The Gaia Lamp - Background


I'm Parker Stafford and I am the owner of Stafford Art Glass, a studio that's been creating award-winning artglass designs since 1997. The hotshop, located in Newport, Virginia, is home  to a gallery and workshop space where customers get to "see it, make it, buy it."

The Gaia Lamp (pronounced "Guy-uh") is my newest creation built on collaboration and discovery with a customer who wanted to see this piece lit (and so did I!).  It is a fusion of lighting and art glass to create a stunning light feature.  In production since 2004, these pieces have only recently been transformed by making the vases into unique works of art glass lighting.  Glowing with a rich fire from within, these pieces bring a soothing welcoming warmth to any room.  Rich, sensual, and complex, this design innovation makes a room come alive with warmth and style!

Detail: Closeup of the Lamp

The lamp is simple, stylish and elegant;  the shade is the vase, which means that its illumination sends a diffuse glow of white light onto the ceiling and a warm rich glow through the body of the vase, where the light kit is located.  The glass base is drilled for the light kit, the large lamp is illuminated with a 60 watt fluorescent bulb.  The switch is in the cord so that it is convenient when sitting on a bedside or on a table without getting in the way.  All wiring and hardware are heavy-duty and built to U.S. electrical codes. We can also build the light kit to conform to most international electrical requirements.


By becoming a supporter of the campaign you can take part in a host of exciting perks that I am excited to include here for you...

(Note: while all of my perks are for shipping within the Continental U.S.,  I am happy to ship anywhere in the world, BUT shipping costs will have to be added to your donation. Contact me via email for details!)


The Benefits

New E-Book published just in time for the campaign!

Donate $2.00 and get a copy of my guide entitled "The Care And Feeding Of Blown Glass." This book is a compilation of information I have provided my own customers over the years for how to not just care for blown glass, but how to display it expertly too!  At 27 pages, it includes information on glass composition in easy to read English explaining how blown glass is different from commercial glass.  In it I reveal something you already have in your kitchen that is better and cheaper than any of the commercial cleaners available for glass.  I explain how you can wash your glass tumblers in a dishwasher and what soap to use. I reveal an interesting way to clean glass that even uses NO cleaners AT ALL (and is one of the single best ways to keep glass clean, too!).  I have a chapter on how to display glass in the home using a range of different lighting techniques.  I  show you how you can determine the right amount of light for a glass piece without having to go to the expense of installing track lighting. This guide has 20 years of professional experience packed into it, the guide is sprinkled throughout with fun glass facts. The Care And Feeding Of Blown Glass is available in PDF format.  


Limited Edition Ornament! 


  • Donate $26.00 and own your very own signed and numbered limited edition Christmas 2014 ornament!  Made with clear crystal and golden murine elements (an Italian cane technique), this design fuses old world sensibilities with a contemporary flair.  My cane design reacts with the atmosphere of the furnace to create a metallic effect that is elegant and stunning!  Great gift to give or keep!  Order multiples for family and friends!  Do you need it shipped? You are covered with our shipped option!  Ornament comes gift boxed with a note about the campaign and how the gift will help to launch the studio's newest design.  It is a gift that gives twice! 


  • Donate $40.00 and  blow your own ornament/suncatcher at the studio after funding is complete (January 7th). Choose your colors, your design, and I show you how to make something amazing! Pick-up from the studio. (Image shown of student work, 2011). Children under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. 



  • Donate $45.00 and get your limited edition ornament (described in our first perk) shipped to you or to a friend within the Continental U.S. Signed, numbered and dated, the ornament comes in its own gift box with a note about the work and the campaign.  It is a gift that gives twice.


    • Donate $95.00 and receive a small Gaia lamp, standing approximately 7" tall, this lamp is excellent as a night light.  At this price you can send them to your friends and family! Standing at approximately 7" tall, it is a scaled down version of the full sized example shown below. For pick up from the studio.  (See our shipping option below

    • Donate $115.00 and have your small Gaia lamp, same as the perk above, but shipped anywhere within the Continental United States.  Standing at approximately 7" tall, it is a mini version of my larger lamp.  I call it a Gaia Night Light!
    • Donate $185.00 and receive your own large Gaia lamp (above) shipped within the Continental U.S.!  Each piece is signed and dated by the artist with a card describing the campaign and a bio of the artist. These pieces are being offered at a special price through this campaign, which is 40% below retail. 


    (Above: a collage of a few of our students over the last year who have blown glass in the studio)

    • Donate $500.00 and get your choice of a half-day glassblowing extravaganza with you and your friends:  I teach you how to blow as much glass as possible in a 5 hour period - ornaments, suncatchers, paperweights, or a bowl?  Its your choice!  Available during our production window between the second week of January to the third week of February 2015.  Can't make it personally to the studio?  Send me your design ideas and let's come up with stunning designs that will work for you!  All design work is guaranteed: I'm not happy unless you are. Either pick up from the studio or we can deduct enough from your donation total to include shipping! Free consultations are included to get you started when you choose to have designs made for you.


    • Donate $1,000.00 and work with me to design your own collection of custom made creations for any number of objects that equal your donation amount.  A new glass sink?  Your very own tumblers, bowl, vase, and tea light?  The studio is your oyster!  You get to exercise your itch to create while you work with a glassblower in studio. Contact me about this option before donating to learn about the list of options possible so you can do everything you have been dreaming of. As with all work made through the studio, satisfaction is guaranteed:  I'm not happy until YOU are!  I am just a phone call away at (540)605-0034 on my mobile or email me any questions that you might have.  All consultations are free for this service.  


    • Want to help with the campaign but  short on funds?  If you are local, I will need help on packing and shipping glass in January, and am happy to make fair trades!  Spreading the word is as easy as a mouse click! My campaign wont work without the help of many people sharing as much as they can in order to spread the word!  When you can bring me donors who saw your mention and acts on it, anyone who mentions your name in the comments section of the donation page, I will credit you with 15% of their donation, which is good towards any of the perks for the campaign!  If you were able to refer someone to me that wound up making a $1,000.00 donation, for example, that would mean that you would have a credit in your name in the amount of $150.00. Help this campaign go viral and you could benefit, too!


    What Is Needed
    • The project cost is $5,600.00. This is a fixed campaign which means that I HAVE to reach my goal in order to get my funding.  If I reach the final day of the campaign and fall short by even one dollar, I do not get my amount.  I AM NOT taking Flex funding for this campaign.  If I do not meet the goal, all money will be returned by Indiegogo. (Let's not let that happen, k?)
    • Funding will be used to repair a furnace door, purchase propane,  electricity for the production period (December to January), colored glass supplies, shipping, base glass, freight, and production costs including printing, postage, packaging, and shipping. A production run of 20 works will be made during the production period for selling to galleries across the United States. However, all perks will be made first before the production begins for galleries. Getting donations above my budget will increase my reach and make a tight budget easier. 
    • $200.00 is budgeted for a lamp lighting party scheduled for for donors on Saturday January 17  from 6:00-until? where I demonstrate the making of the pieces with food and beverages at the studio in Newport! Lamps will be set up for a dramatic reveal for this fun event!  Its a party, its some wintry fun in a hot glass studio! 

    The Impact

    • By donating, you will have helped a local business bring an innovative design to market while also opening the studio for others to enjoy our many other offerings during the holiday season.  Have you seen the many new works that have emerged over the last year?  Oh my goodness!  Check it out on our Facebook page under stafford art glass!  Every year I have dozens of people coming to blow their ornaments at the studio.  My winter events have spread by word of mouth and this program will help make sure that we have hot glass in the New River Valley! 

    The Challenges

    • The challenges of this campaign are to build a larger community of engaged enthusiasts who are ready to become a partner in the process of success!  Who knew word of mouth could be so much fun? I can't hope to achieve any of these things without your willingness to help, which is in getting the word out.  Simple!  This wont cost you a dime and you will be doing more than you know to help push the effort forward.  Share on facebook, send out an email to your friends which is a more personal way of sharing what's up in your life and in your community. 
    • This means that in the following weeks  I will be motivating thousands of people to help in getting the word out, via social media platforms, television, radio, and our newspapers.  Two years ago I leveraged social media to get the word out about an exhibit of glass by my University students.  Within a two-hour period we had over 2,000 views of our announcement for the exhibit with many hundreds in the days that followed.  This led to our effort being featured in the Radford University Magazine.  Helping me is not all about just giving money, not by a long shot!   This leads me to the many ways you can help beyond just donating....

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Want to help but can't donate?  No problem!  I can't tell you just how powerful having a core of devotees who are willing to keep my efforts shared and churning across the internet!  With just one simple click of the mouse, you can  have a big impact. just share my updates on your social media, twitter, instagram, and email! If you want to know how you can best do that, send me a note or a message and I can provide you with images for the campaign that you can use to your hearts content!  Find me on Facebook HERE! Feel free to grab any image of me and my work on Facebook for use in spreading the word!  Have a group you'd like for me to speak to? Sometimes people just need a simple introduction from you about a business that you like.  A "handshake" is as valuable as a donation! Anyone who mentions YOUR name when they donate, will land you a credit that is equal to $15% of their donation! (Some limitations apply, so drop me a note to find out details or go to Facebook to find out more about this option.   
    • Don't forget; Indiegogo has some great tools that make sharing a snap! Share away and let's make this happen!

    With Gratitude and Gusto,

    ~Parker Stafford - Owner Stafford Art Glass

story:
Send us to CUPSI!

We are Madison, Henri, Megan, Jalem, and Montita, five spoken word poets who believe in challenging our audience and each other to work toward change. Spoken word is a type of performance poetry, and a poetry slam is a competition for spoken word.

We are all students at Harvard College, and are part of an awesome organization called Speak Out Loud (SOL). We are hoping to represent Harvard SOL at the College Union Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI) in 2015. In March 2015, CUPSI is in Richmond, VA and we are traveling there from Boston, MA. We need your help getting there!

While money and Harvard are usually closely associated, SOL (and spoken word in general) is new to the school so opportunities for funding are very limited.  The money that you can help us raise will help us cover costs for registration, travel, lodging and food! That's why we have created this campaign. We're not only relying on this to send us to CUPSI, we also hope that it will demonstrate how important spoken word is to us and our community so that Harvard will more enthusiastically fund future student spoken word endeavors.

What We Need

We are trying to raise $3250! Here's where it's going to:

  • Round-trip airfare per person (5 of us plus our coach!): $150x6=$900

  • Registration for CUPSI: $750

  • Lodging at CUPSI: $1000

  • Food at CUPSI: $400 or $66/person for 5 days!

  • Travel within Richmond: $200

If you give $10 or more, we have some fun perks lined up for you to show our appreciation. Having said that, every dollar you give matters! We appreciate and are grateful for contributions of all sizes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we love you anyway!

  • Help us by sharing this with your friends, family, etc.
  • Purchase our special chapbook, the CUPSI edition, featuring poems from us for only 5 dollars!
  • If you are in Boston on February 20th, come support us at our regional slam!
  • If you are in Boston on March 13th, come support us at our showcase!

story:
Thank you All for your support! While our indiegogo campaign has ended you can still make contributions to help us reach our goal. You can donate via paypal here:

 http://www.mobius.org/sites/default/files/html/paypalmemo.htm


What is Mobius?

     Mobius (est. 1977) is a non-profit, artist-run organization, whose mission is to generate, shape and test new forms of experimental art.  Recognized as one of the seminal alternative arts organizations in the U.S. for nearly forty years, Mobius has continued to provide a dedicated space for experimentation across a range of disciplines including performance art, video and installation, sound art, experimental movement and net art.  Based in the Boston area, Mobius has supported thousands of local, national and international artists working in these disciplines, becoming a global nexus for the development of art initiatives and critical dialogue outside accepted frameworks.  It operates as a performance and exhibition space, currently located in Cambridge, MA, as well as a mobile curatorial entity, nurturing its artist members and guests and actively responding to shifts in the cultural landscapes of contemporary art.

     In recognition of the vital importance of the organization's legacy in  experimental art, its preservation and accessibility, Tufts University acquired the Mobius Archives of photographic images, newsletters, video and audio recordings and other materials in 2013.  In terms of current trends, Mobius continues to be positioned at the forefront of innovative and influential practice.  For example, performance art, a core Mobius discipline which its artists have pioneered nationally and internationally for decades, is now increasingly being programmed in major museum contexts.  Two Mobius performance artists have just received important museum based awards to bring their work into highly visible institutional settings and to broader audiences.  Marilyn Arsem, the founder of Mobius, was recently awarded the 2015 Maud Morgan Prize at the Museum of Fine Arts Boston, the first performance artist to receive this honor .  Sandrine Schaefer is one of the first two artists in this discipline to receive the 2015 biennial James and Audrey Foster Prize at the Institute of Contemporary Art in Boston.  

     

     

     


Milan Kohout "Feed Me (First Amendment)," 2002


Why We Need Your Help

     Over the past 38 years, Mobius has worked tirelessly to preserve a space for experimental art for local, national and international artists and has been a global pioneer in contemporary art. A goal of $25,000 will cover our operational expenses for the next several months, ensuring our continued ability to provide artists with a space to create works without commercial pressure, and providing the time necessary to develop our programming and envision our future.

       The economic forces and technological systems that are enabling globalization in the arts are also generating the widespread afflictions produced by environmental crisis, forced migration, vast income inequality and wars.  Artists working at the intersections of these contending realities are developing innovative forms of socially engaged and publicly sited work that respond creatively to crisis and contradiction and in some cases initiate new forms of resistance and alternative social organization.  With increased operational financial resources, Mobius could develop as a pivotal ground of educational and artistic encounter for artists within its purview and other local and internationally based practitioners working in these socially productive modes.

     We need your help to make these critical and visionary initiatives a reality!  If our operational expenses are covered for the immediate future, we will have the time to  develop more dynamic programming and a business plan to sustain it.  Please contribute to keeping Mobius on the forefront of innovative practice through a tax deductible contribution.     

   

Marilyn Arsem "Edge," 2013


The IMPACT of Your Contribution

Your generous TAX DEDUCTIBLE contribution will go towards:

  • OPERATING costs for the next year

  • Ensuring Mobius the TIME necessary to plan and develop a sustainable and compelling long-term business plan. Your contributions will give us a stable financial foundation during this planning period, while the group continues to provide dynamic programming throughout the year. 

  • Preserving a space for ARTISTIC BREAKTHROUGHS! We provide artists with a space to make artwork without commercial pressure. We provide opportunities for artists to make work in contexts that may otherwise be unavailable to them. We provide a space for artists to receive critical feedback on the work, in the various stages of its making.  It is through these things, where one sees artistic breakthroughs happen!


With any additional support beyond our $25,000 goal, we will be able to more aggressively pursue the following projects:


  • Launching a substantial EDUCATION program that offers practicing artists opportunities to work with leading practitioners in the field of experimental art.

  • The realization of a substantial EXHIBITION developed by Mobius Director, Daniel DeLuca, MOBIUS 40 | Receptive Bodies Fields of Action - a survey of experimental art in Boston over the last 40 years through the lens of Mobius.

  • Developing a strategic plan to acquire a new space. Mobius currently resides in a modest 300 square space. The size of our current space limits many of our endeavors and how we are able to envision our future.

  • Still preserving a space for ARTISTIC BREAKTHROUGHS!



The IMPACT of Mobius

In addition to providing opportunities for artists to test and shape ideas, Mobius creates space for rigorous dialogue around experimental art practices. We are a group that also understands the value of research and development to any process. In 2013, our archives were transferred to Tufts University where future artists, historians, researchers, and the public will learn about the work that our organization has and will continue to cultivate.

Mobius has plays a significant role in the cultural heritage of Boston. For nearly forty years we have provided a dedicated space for experimentation. Thousands of artists have used this platform to explore and challenge new forms of experimental art. Performance Art, Sound Art, Early Video and Installation, Movement-Based Art, and Net Art have been pioneered at Mobius. Only now, (40 years later) are these forms  beginning to see popular acclaim in the art world and beyond.  Mobius has helped support the work of artists that have contributed to the rise of these artistic forms over the last 40 years. With your help, we can continue to provide space to artists, across international and generational divides, to come together to discover the next breakthrough in contempary art!

Anna Wexler & Catherine Tutter, "Vessel for Haiti IV," 2014


There Are Other Ways You Can Help!

  • Spread the word about the campaign 

  • Volunteer with us! 

  • Connect us with like-minded institutional partners and people interested in the work that we do

  • Sign up for our mailing list:     http://visitor.r20.constantcontact.com/manage/optin/ea?v=001peuSb9w_PdC2HNEOLKyhvyjag4SI-W8zguM94mtdJGrec8RqYI6un0x_RG6UniLg
story_txt:
Thank you All for your support! While our indiegogo campaign has ended you can still make contributions to help us reach our goal. You can donate via paypal here: http://www.mobius.org/sites/default/files/html/paypalmemo.htmWhat is Mobius?     Mobius (est. 1977) is a non-profit, artist-run organization, whose mission is to generate, shape and test new forms of experimental art.  Recognized as one of the seminal alternative arts organizations in the U.S. for nearly forty years, Mobius has continued to provide a dedicated space for experimentation across a range of disciplines including performance art, video and installation, sound art, experimental movement and net art.  Based in the Boston area, Mobius has supported thousands of local, national and international artists working in these disciplines, becoming a global nexus for the development of art initiatives and critical dialogue outside accepted frameworks.  It operates as a performance and exhibition space, currently located in Cambridge, MA, as well as a mobile curatorial entity, nurturing its artist members and guests and actively responding to shifts in the cultural landscapes of contemporary art.     In recognition of the vital importance of the organization's legacy in  experimental art, its preservation and accessibility, Tufts University acquired the Mobius Archives of photographic images, newsletters, video and audio recordings and other materials in 2013.  In terms of current trends, Mobius continues to be positioned at the forefront of innovative and influential practice.  For example, performance art, a core Mobius discipline which its artists have pioneered nationally and internationally for decades, is now increasingly being programmed in major museum contexts.  Two Mobius performance artists have just received important museum based awards to bring their work into highly visible institutional settings and to broader audiences.  Marilyn Arsem, the founder of Mobius, was recently awarded the 2015 Maud Morgan Prize at the Museum of Fine Arts Boston, the first performance artist to receive this honor .  Sandrine Schaefer is one of the first two artists in this discipline to receive the 2015 biennial James and Audrey Foster Prize at the Institute of Contemporary Art in Boston.                 


Milan Kohout "Feed Me (First Amendment)," 2002

Why
We Need Your Help

     Over the past 38 years, Mobius has worked tirelessly to preserve a space
for experimental art for local, national and international artists and has been a global pioneer in contemporary art. A goal of $25,000
will cover our operational expenses for the next several months, ensuring our continued ability to provide artists with a space to create works without commercial pressure, and providing the time necessary to
develop our programming and envision our future.       The economic forces and technological systems that are enabling globalization in the arts are also generating the widespread afflictions produced by environmental crisis, forced migration, vast income inequality and wars.  Artists working at the intersections of these contending realities are developing innovative forms of socially engaged and publicly sited work that respond creatively to crisis and contradiction and in some cases initiate new forms of resistance and alternative social organization.  With increased operational financial resources, Mobius could develop as a pivotal ground of educational and artistic encounter for artists within its purview and other local and internationally based practitioners working in these socially productive modes.     We need your help to make these critical and visionary initiatives a reality!  If our operational expenses are covered for the immediate future, we will have the time to  develop more dynamic programming and a business plan to sustain it.  Please contribute to keeping Mobius on the forefront of innovative practice through a tax deductible contribution.        
Marilyn Arsem "Edge," 2013
The
IMPACT of Your Contribution


Your
generous TAX DEDUCTIBLE contribution will go towards:

	costs
	for the next year

story:
[EN] What is: “Murals Without Borders”: 

It is a social project promoted by the NGO’s “HER YERDE SANAT” based in Mardin (Turkey) together with “CIRCO ALL'INCIRCA” from Udine (Italy) are setting up a new collaboration in order to support for the coming spring, scheduled from 16th May the following international artists: Aleksandra Miciak (Poland), Jovana Komnenic (Germany/Serbia), Olivera Indjic (Serbia) e David Romanello (Italy).

[IT] Cos’è “Murales Senza Frontiere”: 

è un progetto di promozione sociale proposto dall’organizzazione no-profit “Her Yerde Sanat" Mardin (Turchia) in collaborazione con l’Associazione italiana “Circo all’inCirca” Udine (Italia). Il progetto è finalizzato a sostenere durante la stagione primaverile a partire dal 16 Maggio l’azione dei seguenti artisti internazionali: Aleksandra Miciak (Polonia), Jovana Komnenic (Germania/Serbia), Olivera Indjic (Serbia) e David Romanello (Italia)

                                   http://www.muralesenzafrontiere.blogspot.it

[EN] Goal: Painting production of 4 Murals located in sensible points of the Old City, standing up for the right of creative free expression, as model of universal education. Involving the Syrian children of the Refugee Camp situated in Nusaybin at the nearest border. The Murals symbolizing an harmonic link of the 4 Natural Elements to the Cardinal Points, represent as well an experience of social balance by distance, giving a special chance to the children of collective painting.

[IT] Obiettivo: Realizzare 4 dipinti in punti sensibili della città turca di Mardin, al confine tra Iran e Siria, monitorati dalle autorità locali. I temi saranno: la pace e libertà d'espressione creativa come modello educativo universale. Coinvolgendo i bambini del campo rifugiati siriano poco distante di Nusaybin. I murales simboleggiano l`incontro armonico dei 4 elementi naturali associati ai 4 punti cardinali, ricercando in questa esperienza uno scambio d`equilibrio sociale mettendo a confronto diverse etnie, facendo dipingere i bambini insieme.

http://www.artanywhere.weebly.com

[EN] Previous Experience: The campaign find its meaning in the post-production of the work done during previous spring workshops, participating in the results of the program: "PLAY FOR NO WAR – Social Circus & Art School" providing creative activities such as painting wooden panels for theatrical backgrounds and decoration of self-made diaries with 15 kids from the neighborhood and from the primary school of Mardin. The drawings realized during the workshops were used as sketches, inspiring collective imagination in order to reach the final picture.

[IT] Esperienze precedenti: il progetto nasce a seguito dell’esperienza sviluppata la scorsa primavera, che a sua volta è parte integrante del programma "PLAY FOR NO WAR - Social Circus & Art School”. Grazie a questo progetto nel 2014 quindici bambini del quartiere adiacente alla sede dell'associazione Turca e della scuola elementare di Mardin (Città Vecchia) hanno partecipato ai laboratori di pittura creativa su pannelli scenografici e alla decorazione di diari auto-prodotti. I disegni realizzati durante i laboratori sono poi stati utilizzati come bozzetti stimolando l'immaginazione collettiva dei ragazzi al fine di raggiungere l’idea per il dipinto finale.

http://www.wmoidr.blogspot.com

[EN] Why Circo all’Incirca : It has been active in the cultural life of Mardin and surrounding Mesopotamian Communities since the past years, participating in festivals and providing workshops for youths from all over the world, choosing creativity as main educative method of daily communication exchange, dealing with controversial and fragile political aspects of this specific Turkish region of Kurdistan, where social exclusion represent an heavy phenomenon clearly visible in the new generation reactions.

[IT] Perché il Circo all’inCirca: l’Associazione è presente da diverso tempo in una regione geo-politica fragile e controversa come il Kurdistan Turco. Sono state proposte molteplici azioni di sensibilizzazione culturale sul territorio circostante, specialmente durante il triennio 2012/2014. In particolare sono stati organizzati festival e laboratori di circo sociale, ospitando giovani da tutto il mondo, scegliendo la creatività come mezzo educativo quotidiano per lo scambio comunicativo. L’idea di aiutare la zona Mesopotamica attraverso il circo nasce dalla volontà di eliminare l'esclusione sociale, divenuta un fenomeno sempre più insostenibile soprattutto nei confronti delle nuove generazioni, laddove l’attenzione dei media e delle grandi organizzazioni di volontariato non riescono ad essere del tutto incisive.

http://www.circoallincirca.it

[EN] Why “Murals”: The realization of a piece of “Public Art” has the power to speak without words, leaving people free to act concretely in their daily life contest, protecting the knowledge about unique personal skills, building up their self-trust and motivations.

[IT] Perché i “Murales”: La realizzazione di un’opera d’arte "pubblica" ha il merito di metter tutti nelle condizioni di agire concretamente sul proprio contesto quotidiano facendo acquisire ai giovani e alla popolazione della città una rinnovata consapevolezza delle proprie capacità, smorzando così la mancanza di fiducia in sé e nelle potenzialità del proprio territorio.

http://www.facebook.com/muralesenzafrontiere

[EN] Who are the artists involved:

Aleksandra Miciak (Poland)

Born in Warsaw in 1987. Graphic Designer, painter and filmmaker. Participated in several international projects. Assistant in social workshops for kids & youngsters.

Jovana Komnenic (Serbia, Germany)

Born in Pancevo in 1981. Artistic Mediator worked with various museums, galleries, foundations for visually impaired people and educational centers. She had numerous exhibitions and participations in projects in Balkan Area, Italy, Germany & USA.

Olivera Indjic (Serbia):

 Painter born in Belgrade in 1981. She operates mainly in the photographic and illustration circuits. She participates in several projects within which multidisciplinary workshops for children and she realize murals in cultural centers. She was part of numerous collective and solo exhibitions in Asia and Europe, from Paris to Venice, Istanbul and Kyoto. Co-founder of the project Murals Without Borders.

David Romanello (Italy): 

Born in Mirano – Venice in 1981. Social Circus Artist, at his work of research on the contemporary forms of street art, he get involved in visual art projects and realize murals in cultural centers; he acts in musical and theatrical performances, he leads interactive workshops for kids in Italy, Balkans, India and Mesopotamia, Co-founder of the project Murals Without Borders.

[IT] Chi sonogli artisti coinvolti: 

Aleksandra Miciak (Polonia): 

nata a Varsavia nel 1987. Graphic designer, pittrice e video maker. Ha partecipato a numerosi progetti internazionali come assistente di laboratori creativi sociali per bambini e adolescenti.

Jovana Komnenic (Serbia, Germania): 

nata a Pancevo nel 1981. Artista Contemporanea, ha lavorato con musei, gallerie e associazioni disabili in centri educativi. Ha collezionato numerose esposizioni e progetti nell’Area Balcanica e in Italia, Germania e USA.

Olivera Inđić (Serbia): 

pittrice nata a Belgrado nel 1981. Opera prevalentemente nel circuito fotografico e dell’illustrazione. Collabora  a numerosi progetti, tra i quali laboratori creativi multidisciplinari per bambini e realizza murales in centri culturali. Ha partecipato a svariate mostre collettive e individuali in Europa e Asia, tra le quali Parigi e Venezia, Istanbul e Kyoto. E’ ideatrice del progetto Murales Senza Frontiere.

David Romanello (Italia): 

nato a Mirano (Venezia) nel 1981. Artista di circo sociale, al suo lavoro di ricerca sull’arte di strada contemporanea, si aggiungono gli interessi per le arti visive e realizza murales in centri culturali; recita e conduce laboratori interattivi per bambini in Italia, nei Balcani, in India e Mesopotamia. E’ ideatore del progetto Murales Senza Frontiere.

[EN] Contribute to the realization of Murals Without Borders in Mardin: 

Supporting our campaign you will help us buying colors & brushes and all the logistic necessary materials . It will cover production costs, as well as participants and artists travel expenses.

At the end of the project we are going to organize an exhibition of the children’s sketches. We’ll also print a small photo book with the documentation of the results of the artworks, that will include a list of the names of everyone who has contributed with their donations. The translated versions will be available at the offices of ''Circo all'InCirca'' in Udine & at ''Her Yerde Sanat'' in Mardin.

Main goal is to collect €4,000. If we manage to have a bigger amount available, we’ll  engage other artists, in order to involve more children to take part in the workshops. If we will not reach the final goal proposed, we are motivated to run the program anyway, realizing less murals in proportion to the amount collected. If you believe in our project: we are very happy to receive your support, to improve concretely in this initiative!

[IT] Contribuisci alla realizzazione di Murales Senza Frontiere a Mardin: 

Offrendo il tuo sostegno alla campagna, contribuisci direttamente all’acquisto dei colori, dei pennelli e di tutto il materiale logistico necessario; sosterrai inoltre le spese di produzione e il rimborso dei costi di trasporto dei partecipanti e degli artisti.

A fine lavori sarà allestita una mostra dei disegni e sarà stampato un piccolo libretto contenente le foto dei lavori dei partecipanti come testimonianza diretta, che includerà i nomi di tutti quelli che hanno contribuito al progetto con le loro donazioni. Le versioni tradotte saranno disponibili in visione presso le sedi di “Circo all'InCirca” a Udine e di ''Her Yerde Sanat'' a Mardin.

La somma che ci prefiggiamo di raccogliere e` di 4000 euro, ma nell'ipotesi che superassimo la quota prevista ci impegniamo ad impiegare le donazioni extra per coinvolgere altri artisti e permettere così a più ragazzi di prendere parte alle attività del laboratorio.

Nell’ipotesi inversa invece, saremo motivati comunque a proporre l’iniziativa, riducendo il numero dei murales relativamente alla somma ricavata. Se credi alla buona riuscita del progetto: siamo felici di ricevere il tuo gesto di generosita' contribuendo attivamente alla realizzazione della campagna!


To Thank you for your donation:

we prepared a symbolic gift to send you !

No matter the amount you sent, choose from our craft gadgets available choosing from 6 postcards of printed analog photos of subjects about Murals Workshop and typical atmosphere of Mardin and/or get the screen printed shopper cotton bags decorated by the logo of the project.

To share with us your choice, after you made your donation

Feel free to write an email to withoutbordersmurals@gmail.com

Specifying in the subject field your preference.

[IT] Ringraziandoti della tua eventuale donazione:

abbiamo pensato di inviarti un pensiero sincero e simbolico!

Potrai scegliere tra le 6 cartoline raffiguranti i dipinti e le fotografie analogiche di soggetti riguardanti il laboratorio creativo di Murales e l'atmosfera tipica di Mardin e/o la borsa realizzata con la tecnica della serigrafia artigianale raffigurante il logo della missione.

Per indicare la tua scelta basterà, dopo aver fatto la donazione,

inviare una mail a withoutbordersmurals@gmail.com,

specificando nell’oggetto la tua preferenza.



PAINT FOR NO WAR - A PEACEFUL COLORS INVASION !

DIAMO COLORE AD UN MONDO MIGLIORE !

Collabora  a numerosi progetti, tra i quali laboratori creativi multidisciplinari per bambini e realizza murales in centri culturali. Ha partecipato a svariate mostre collettive e individuali in Europa e Asia, tra le quali Parigi e Venezia, Istanbul e Kyoto. E’ ideatrice del progetto Murales Senza Frontiere.
David Romanello (Italia): nato a Mirano (Venezia) nel 1981. Artista di circo sociale, al suo lavoro di ricerca sull’arte di strada contemporanea, si aggiungono gli interessi per le arti visive e realizza murales in centri culturali; recita e conduce laboratori interattivi per bambini in Italia, nei Balcani, in India e Mesopotamia. E’ ideatore del progetto Murales Senza Frontiere.
[EN] Contribute to the realization of Murals Without Borders in Mardin: Supporting
our campaign you will help us buying colors & brushes and
all the logistic necessary materials . It will cover
production costs, as well as participants and artists travel expenses. 
At the end of
the project we are going to organize an exhibition of the children’s
sketches. We’ll also print a small photo book with the
documentation of the results of the artworks, that will include a list of the
names of everyone who has contributed with their donations. The translated versions will be
available at the offices of ''Circo all'InCirca'' in Udine & at ''Her Yerde Sanat'' in Mardin.
Main
goal is to collect €4,000. If we manage to have a bigger amount available,
we’ll  engage other artists, in order to
involve more children to take part in the workshops. If we will not reach the
final goal proposed, we are motivated to run the program anyway, realizing less
murals in proportion to the amount collected. If you believe in our project: we
are very happy to receive your support, to improve concretely in this
initiative![IT] Contribuisci alla realizzazione di Murales Senza Frontiere a Mardin: Offrendo il tuo sostegno alla campagna, contribuisci
direttamente all’acquisto dei colori, dei pennelli e di tutto il materiale logistico necessario; sosterrai
inoltre le spese di produzione e il rimborso dei costi di trasporto dei partecipanti
e degli artisti.
A fine lavori sarà allestita una mostra dei disegni e
sarà stampato un piccolo libretto contenente le foto dei lavori dei
partecipanti come testimonianza diretta, che includerà i nomi di tutti quelli
che hanno contribuito al progetto con le loro donazioni. Le versioni tradotte
saranno disponibili in visione presso le sedi di “Circo all'InCirca” a Udine e
di ''Her Yerde Sanat'' a Mardin.
La somma che
ci prefiggiamo di raccogliere e` di 4000 euro, ma nell'ipotesi che superassimo la
quota prevista ci impegniamo ad impiegare le donazioni extra per coinvolgere
altri artisti e permettere così a più ragazzi di prendere parte alle attività
del laboratorio. 
Nell’ipotesi
inversa invece, saremo motivati comunque a proporre l’iniziativa, riducendo il numero dei murales relativamente alla somma ricavata. Se credi alla buona riuscita del progetto: siamo felici di ricevere il tuo gesto di generosita' contribuendo attivamente alla realizzazione della campagna!To Thank
you for your donation:
we prepared a symbolic
gift to send you !
No matter the amount you
sent, choose from our craft gadgets available choosing from 6 postcards of
printed analog photos of subjects about Murals Workshop and typical atmosphere
of Mardin and/or get the screen printed shopper cotton bags decorated by the
logo of the project.
To share with us your
choice, after you made your donation
Feel free to write an
email to withoutbordersmurals@gmail.com
Specifying in the subject
field your preference.
[IT] Ringraziandoti della tua eventuale donazione:
abbiamo pensato di inviarti un pensiero sincero e
simbolico!
Potrai scegliere tra le 6 cartoline raffiguranti i
dipinti e le fotografie analogiche di soggetti riguardanti il laboratorio
creativo di Murales e l'atmosfera tipica di Mardin e/o la borsa realizzata con
la tecnica della serigrafia artigianale raffigurante il logo della missione.
Per indicare la tua scelta basterà, dopo aver fatto la
donazione,
inviare una mail a withoutbordersmurals@gmail.com,
specificando nell’oggetto la tua preferenza.PAINT FOR NO WAR - A PEACEFUL COLORS INVASION !DIAMO COLORE AD UN MONDO MIGLIORE !

story:
Renewable Energy Can Be Beautiful!

Spread the word and inspire people about how renewable energy can be designed to fit seamlessly into our communities.

Your donation will help to make possible the book, Regenerative Infrastructures, presently being designed by Paul Schifino (Schifino Design), and to be published in May 2013 by Prestel Publishing (a division of Random House). It's a "subvention" contract in which we agree to pay the publisher. The publishing, editing, and design costs together come to $22,000. Our grant-writing efforts have secured a generous $5,000 from Furthermore (a program of the J. M. Kaplan Fund), and we've raised some additional money but we’re still $10,000 short. We have some really great perks that we hope will make it easy for you to support this project. Donate $100 and we will even give you a signed copy of the book when it comes out in May!

As Prestel writes in their spring 2013 catalog, Regenerative Infrastructures is, “an in-depth exploration of one of the most exciting urban design competitions in recent years—the Land Art Generator Initiative for Freshkills Park on New York’s Staten Island.” It will be an excellent resource for everyone who is interested in the design of our renewable energy future.

In addition to showcasing details of 65 thought-provoking entries to the 2012 LAGI design competition, the book will also contain essays on design, art, architecture, waste, and energy by writers such as Thaddeus Pawlowski (NYC City Planning, Urban Planning Dept.), Eloise Hirsh (Freshkills Parks Administrator, NYC Dept. of Parks & Recreation), Heather Rogers (Independent Journalist and contributor to New York Times Magazine, Mother Jones,and The Nation), Tafline Laylin (Independent Journalist and contributor to Inhabitat and Green Prophet), Mitchell Joachim (Terreform One), Ann Rosenthal (American Ecoartist), Andreas Kipar (Landscape Architect), and Elizabeth Monoian and Robert Ferry (co-founders of LAGI).

All donations will go directly for the funding of this book project. Any small amount will make a huge difference!

Images of "Scene Sensor" (First Place LAGI 2012 Prize) courtesy of James Murray and Shota Vashakmadze

The design of our constructed environment is of critical importance to the health of our cities. Beautiful cities attract greater investment and increase livability. This fact has lately become important to solar and wind power generation projects. The “not-in-my-backyard” (NIMBY) response has been getting louder as clean energy infrastructure comes closer to the places where we live and recreate.

The Land Art Generator Initiative (LAGI) is presenting the world with new and inspiring design solutions for renewable energy power plants. Through a biennial design competition, we’re bringing together teams of artists, architects, engineers, landscape architects, designers, and scientists to conceive of large-scale works of public art that have the added capability of generating renewable power at a utility scale. Each land art generator has the capacity to power hundreds or even thousands of homes by incorporating existing technology as the medium for the artwork. LAGI was founded in 2009 and has run two successful international design competitions (2010 and 2012), receiving more than 400 design proposals from artist teams representing more than 50 countries.

The book, Regenerative Infrastructures, will bring these amazing ideas and the technical innovations behind them to a broad audience and help to build momentum towards the eventual implementation of clean energy infrastructure land art as an amenity to cities.

See us talk more about the overall LAGI project in this TEDx video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BaCBLHMvOds 

Images of "Fresh Hills" (2nd Place LAGI 2012 Prize) courtesy of Matthew Rosenberg

LAGI is founded on the assumption that collective action is desperately needed on issues of global climate change, environmental conservation, air quality, energy infrastructure, and sustainable development. Rather than work against the NIMBY roadblock, LAGI seeks to present an alternative model based on a design approach that can inspire people and help to bring about a more universal embrace of a transition to renewable energy sources.

LAGI is a not for profit project of Society for Cultural Exchange, a 501(c)(3) organization.


Images of "Solar Loop" (2012 LAGI Shortlist) courtesy of Paolo Venturella

Here are the details from the Prestel Spring Catalog:

REGENERATIVE INFRASTRUCTURES: FRESHKILLS PARK NYC, LAND ART GENERATOR INITIATIVE

EDITED BY CAROLINE KLEIN AND LAGI, IN COOPERATION WITH NEW YORK CITY DEPARTMENT OF PARKS & RECREATION, THE INSTITUTE FOR URBAN DESIGN, AND THE COUNCIL ON THE ARTS & HUMANITIES FOR STATEN ISLAND

Formerly a symbol of immense urban waste, the Fresh Kills Landfill is being transformed into an enormous parkland that is destined to exemplify the values of ecological restoration and environmental sustainability. Part of that transformation includes a competition for a site-specific public artwork designed to operate as a source of clean energy for the city utility grid. This volume features many of the top submissions to the Land Art Generator Initiative, which aims to create sustainable design solutions that integrate art and technology into renewable energy infrastructure around the world.

The book draws a much-needed connection between the two critical issues of sustainable development—energy generation and waste management—highlighting solutions that address both problems at once, thereby creating economically beneficial hybrid utility installations.

CAROLINE KLEIN is an architect and freelance author and editor for international architectural magazines and publishing houses. THE LAND ART GENERATOR INITIATIVE, founded in 2010 by Elizabeth Monoian and Robert Ferry, brings together artists, architects, scientists, landscape architects, and engineers to advance sustainable design solutions for large-scale renewable energy infrastructure.

240 pages with 250 illustrations; Hardcover; 11 x 9 in. / 28 x 23 cm; ISBN 978-3-7913-5286-2; Publication date: May 2013.

The book launch will be in June at Arsenal Gallery in NYC's Central Park.

Image courtesy of Inki Hong, Solim Choi, and Walter Sueldo

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help to spread the word about this campaign by sharing a link on your Facebook wall, Google+, or other social network of your choice, sending a Tweet, or emailing a link to this page to your friends. Take advantage of Indiegogo’s easy to use sharing tools.

Let us know (lagi@landartgenerator.org) if you post a link to this indiegogo page to your facebook wall or other social media page. Send us to the post and we'll enter you into a random drawing for a Terawatt prize. The lucky winner will get all of the perks that Ms. / Mr. Terawatt get ($750 level) in addition to the perks that they already received for their donation.

Thank you for sharing and thank you for caring about the design of our renewable energy future.

story:
Hi Friends! And welcome to the Portland Artists Kumite Art Competition and Show's indiegogo campaign.

My name is James Wallace-Mischke, founder and director of The Portland Artists Kumite. I'm an artist and promoter/sometime curator living and working in the Rose City - Portland, OR. I love this town and couldn''t imagine calling any other place home. I created this competiton last year as a way to give something back to my community and offer an alternative opposed to the traditional way in which most art contests are run. The Portland Artists Kumite is a fun, free, open format, local  art competition where the public chooses the winner!. This competition is intended to celebrate the Rose City and our love of all things art and fun.

Your support will ensure another successful year, allowing us at the P.A.K. to provide a fun and free art event to the people of Portland while at the same time giving local artists an oppurtunity to showcase their talent and gain exposure.

The P.A.K. Funding Campaign Goal

It takes suprisingly little to make a city wide art competition and show happen, especially when you have the great friends like the ones I have helping me out. With your help we hope to raise $1,065. That's it. Even if we do not reach our goal every little bit helps. Here is a simplified version of the P.A.K. budget:

1. Promotional Materials and Advertising - $305.73

2. Prizes/Awards for competitors - $357

3. Opening/Closing Receptions, Catering - $300

4. Incidental Expenses - $100

* Total Projected Budget - $1062.73

What You Get

For our indiegogo supporters the P.A.K., in collaboration with artists Christopher Kelleher (http://www.galleryck.com/), Mari Navarro (http://www.marinavarro.com/), and Josh O'Renick (http://oboystudios.com/), is producing a series of limited edition fine art prints as perks for our indiegogo friends. Once finished, we will post them online so you may choose your reward. Please check out our gallery page.

  • At the $10 level, friends of the P.A.K. will receive a limited edtion, numbered, and signed 8.5" X 11" print by artists Christopher Kelleher, Mari Navarro, and myself.
  • Those who contribute at the $25 option will receive the $10 perk plus a limted edition 5" X 7" Lino-cut print by artist Josh O'Renick.
  • A $50 pledge to the Kumite will you get all the $10 and $25 perks plus your name or business will be listed on the P.A.K. website, facebook page, and all the print media as an official friend and sponsor of the Portland Artists Kumite. 

P.A.K. Vision and Mission

Vision

By creating a free and open format art competition, the Portland Artists Kumite strives to create a fun, friendly event that enriches the community by showcasing the work of local artists and generate interest in the fine arts by including the public in the decision making process.

Mission

To provide local artists at all levels of experience a unique and positive environment in which to exhibit their work and generate interest in the arts among the public.


The P.A.K. is funded by generous individuals and local businesses, without their support the Kumite would not be possible. We at the Kumite would like to say "Thank You" and hope to see you at the show.

Sincerely,

James Wallace-Mischke

*To see the last show I organized and curated (AtroxSomes: The Savage Body @ The Northview Gallery) please visit - http://atroxsomes.blogspot.com/. And don't forget to "like" us on fb - https://www.facebook.com/PortlandKumite. Find the P.A.K. on the web at http://www.portlandartistskumite.info/.

story:
About the campaign:

This Indiegogo fundraising campaign is an opportunity to raise the funds necessary to mount five photographic exhibitions during 2013 and into 2014. These exhibitions are costly but with substantial contributions I could mount them and also launch permanent websites, upgrade my computer and camera in order to continue my artistic exploration.

These funds will also publish my book, Variations on a Sculpture by Calder, a collection of 60 photographs from the exhibit and original dramatic writing from me and my friend, poet Toni Asante Lightfoot.

 

What is needed?

Contribute

Send Campaign link to friends via social networks.

Send Campaign link via email

Use Talking Points to share Campaign information

Use Indiegogo “Share Tools”

 

Why give?

Artistic expression pleases the eye, soothes the soul, and provokes thought either in a gallery setting or one’s home.

The photographs I have created are an easy fit for the eye or the soul and they are images that one could notice in passing or ponder at length. They would fit well in many rooms in one’s home and they would provoke conversation among guests who visit.

All of these images, no matter when they were made throughout the last 40 plus years, mark moments of departure and launch pads to further artistic, visual expression and exploration.

 

What the Calder Series represents?

I am a photographic artist and throughout my 40 plus years career as an instructor and an artist, I have made pictures of everyday subjects. I consider these photographs profound as light illuminates ordinary things and makes them visually extraordinary. In the last three years I have focused my attention on the Alexander Calder sculpture, Two Disks, which sits in front of the Hirshhorn Museum on the National Mall in Washington, DC.

 

This new adventure of my artistic life has brought me to a fantastic opportunity to have five separate exhibitions during 2013 and into 2014. However, this great opportunity requires a great financial investment. Exhibits come with heavy costs: printing, matting, framing, promotions, postcards, invitations, catering, and transportation…they all add up to an expensive enterprise. This is why I need your help and all supporters will receive a signed, matted photograph from the collection as well as a commemorative poster as a thank you. 

 

The Alexander Calder sculpture, Two Disks, in addition to its obvious grace and beauty, has a resonant and compelling movement and a sensual dynamism that captivated my photographic eye. Each session I spent with the sculpture was spiritually moving to me as an artist.

I always sought to maintain the integrity of Calder’s single intention, which I perceived to be the inherent appearance of motion in the “disks” with their curvature, providing the viewer a beginning point and an end point. I began a serious interpretation of the sculpture.

 

There were additional elements to interplay with the “disks”: There was a crystalline blue sky and the subtle monochromatic façade of the museum that added new dimensions to the sculpture. The sun became prominent and my horizontal and vertical explorations were creating silhouettes that gave new meaning to Calder’s “disks” and indeed the central structure that held the sculpture up to the sun.

 

These initial renderings were only resonant in black and white since there was no color in the structure and against the sun and sky and building façade, there were only gradations of gray; it seemed to coincide with my continuing love affair with black and white photography.

 

There was a clear sun intrusion that emerged with my subsequent interpretations of the Calder sculpture. I saw it in different sensual tones and then made a leap into a color toning which translated gray tones into golden, sun-like renderings, I had not anticipated since I rarely make color photographs. I started playing with the sun and the golden influence it had with a newly discovered “pyramidic” intrusion. In many of the photographs, I noticed “pyramids” within images I captured. It had taken on an African-esque interpretation and a universal quality that allowed Calder to transcend what I had discovered weeks and months prior to that day.

 I have completed the prototype of my book on the Calder study. There are 60 photographs combined with my writing and the writing of my friend, poet Toni Asante Lightfoot. We crafted a photographic and poetic study of the Calder sculpture, Two Discs, that highlights its special qualities that are so compelling and powerful. The book will be published with these funds and signed early release copies will be given as perks to those who make large donations.

My Calder studies are not a culmination of 40 years of photography; they are yet another period in my career as a photographic artist. I know there’s more ahead and I am excited about the possibilities for the next 40
years.  

Your contribution will facilitate the following:

Print Production

Matting

Framing

Upgrades for computer and camera

Insurance

Transportation (zip cars and Metro)

Invitations

Postage

Reception

Commemorative Poster production

Promotion

Website Development and Hosting Fees

Publication of my book, Variations on a Sculpture by Calder.
