Exhibits come with heavy costs: printing, matting, framing, promotions, postcards, invitations, catering, and transportation…they all add up to an expensive enterprise. This is why I need your help and all supporters will receive a signed, matted photograph from the collection as well as a commemorative poster as a thank you. 
 
The Alexander Calder sculpture, Two Disks, in addition to its obvious grace and beauty, has a resonant and compelling movement and a sensual dynamism that captivated my photographic eye. Each session I spent with the sculpture was spiritually moving to me as an artist.
I always sought to maintain the integrity of Calder’s single intention, which I perceived to be the inherent appearance of motion in the “disks” with their curvature, providing the viewer a beginning point and an end point. I began a serious interpretation of the sculpture.
 
There were additional elements to interplay with the “disks”: There was a crystalline blue sky and the subtle monochromatic façade of the museum that added new dimensions to the sculpture. The sun became prominent and my horizontal and vertical explorations were creating silhouettes that gave new meaning to Calder’s “disks” and indeed the central structure that held the sculpture up to the sun.
 
These initial renderings were only resonant in black and white since there was no color in the structure and against the sun and sky and building façade, there were only gradations of gray; it seemed to coincide with my continuing love affair with black and white photography.
 
There was a clear sun intrusion that emerged with my subsequent interpretations of the Calder sculpture. I saw it in different sensual tones and then made a leap into a color toning which translated gray tones into golden, sun-like renderings, I had not anticipated since I rarely make color photographs. I started playing with the sun and the golden influence it had with a newly discovered “pyramidic” intrusion. In many of the photographs, I noticed “pyramids” within images I captured. It had taken on an African-esque interpretation and a universal quality that allowed Calder to transcend what I had discovered weeks and months prior to that day.
 I have completed the prototype of my book on the Calder study. There are 60 photographs combined with my writing and the writing of my friend, poet Toni Asante Lightfoot. We crafted a photographic and poetic study of the Calder sculpture, Two Discs, that highlights its special qualities that are so compelling and powerful. The book will be published with these funds and signed early release copies will be given as perks to those who make large donations.
My Calder studies are not a culmination of 40 years of photography; they are yet another period in my career as a photographic artist. I know there’s more ahead and I am excited about the possibilities for the next 40 years.
 
Your contribution will facilitate the following:
Print Production
Matting
Framing
Upgrades for computer and camera
Insurance
Transportation (zip cars and Metro)
Invitations
Postage
Reception
Commemorative Poster production
Promotion
Website Development and Hosting Fees
Publication of my book, Variations on a Sculpture by Calder.

story:
UPDATE:

There is a 2 for $25 special on perks until the end of the campaign! Donate 25 today and we will send you a digital copy of the DVD and Mix Tape (including performances and sound installations from the visual opera) To get this deal email us with "special" in the subject line at agalleryofthestreets@gmail[dot]com


Gallery of the Streets

                   an art and organizing hybrid aimed at decolonizing imagination.

                                                      


All too often we have seen marginalized groups excluded from, and/or exploited by, mainstream artistic and cultural endeavors. Therefore, Gallery of the Streets' work is primarily created for, by, and with, marginalized communities who have direct and daily experiences with racism, sexism, xenophobia, classism and poverty, heteronormativity and transphobia. Not only do our voices go unnoticed and unsupported, worse yet, our cultural and artistic contributions are co-opted and sold back to us. New Orleans-especially post-Katrina NOLA, is a prime example of these practices. In this sense, we believe that the process of art making as well as the work itself, can evoke strategies and actions to transform social ills.


With your contributions Gallery of the Streets can produce our first visual opera: 


ECOHYBRIDITY: LOVE SONG FOR NOLA,

a visual [black] opera in 5 movements

ECOHYBRIDITY is a collaborative partnership with New Orleans-based artists and organizers. The visual opera marks the 10th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina and examines issues connected to disaster capitalism, displacement, spatial inequities, the prison industrial complex, and the privatization of public resources from a Black feminist lens. A large-scale production featuring roving performances and site-specific installations throughout post-Katrina New Orleans, the plot follows a group of nomadic “SONGBIRDS” as they journey to recover, redefine, and reclaim Home.

The visual opera draws on the vision, memory, and skills of New Orleans-based Black feminist artists and organizers—many of whom survived Hurricane Katrina. Through on-going convening, documentation, evaluation, art-making, and collective study, we focus and drive the opera’s content, movements, mapping and impact(s). We are also developing ways to support those who remain displaced and are experiencing trauma ten years later. We aim to fuse public art and community engagement to confront power, provoke dialogue, and develop a cultural organizing praxis.

As its long-term goal, the project aims to serve as a mechanism to examine the creative and philosophical possibilities of Black geographies. Our point of departure is rooted in spatial equity—specifically as related to Black women’s lives.





Support Black Feminist Art and the people of New Orleans!

We need $25,000 dollars to produce ECOHYBRIDITY!

The production phase of this project includes working materials for 15 participants.  Materials include: projectors, paints, canvas, wood, nails, hammers, tool belts, wide angles lenses fabrics, thread, needles, extension cords, sound equipment and a stipend for each participating artist!

We also have some things to give back!


Check out our perks!

"Storm Series" prints by kai lumumba barrow

                                                            

             

see image gallery for print selections


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute money to this Indiegogo Campaign there are plenty of other ways to support! Please email us at agalleryofthestreets@gmail[dot]com if you are interested in any of the options below!

 

Artist + Organizer Collaboration to Mark the 10th Anniversary.

Our hope is that this project can be a pilot for principled solidarity- and movement-building. What does solidarity look like in this historical moment? Whether in NOLA or elsewhere, we would love for you to consider this question with your members, staff, board, and allies on the 10th anniversary.

  • If you are planning an event for Katrina +10, we are interested in participating in/collaborating with you on your COMMEMORATION EVENTS including marches, conferences, and vigils. We also invite you and your members, staff, board, constituents, and allies to attend or volunteer with the visual opera.
  • If you are in New Orleans during the anniversary, we invite you to work with an ECOHYBRIDTY artist to design an ORGANIZATIONAL DISPLAY for the Subversive Ball.
  •  If you cannot join us in NOLA, we would like you to organize a DAY OF ART and/or POLITICAL EDUCATION to examine questions of Black displacement,dispossession, and border-crossing from a Black feminist lens.

Giving Circles
(Creating an Ecology of Abundance, Accountability &Sustainability)
We would like to set-up Giving Circles for the 10th anniversary and beyond for specific costs
such as:

  • Transportation and housing for displaced Black feminist artists/organizers to come home for the 10th anniversary.
  • Printing and mailing costs for “Kites” or Letters of Solidarity from prisoners outside of NOLA to prisoners in Orleans Parish Prison.
  • Producing an exhibition catalog, 30-minute documentary, and popular education curriculum.
  •  Touring excerpts from the visual opera.
  • An evolving fund to build ECO-HOUSE, a space for Black feminist art and creativity in NOLA.

On-Going Collaboration.

To continue our commitment to New Orleans, we would like to work with New Orleanians throughout this anniversary year and beyond to construct strong replicable models that can show the impact of art, community engagement, and social change organizing. Would you consider sharing information and/or facilitating political education about your primary issues with Gallery of the Streets? Will you endorse the project?


The Impact

As Nomadic Interlopers (formerly known as "Outside Agitators"), Gallery of the Streets holds to a creed rooted in cooperation, respect, and shared interests. Our intention is to contribute our labor, resources, and ideas to the work going on in each location.

In this period of late capitalism, a time of alienation, hyperreality, surveillance, spatial and carceral control, a ruthless haint of transnational proportion is riding us for its own pleasures.

In this period of late capitalism, a super-security structure protects the interests of the 1 percent. And international law enforcement controls the vision, goals, movements, and native environments of the 99 percent.

In this period of late capitalism, Black life, especially Black queer life, is forced by choice and/or circumstance to perch outside mainstream narratives of Home. And yet, it is from this position of displacement that we create memories, transformation, and safety. Our relationship to home is charged and organic -- an experiment in reimagining and redefining ourselves and our safety. In this place we form deep communitytie -- rarely based on longevity or location, but more often, based in shared experience, mutual aid, resiliency, resourcefulness, and respect.



A Nomad Manifesto





1. This is a beginning... This is a movement... This is neither stagnant nor beige...

2. We see more when we use multiple sights. Collective visioning is groovy. The Nomad's work should reflect the vision and desires of the communities that will reap the benefits, accolades, backlash, and attack brought on by the work.

3. We call on Nommo and Sun Ra and the Funkadelic to turn a cacophony of sound into a shared language that can produce thoughtful and efficient decision-making, relationship-building, and shared knowledges.


 


4. We will be accountable to those whom we engage through direct and/or indirect contact. We walk with rememory.

5. We call for binaries to synthesize.

6. Our work should provide opportunities for viewers and makers to dialogue/disagree/ask for-about-/answer to-for-about/challenge.

7. The work should find and ride the pocket and be prepared to ride the groove until it is time to fade out ...

8. The nomad's swan song must be on the 1.

9. Be mindful of Kudzu and Passion Flowers. If desired by the Community, the Nomad should leave a small part of its mojo behind. But not too much...


    THANKS TO ALL OF YOU!!!

story:
Hey there, 

My name is Reggie and I'm starting up an indiegogo campaign to help my beautiful girlfriend Jessica McDonald finance her trip to Toronto so she can attend and sell her incredible work at the One of a Kind Show at the Direct Energy Centre.  Jessica was nominated and selected to go to this prestigious event by fellow members of the craft community in St. John's, NL.   This is such a tremendous honour  and I'm so excited to help make her dream of going a reality.   With travel costs sky rocketing and a variety of expenses that come along with such an event, I'm hoping this indiegogo campaign will inspire people to donate  to help cover some of her expenses in Toronto.   I am incredibly proud of her for what she has accomplished so far in her short career and I hope this will be the beginning of an exciting adventure in the craft world.  

The One of A Kind show is one of the biggest craft fairs in North America.  To give you an idea what this show is all about, it entails over 800 artisans and designers  which present their handcrafted goods to Toronto shoppers.  This show started out as a humble trade show in the mid-seventies and exploded into one of Toronto’s largest exhibitions of original arts and crafts. Everything on sale at the One of a Kind show was made by artisans living in North America.(www.oneofakindshow.com). The event will take place between the dates of Mar. 25-29th, 2015. 

I want to thank you again for taking the time to read my campaign and I hope this inspires you to donate to help Jess fulfill her dream of getting to Toronto!  If you feel like donating 5, 10, 20 or even 100 bucks, I would be forever grateful.  I can't think of any perks for donating but if you donate and want a hug, I will be most willing to give one. Bear hugs are my speciality.  Thanks everyone.  

Reggie

story:
I am Michael Anthony García an artist and curator based in Austin TX. I have been living and working here for almost thirteen years and feel that this community has had a profoud impact on my artistic career. Some of you may be familiar with another exhibition I curated at the Emma S. Barrientos Mexican American Cultural Center in the spring of 2010 with Los Outsiders. I am humbled to announce that I have been honored with the task of curating this year's iteration of Mexic-arte Museum's YLA (Young Latino Artist) exhibition series.

This exhibition series has played a big part in my artistic life in one way or another since I've lived here in Austin and was very anxious to take the reins. The excitement of opening this exhibition up to international artists, regardless of the extra budgetary constraints this adds, actually helped me develop the concept for this collection of works. 

I have selected an amazing group of artists to not only show their own work, but to collaborate on new artistic endeavors making their world debut in this exhibition. The selected Texas artists hail from Austin, Houston, Dallas and San Antonio. This year other cities represented are Bogota, Colombia as well as Mexico City and Guadalajara, Mexico. Keep an eye out here for the press release with a full list of the artists involved.

As you can imagine, opening up the exhibition to international artists adds a bit more of a strain to the budget we are working with at the museum. That is where you can be a part of this creative endeavor to help redefine what is presented as "Latino Art" and help foster extended communities and connections amongst artists.

The idea of “community” has various interpretations. At it’s core, it is about groups of people working together directly or in parallel and under a social contract, be it implicit or not. That idea is the centerpiece of “YLA 18: Con / Juntos,” this year’s iteration of the annual Young Latino Artist (YLA) Series at Mexic-Arte Museum. The title, which means “With / Together,” reinforces the importance of the joining of ideas and of individuals with a common cause, while also referencing the idea of conjuntos, a group of musicians collaborating and unifying their talents to create beautiful music for the public to partake.

Even with the YLA series’ inherently constraining eligibility for inclusion (being Latino within a particular age parameter), these limitations create an opportunity to explore and/or create community in different ways. Much like our true cultural reality, this community is comprised of individuals from our various Latino nationalities and cultures, gender identities, and sexual orientations. 

This exhibition is about nurturing a diverse community of individuals while paying reverence to a shared common space. The selected artists collaborated and opened their homes and studios to each other, sometimes across the globe via the internet, to create many of the works in this exhibition. From many voices, stories and ideas, a community is formed and compose a common song in “Con / Juntos.”

Please, help us reach our goal to make this a cultural focal point in this year's arts calendar and expand the ideas of "Latino Art" and community for the city of Austin. 
If anything, please help us get the word out about this campaign.

Thank you so much for your time, attention and assistance in sharing with your own networks!

story:
Summary

This is a Group Funding campaign. I am seeking your support to fund both the Project Materials, and an Artist's Website for a 2 Year Oil Painting Series that will explore the emotive perception of “Beauty” by the creation of "Mystery"or "Awe" via the obscuration of Primary ( and / or Secondary ) Light Sources, and through the Diffusion of Objects or Forms within the visual plane.

Two Year Material Requirements

PRODUCT DESCRIPTION Unit  PRICE   TOTAL 
Scheveningen Orange 225 ML Oil Paint 3.00    99.41  $     298.23
Permanent Green Deep 225 ML  Oil Paint 1.00    70.79  $       70.79
Titanium White 225 ML  Oil Paint 3.00    44.89  $     134.67
Scarlet Lake Extra 225 ML  Oil Paint 1.00    99.59  $       99.59
Burnt Umber 225 ML  Oil Paint 5.00    43.52  $     217.60
Caput Mortuum Violet 225 ML  Oil Paint 3.00    43.52  $     130.56
Mars Yellow 225 ML  Oil Paint 2.00    44.89  $       89.78
Scheveningen Orange 225 ML  Oil Paint 1.00    99.59  $       99.59
Scheveningen Blue 225 ML  Oil Paint 4.00    70.98  $     283.92
Yellow Ochre Deep 225 ML  Oil Paint 3.00    43.52  $     130.56
Burnt Sienna 225 ML  Oil Paint 5.00    43.52  $     217.60
Carmine Lake Extra 225 ML  Oil Paint 1.00  161.99  $     161.99
Ultramarine Blue 225 ML  Oil Paint 4.00    43.52  $     174.08
Old Holland Cold Grey 225 ML  Oil Paint 3.00    43.52  $     130.56
Alizarin Crimson Lake  225 ML  Oil Paint 3.00    99.41  $     298.23
Gamsol 128 OZ Can 3.00    29.39  $       88.17
Gamvar 5.4 OZ 4.00    11.31  $       45.24
Canvas Cotton Duck #10 50.00      7.58  $     379.00
Paint Brushes Raphael 357 Flat #4 20.00    11.02  $     220.40
Paint Brushes Raphael 3577 Filbert #6 25.00    12.07  $     301.75
Stretchers Bars 100CM X 100CM $2.97 / Ft 12.00    35.64  $     427.68
Stretchers Bars 100CM X 100CM $2.97 / Ft 10.00    47.52  $     475.20
Website   1.00  500.00  $     500.00
         
TOTAL        $  4,975.19

The Importance and The Impact

“..I wish to reaffirm the meaning of beauty, which has become maligned or obscured.   My work is a minimalistic representation, communicating the relationship between the transcendental and the ordinary not available in the various dogmas of abstraction or conventional realist styles.  I intend to the Transcendentalist view that any scene is a profound mystery existing as the mundane.  Using formalism, and an intuitive chromatic scale, the visually ephemeral and inconsequential is revealed as a moment of experiential wonderment.  Beauty, by Art or by Nature, has the capacity to awaken the feeling of awe, and awe is the emotional and bodily perception of the underlying Mystery of this ordinary experience..."

Joseph C Blanchette

Primarily autodidactic Joseph C. Blanchette's artistic influences range from Georgia O’Keefe, Casper David Frederick, Edward Hopper, Gerhard Richter, and Monet.  He painted as a non-degree student at the San Francisco Art Institute ( SFAI ) studying under Professors Jeremy Morgan, Dave Tangney and Carlos Via from 1994 through 2000.

Joseph C. Blanchette’s work arises from an almost “Coltrane-istic” desire to explore the transcendental using the confines of the existing representationalism and structure to seek out “Le Vraiment Beau” or the true and the beautiful which he believes “is” the felt perception of the transcendental within the conventional.

Jeremy Morgan
story_txt:
Summary
This is a Group Funding campaign. I am seeking your support to fund both the Project Materials, and an Artist's Website for a 2 Year Oil Painting Series that will explore the emotive perception of “Beauty” by the creation of "Mystery"or "Awe" via the obscuration of Primary ( and / or Secondary ) Light Sources, and through the Diffusion of Objects or Forms within the visual plane.

The Importance and The Impact
“..I wish to reaffirm the meaning of beauty, which has become maligned or obscured.   My work is a minimalistic representation, communicating the relationship between the transcendental and the ordinary not available in the various dogmas of abstraction or conventional realist styles.  I intend to the Transcendentalist view that any scene is a profound mystery existing as the mundane.  Using formalism, and an intuitive chromatic scale, the visually ephemeral and inconsequential is revealed as a moment of experiential wonderment.  Beauty, by Art or by Nature, has the capacity to awaken the feeling of awe, and awe is the emotional and bodily perception of the underlying Mystery of this ordinary experience..."
Joseph C Blanchette
Primarily autodidactic Joseph C. Blanchette's artistic influences range from Georgia O’Keefe, Casper David Frederick, Edward Hopper, Gerhard Richter, and Monet.  He painted as a non-degree student at the San Francisco Art Institute ( SFAI ) studying under Professors Jeremy Morgan, Dave Tangney and Carlos Via from 1994 through 2000.
Joseph C. Blanchette’s work arises from an almost “Coltrane-istic” desire to explore the transcendental using the confines of the existing representationalism and structure to seek out “Le Vraiment Beau” or the true and the beautiful which he believes “is” the felt perception of the transcendental within the conventional.
Jeremy Morgan

story:
The Texas Quilt Museum invites quilt lovers to help us purchase a state-of-the-art digital projector and large screen to enhance our public programming.  We are the only quilt museum in the American Southwest (texasquiltmuseum.org), celebrating our first-year anniversary!  (We are a 501 c 3 organization.)

WHY SHOULD YOU HELP?  This equipment will enable us to tell the story of quilts with top-quality images and narration to school groups and other visitors, complementing the current exhibition with in-depth information to pique the interest of everyone.  We believe that learning about quilts will encourage a deep sense of appreciation for American material culture and the historic role of women in the past and in the quilt art of today.

WHAT ARE YOU HELPING US PURCHASE?  If we reach our goal: a professional projector (5000 bright lumens) with built-in audio, and an electric screen, 45 x 80 inches, plus installation.  We need equipment of this quality because the room is rather large and we want to present quilts in the best possible light with true color.

WHY ARE WE ASKING FOR SO MUCH MONEY?  The projector alone costs more than $4000, and administrative costs from IndieGoGo and First Giving take more than ten percent.  Your receipt from The Quilt Institute will be emailed by First Giving, which manages the IndieGoGo non-profit campaigns.

If we happen to exceed our goal, additional funding will be applied to the Museum's exhibitions budget.  The image above shows you only a few of the spectacular antique quilts in our spring 2013 exhibiton, Flower Power.

Any amount of donation is very much appreciated.  Please note that, except for Canada, we are not able to ship gifts outside the U.S. because of excessive postal costs.

story:
The Forest Of Creation

The Forest of Creation is the first Temple at Midburn, Israel’s first regional Burning Man event. It is a community project made by the community, for the community. We are a group of artists, designers, engineers, hackers, and techies that want to make the first Israeli Regional Burning Man event unforgettable. This Temple will set the bar and stand to inspire our community for years to come.

Concept and Purpose

The Forest is an interactive architectural installation, searching for the origins of spiritual places in the context of the Burning Man community, and in our culture at large. It is inspired directly by the Temple at Black Rock City, and by our event's theme --- Genesis.

We sought to find the roots of spiritual spaces in our cultures and strip them down to their origins. Instead of drawing inspiration from temples, cathedrals, pyramids, etc., we reached back to the dawn of history and the natural places that have inspired reflection, social gathering, and peace.

Like the Temple at events before it, our Forest will provide a space for people to have these kinds of experiences. The structure we create is a canvas for the community to project their experience upon, in and around. The Temple's beauty and the image of the Forest in the Desert is just a tool and a beginning.

Design and Structure

The Forest of Creation is composed of a series of towers designed as deconstructed trees, which combine together to create a sacred space. This space is further subdivided into breathing spaces inside and between the structures. Each structure is unique in its construction and interactive potential, allowing participants to enter, discover compartments, connections, and unique perspectives upon the installation, event, and surroundings.

In addition to the structure, interactive elements of light and sound will respond gently to the play of wind and movement of visitors to the installation, creating haunting displays and other-worldly sound.

The Forest is a large logistical challenge and is created entirely by volunteers working in their spare (hah!) time. The sheer amount of materials and tools needed by the team is staggering, and exceeds the funds we have already raised. This is where you enter the picture… :P

What We Need & What You Get


We need 6,000 dollars. This cash will be used to pay for the constructive wood, bamboo, rope, electronics, screws and nails. Additionally, it will be used to pay for the trucks needed to move the materials, and the wood we have received from donors, to the construction zone on the playa. It will also enable us to procure the materials to properly and safely burn the installation, and the tools needed to clean it all up at the end and Leave No Trace.

It is a great privilege to take part in a large scale art project and to contribute to the growth of the local Burning Man community. We are proud to bring a project to life and gift it to others. You can take an active part in the project by contributing through our awesome gift tiers, and even be a part of the burn!

The Forest is already on its way to becoming a reality, with one structure already standing. Our vision is to create ten structures, and each contribution you make brings us closer to that goal. If we cannot reach our funding goals we are prepared with alternative designs using less materials and less trees. If we receive more than our goals, we are prepared to improve the structures and expand the Forest. If the money flows from you to us like a mighty river unleashed by the hope of millions and we cannot use it all, we will donate the excess to next year's temple team, whomever they will be.

The Impact

Here in Midburn and in the Forest of Creation team we believe that Radical Self Expressions should have no borders. We want the Forest to provide inspiration to our local community to dare to dream big and make those dreams a reality, and prove that a young and underfunded region can create worthy and powerful art.

There are many people in our region who can’t afford to reach Black Rock City, and we believe that they too deserve the experience of powerful spiritual catharsis just like in any other Burn.



Our Skillz and Cred

In 2013, the Midburn community was invited to present it’s first C.O.R.E project in BRC. We rose to the challenge and created the Hand of Inspiration [link]. Members of the Forest of Creation team planned, designed, built, and successfully burned the Hand, and we are now ready to do it again. Here at Midburn, we know how to build shit.

The members of the team are professional designers, civil engineers, artists, and craftsmen (and women!) who deal daily with projects of this scope, and we are ecstatic to do so together as a labor of love.

Hand Of Inspiration - C.O.R.E Burning Man 2013


We have already built one of the medium sized structures as a test and in exactly two weeks and two days we will have one of the large structures standing. We have already ordered the L.E.Ds (which have to come all the way from China), and at this point, nothing is going to stop us. Together we will create a reality in our local burn where there are no borders to imagination and no borders to art. Join us to find out just how far we can go!

Other Ways You Can Help

Most importantly, spread the word! Even if you give! Even if you just contribute a small amount; together we are many, and the more people there are who get a chance to be a part of this, the farther we will go.


Also, if you want to be a part of the build team, get in touch! We already have a few international crew members on board, and we welcome you with open arms.

If you are already coming, but do not have the ability to join the build, you can BYOT (Bring Your Own Tree). In the upcoming weeks, we will publish the complete design and building instructions of a small tree, and we invite you to build your own and bring it with you to join the Forest!

story:
Short Summary


Though I have been painting since my childhood, I feel as though I didn't really start to fall in sync with my art until the blossoming of Music's Brow, my first visionary inspired oil painting. The painting was inspired by the overindulgence of work for a monetary gain, an audiobook, music, and an Exit 308.

Since 2008 I have been traveling throughout the United States and several other countries observing their culture, art, and philosophies. I've been inspired by the countless musicians who have included me into their musical presentation. I'm inspired by the individuals who've attended the shows and by those who converse with me or those who do not. I'm inspired by silence and all sounds that surround me.

Alicia has painted with Emancipator, Dixon's Violon, Old Shoe,  Digital Tape Machine, EGI, Cosby Sweater, IndigoSun, Elephant Revival, Ott, Bluetech, Future Rock, and Keller Williams.  She has displayed work at festivals including Shoe Fest, Whippersnap, Camp Kind, Hyperion, and Wakarusa.

While music has inspired much of her work, many of her paintings include teachings and inspirations from her teacher Kalyani Ma Jaya, whom she has studied Vinyasa and Kali Natha Yoga. Through Kalyani's  teachings and guidance Alicia has become more in tune with the importance movement and sound intuitively effecting our nature.

Recently, Alicia was accepted to be a live painter at Envision Festival in Costa Rica.  Envision is one of the world's premier transformational festivals.  Last year's event played host to artists such as Alex Grey, Autumn Skye Morrison, Morgan Mandala, Mark Henson, and Juan Carlos Taminchi, to name only a few.  Alicia is honored to be blessed with the opportunity to show her work alongside some of the biggest names in Visionary Art.

A week after Envision, Alicia will be spending a week studying with renowned visionary artist Autumn Skye Morrison.

While Alicia was selected to be a live painter at Envision, all of the other expenses associated with going to an event in Central America fall on Alicia's shoulders.  Airfare.  Getting camping and art supplies there.  Transportation.  Lodging.  It all adds up quickly.  That's why Alicia needs your help to make this dream into a reality.

What Alicia Needs

Alicia is trying to raise at least $1000 to cover her expenses for the trip.

$1000 - This will cover airfare and other fees associated with traveling.

$1500 - This covers airfare and lodging.

$2500 - This covers airfare, lodging, and Autumn Skye's painting retreat.

While we know this is a lot of money to raise, any little bit helps.  Whatever money is raised helps to defer the out of pocket costs of the trip.

What You Get

Alicia is offering various types of artwork, including custom portraits.  I've given brief descriptions with the items.  If there are any questions feel free to message me.  I can be reached at intrinsicartists1@gmail.com.  I can provide far more detailed accounts of all of the options.

There are examples of all of the available prints in the gallery section.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  Please share this campaign via social media, word of mouth, or any by any other means you deem necessary. 

Alicia will also be running a sale on all of her original artwork via social media.

www.facebook.com/mojomuseart

www.facebook.com/intrinsicarts

Your help is greatly appreciated.

Thank You!

story: As a cook I have always wanted to print shirts for myself and friends but as a cook I can't fund a large run of shirts. My goal is offer limited run designs and when they are gone they are gone. These are ideas that are borne of working long hours in kitchens and brought on by too much coffee and bad jokes.

My goal is offer limited run designs and when they are gone they are gone. These are ideas that are borne of working long hours in kitchens and brought on by too much coffee and bad jokes.

story:
P.S. De campagne is voorbij. Wil je weten waar ik momenteel mee bezig ben? Kijk dan op mommersontwerp.nl

Trek de opdrachtgevers aan die bij jou passen

Scoren met de juiste vormgeving

  • Kom jij ook wel eens op websites terecht waar je zo gek wordt van de flikkerende kleuren, de grote hoeveelheid advertenties en de onduidelijke manier waarop je kunt navigeren, dat je meteen weer wegklikt?

Techneuten zeggen dat dat aan de slechte techniek ligt. Ik zeg dat het aan de vormgeving ligt. Websitevormgeving is een combinatie van gebruiksvriendelijkheid, de juiste techniek en een goede combinatie van kleur en typografie. Mis één aspect en je gaat de mist in.

  • Een van mijn zakelijke relaties is een fantastische ruimtelijk ontwerper. Zij ontwerpt stijlvolle en toch gedurfde, moderne badmeubels en -accessoires. Rond de feestdagen kreeg ik echter een nieuwjaarskaart met flauwe cartoons en slechte typografie. Rationeel weet ik dat het niets zegt over de ontwerpen die ik al had bewonderd. Toch daalden die in mijn achting.

Bij een tegenstrijdigheid in de vormgeving van de verschillende producten van jou als bedrijf of ondernemer, raakt je publiek in verwarring over jouw kwaliteiten.

  • Valt het je wel eens op dat sommige winkels helemaal vol staan met graaitafels en slordige bordjes, terwijl andere winkels veel lege ruimte hebben en een opgeruimde aanblik geven? De vormgeving van de ene soort winkel is niet beter dan die van de andere winkel. Beide trekken een bepaald soort publiek aan dat bij hen past.

De juiste vormgeving zegt niet veel over hoe iets er precies uitziet, maar alles over de doelgroep. Als je daar bij jouw vormgeving op let, heb je een goede kans op succes.

Vormgeving ondersteunt jouw onderneming. Zorg dat je de vormgeving hebt die bij je past.

  • Jij kent jouw onderneming het beste
  • Jij kent jouw opdrachtgevers het beste en weet wat zij van je verwachten
  • Jouw onderneming verdient de beste vormgeving

Of je die vormgeving nu zelf ter hand neemt of uitbesteedt aan een grafisch ontwerper, in beide gevallen heb je kennis van de basisbegrippen nodig. Mijn doel is het om jou daarin wegwijs te maken en jou zo zichtbaar beter te laten presteren.

Vormgeving telt

Over smaak valt te twisten. Dat is ook heel leuk om te doen. Maar goed en functioneel vormgeven is een vak. Je kunt je voordeel er mee doen als je daar meer van weet.

  • Wat is de betekenis en het belang van kleur? Of van letters?
  • Hoe zit het met de spaties tussen letters en woorden?
  • Wat zijn de beste regelafstanden?
  • Hoe verdeel je tekst en foto’s op een webpagina?
  • Werk je met een sjabloon of ga je voor maatwerk?

Smaken verschillen en daar valt over te twisten, maar over rendement denken we allemaal hetzelfde. In een onderzoeksrapport uit 2010 van de Erasmusuniversiteit en TU Delft staat: “De financiële prestatie van een nieuw product is bijna 20% beter als er bij de ontwikkelingsfase veel aandacht wordt besteed aan design”.

Wil jij beter presteren?

Ik wil je helpen om terug te gaan naar de basis. Vormgeving is een proces dat zich in je hoofd afspeelt en niet op het toetsenbord. Hoe geef je wat in jouw hoofd zit zo vorm dat jouw opdrachtgevers begrijpen wat jij bedoelt en dat ze tegelijkertijd jouw professionaliteit ervaren, zowel online als offline? Wordt 2015 zo jouw beste jaar ooit?

Profiteer van mijn 30 jaar ervaring

In juli 2015 bestaat mijn bedrijf Mommersontwerp 30 jaar. De techniek van mijn vak is in die tijd volledig veranderd, van analoog - met potlood, pen en papier - naar digitaal - met computers. Was de tijd van potlood, pen en papier nog overzichtelijk, in de digitale wereld speelt vormgeving de hoofdrol en verandert de techniek doorlopend. Voor gebruikers van computerprogramma’s – en wie is dat tegenwoordig niet? - kan dit behoorlijk verwarrend zijn.

Met kennis meer invloed

Om mijn kennis en ervaring over digitale (en analoge) vormgeving op jou als ondernemer over te brengen, heb ik de afgelopen jaren een aantal boeken geschreven.

  • Waar komen ideeën vandaan voor een goede vormgeving?
  • Wat is een goede vormgeving? Een vormgeving die resultaten boekt! Ja, maar hoe?
  • Krijg je de vormgeving die je verdient? Investeren en vormgeven.
  • Hoe zet je jouw technische middelen in voor een goed vormgevingsresultaat?
  • Hoe krijg je goede vormgeving? Met een praktisch plan.

Daarnaast vind je tips op mijn blog. In 2015 ga ik hier mee door, ook door webinars  en korte (instructie-)videos aan te bieden.

Wat vinden anderen?

Over mijn werkwijze zegt Kees Zwanenburg, filmmaker: "Hannie combineert in mijn ogen het vakmanschap van een traditionele typograaf met de elementaire kennis van een moderne webdesigner. Een combinatie, die ik nog niet ben tegengekomen. Naast de kwaliteit van het geleverde werk was ik ook onder de indruk van de heldere uitleg, waarmee zij ons door het creatieve proces meenam."

En vindt Frank van Gool, ondernemer en trainer in de zorgsector: "Het is altijd weer mooi om te zien wat Hannie maakt van mijn vage ideeën en schetsen. Een mooi logo en huisstijl waar Trifier en SLiM-strategie professioneel mee voor de dag kunnen komen!"

Over een van mijn boeken zegt Sylvia Tóth, ondernemer: "Kies uit wat bij jou past, probeer je te onderscheiden en als je daarbij net zo secuur te werk gaat als Hannie Mommers in "Overtuig je klant. Overtuig met je visitekaartje." heeft gedaan, dan is succes verzekerd."

Met deze campagne wil ik mijn kennis en ervaring delen voor meer resultaat met een professionele vormgeving die bij jou en je bedrijf past

Ik zou het fantastisch vinden als jij me wilt ondersteunen in mijn streven om ondernemers zichtbaar beter te laten presteren. Op een platform als Indiegogo werkt dat met zogenaamde perks, te vertalen als voordeel of gunst.

Als je €5 in mijn campagne investeert, krijg je het whitepaper "Tien tips voor een betere vormgeving", waarin ik aan de hand van tien voorbeelden van hele gewone vormgeving van alledag uitleg hoe die met wat simpele aanpassingen merkbaar effectiever kan worden.

Als je €20 in mijn campagne investeert, ontvang je mijn eBook "Zichtbaar beter presenteren". Naast mijn uitleg over de zichtbare do's en dont's in een presentatie komen acht presentatie-experts aan het woord met tips zodat ook jij jouw presentatie kunt verbeteren.

Heb je "Zichtbaar beter presenteren" liever als boek in je handen kies dan voor de perk van €25. Dat boek is nu in productie en zal in april worden geleverd.

Investeer je €50 in mijn campagne, dan stuur ik je "Overtuig je klant. Overtuig met je visitekaartje." en "Zichtbaar beter presenteren", alsmede "Tien tips voor een betere vormgeving" en "Inspiratie halen uit een alfabet".

Organiseer je weleens avonden voor jouw netwerk of service-club en zoek je daar een goede invulling voor, laat mij dan een lezing over vormgeving geven.

Voor vier EarlyBirds heb ik een speciale perk. Ik kom voor €150 naar jouw locatie met een verhaal over huisstijlen, auteursrecht of vormgeving.

Kies jouw favoriete perk uit de kolom rechts en deel het met je netwerk.

Ik dank je heel hartelijk voor je steun!!
 
P.S. De campagne is voorbij. Wil je weten waar ik momenteel mee bezig ben? Kijk dan op mommersontwerp.nl

 

Jouw onderneming verdient een goede vormgeving!
story_txt:
P.S. De campagne is voorbij. Wil je weten waar ik momenteel mee bezig ben? Kijk dan op mommersontwerp.nlTrek de opdrachtgevers aan die bij jou passen
Scoren met de juiste vormgeving
Kom jij ook wel eens op websites terecht
waar je zo gek wordt van de flikkerende kleuren, de grote hoeveelheid
advertenties en de onduidelijke manier waarop je kunt navigeren, dat je meteen
weer wegklikt?
Techneuten zeggen dat dat aan de slechte techniek ligt. Ik
zeg dat het aan de vormgeving ligt. Websitevormgeving is een combinatie van gebruiksvriendelijkheid, de juiste techniek en een goede combinatie van kleur en typografie. Mis één aspect en je gaat de mist in.
Een van mijn zakelijke relaties is een
fantastische ruimtelijk ontwerper. Zij ontwerpt stijlvolle en toch gedurfde,
moderne badmeubels en -accessoires. Rond de feestdagen kreeg ik echter een
nieuwjaarskaart met flauwe cartoons en slechte typografie. Rationeel weet ik
dat het niets zegt over de ontwerpen die ik al had bewonderd. Toch daalden die
in mijn achting. 
Bij een tegenstrijdigheid
in de vormgeving van de verschillende producten van jou als bedrijf of
ondernemer, raakt je publiek in verwarring over jouw kwaliteiten. 
Valt het je wel eens op dat sommige
winkels helemaal vol staan met graaitafels en slordige bordjes, terwijl andere
winkels veel lege ruimte hebben en een opgeruimde aanblik geven? De vormgeving
van de ene soort winkel is niet beter dan die van de andere winkel. Beide
trekken een bepaald soort publiek aan dat bij hen past.
De juiste vormgeving
zegt niet veel over hoe iets er
precies uitziet, maar alles over de doelgroep.
Als je daar bij jouw vormgeving op let, heb je een goede kans op succes.
Vormgeving ondersteunt jouw onderneming. Zorg dat je de vormgeving hebt die
bij je past.


Jij kent jouw onderneming het beste

Jij kent jouw opdrachtgevers het beste en weet wat zij van je verwachten 

Jouw onderneming verdient de beste vormgeving

Of je die vormgeving nu zelf ter hand neemt of uitbesteedt
aan een grafisch ontwerper, in beide gevallen heb je kennis van de basisbegrippen nodig. Mijn doel is het om jou daarin wegwijs te maken en jou
zo zichtbaar beter te laten presteren.
Vormgeving telt
Over smaak valt te twisten. Dat is ook heel leuk om te doen. Maar goed en functioneel vormgeven is een vak. Je kunt je voordeel er mee doen als je daar meer van weet.


Wat is de betekenis en het belang van kleur? Of van letters? 

Hoe zit het met de spaties tussen letters en woorden? 

Wat zijn de beste regelafstanden? 

Hoe verdeel je tekst en foto’s op een webpagina? 

Werk je met een sjabloon of ga je voor maatwerk? 

Smaken verschillen en daar valt over te twisten, maar over
rendement denken we allemaal hetzelfde. In een onderzoeksrapport uit 2010 van de Erasmusuniversiteit en TU Delft staat: “De financiële prestatie van een nieuw product is bijna 20% beter als er
bij de ontwikkelingsfase veel aandacht wordt besteed aan design”.
Wil jij beter presteren?
Ik wil je helpen om terug te gaan naar de basis. Vormgeving
is een proces dat zich in je hoofd afspeelt en niet op het toetsenbord. Hoe
geef je wat in jouw hoofd zit zo vorm dat jouw opdrachtgevers begrijpen wat jij
bedoelt en dat ze tegelijkertijd jouw professionaliteit
ervaren, zowel online als offline? Wordt 2015 zo jouw beste jaar ooit?
Profiteer van mijn 30 jaar ervaring 
In juli 2015 bestaat mijn bedrijf Mommersontwerp 30 jaar. De
techniek van mijn vak is in die tijd volledig veranderd, van analoog - met
potlood, pen en papier - naar digitaal - met computers. Was de tijd van
potlood, pen en papier nog overzichtelijk, in de digitale wereld speelt vormgeving
de hoofdrol en verandert de techniek doorlopend. Voor gebruikers van computerprogramma’s
– en wie is dat tegenwoordig niet? - kan dit behoorlijk verwarrend zijn. 
Met kennis meer invloed
Om mijn kennis en
ervaring over digitale (en analoge) vormgeving op jou als ondernemer over te brengen, heb ik de afgelopen jaren een aantal boeken geschreven. 


Waar komen ideeën vandaan voor een goede vormgeving?

Wat is een goede vormgeving? Een vormgeving die resultaten boekt! Ja, maar
hoe?

Krijg je de vormgeving die je verdient? Investeren en vormgeven.

Hoe zet je jouw technische middelen in voor een goed vormgevingsresultaat?

Hoe krijg je goede vormgeving? Met een praktisch plan.

Daarnaast vind je tips op mijn blog. In 2015 ga ik hier mee
door, ook door webinars  en korte (instructie-)videos
aan te bieden.
Wat vinden anderen?
Over mijn werkwijze zegt Kees Zwanenburg, filmmaker:
"Hannie combineert in mijn ogen het
vakmanschap van een traditionele typograaf met de elementaire kennis van een moderne webdesigner. Een combinatie,
die ik nog niet ben tegengekomen. Naast de kwaliteit van het geleverde werk was
ik ook onder de indruk van de heldere
uitleg, waarmee zij ons door het creatieve proces meenam."

zorgsector: "Het is altijd weer mooi om te zien wat Hannie maakt van mijn
vage ideeën en schetsen. Een mooi logo en huisstijl waar Trifier en
SLiM-strategie professioneel mee voor de
dag kunnen komen!"
Over een van mijn boeken zegt Sylvia Tóth, ondernemer:
"Kies uit wat bij jou past, probeer je te onderscheiden en als je daarbij
net zo secuur te werk gaat als Hannie Mommers in "Overtuig je klant. Overtuig met je visitekaartje." heeft
gedaan, dan is succes verzekerd."

met een professionele vormgeving die bij jou en je bedrijf past

in mijn streven om ondernemers zichtbaar
beter te laten presteren. Op een platform als Indiegogo werkt dat met

Voor vier EarlyBirds heb ik een speciale perk. Ik kom voor

story:
Hey there!

We're the graduates from the RMIT Advanced Diploma of Graphic Design, 2014. After two long years, we've compiled our work into an exhibition and would love to share this with you. 

Our exhibition 'Great Dreamers' will be held at 33 Lygon Street, Carlton and will be open to the public starting Tuesday 2, 2014 to Thursday 4, 2014 at 10AM to 4PM, with grand event opening on Thursday 4 December, 2014 at 6PM to 8:00PM.


Can you help?

To ensure the success of this exhibition, we're looking to raise $1000.00 to help us with printing, supplies and catering. Ten dollars would go a long way to making this a great night!


In return you will receive:

  • An exclusive invite to our opening party (food and drinks provided) and a chance to see the work you're supporting up close
  • A secured copy of our limited edition catalogue
  • Plenty of good karma

Would you like to keep up to date with our exhibition?

Check out our website: www.greatdreamers2014.com
Follow us on Instagram: @GREATDREAMERS2014
Follow us on Twitter: @Great_Dreamers
Like us on Facebook: Great Dreamers 2014

story: PB&J Theatre Factory is expanding to an international festival. In July of 2016 we will be traveling to Calgary Fringe, and could use your support! The money that you donate will help us with travel, shipping of props and set pieces, lodging, and other production costs. Thank you very much for your support!

story:
This year, a new temple will silhouette the skies at AfrikaBurn: the Temple of Gratitude.

As always, the temple will offer a space for meditation and reflection, a place for mourning and a place for honouring. However, our hope is that in 2017 it will also provide a space for gratitude, a sanctuary where we can all give thanks for life’s many gifts.

The mostly mad and certainly fantastic crew bringing the temple to AfrikaBurn 2017 loves two things: building big structures and sharing them with others. We’re gardeners and engineers, architects and storytellers, astrophysicists, healers, educators and friends. And, perhaps most importantly, we’re people who are grateful for the many lessons that AfrikaBurn has taught us in its playful yet powerful way: lessons about authenticity, respect, creativity, freedom, love and connection. This year’s temple is an expression of our immense gratitude for this experience, and for the many people who make it possible.

This is a creative project, entirely volunteer-run, with a vision to create beautiful art while facilitating positive shifts in the world around us. Read more to see how you can help to make our project a reality.

 

Design Inspiration

The design of the Temple of Gratitude is based on the Irish father-daughter knot which, as legend goes, is tied by a girl at her father’s deathbed. The four edges that point inward symbolise family members looking in towards the father. This design, however, is also often interpreted as a symbol of gratitude.

The temple will have a hall-like ground floor, with the father-daughter knot painted on the floor. Steps at the back of the temple will lead to the second floor, which has the shape of the knot’s inner winged cross. Arches in the shape of half the knot flank the second floor.

 

The Temple of Gratitude, which stands 8m high and has a footprint of about 100m2, requires a whopping 8 tonnes of wood, additional steel and several thousand screws and nails. The whole structure also needs to be transported all the way from Johannesburg to Tankwa Town.

We’ve already covered the cost of some of the materials, but we’d so appreciate a little bit of help.

 

What we need:

If heaps of passion and a love for sawdust (and desert dust, of course) were the only things required to build the temple, we’d be ready to head into the Karoo. However, we’re also going to need a little bit of money. Well, more than a little: R258,938 to be exact. We were fortunate to be awarded some funding from AfrikaBurn’s art grant (which is why we’ve already started building), but it’s not quite enough to bring our project to completion.

Fundraising goal 1: Help us get the temple to the playa

We need to raise $7500 (R97,000) to fund the remainder of our building materials and transport costs of getting the pre-built components of the temple to the playa to be assembled.

 

Fundraising goal 2: Bling!

The temple needs some bling! By day, we believe that the temple is going to look spectacular, but by night… Well, we have a vision of it being something different altogether. We have some basic lights already, but would love to light it up spectacularly. To make this happen, we would like to spend about $1500 on additional lighting and pyrotechnics. 

Giving back: Our charity

The Temple Crew is passionate about giving back to our community. Our charity of choice is a not-for-profit community organisation that focusses on how horses can positively impact people and help to change lives for the better. Shumbashaba’s Horses Helping People programmes reaches out to the community of Diepsloot. A neighbouring township on the northern outskirts of Johannesburg, Diepsloot is home to some 250,000 people and unemployment, poverty and crime are rampant. ​Our Crew is committing to build a jungle gym at Shumbashaba as well as  volunteeer at their Saturday development programme once we've completed the project. 

Our Inspiration

We define gratitude as an expression of appreciation for what one has as opposed to a consumer-driven focus on what one wants. Studies show that we can deliberately cultivate gratitude, and can increase our well-being and happiness by doing so. The expression of gratitude – and especially the expression of it to others – is also associated with increased energy, optimism and empathy.

“Every year I have been to AfrikaBurn, I have learnt something. Over the years I have developed an immense gratitude for these lessons, and for the Burn for facilitating them. I am grateful for the fact that we are able to have such a privilege to learn and play in such a powerful way.

With this in mind, I designed the temple based on the concept of gratitude – so that I could say thank you. And so that I could remind others of the power that lies in this simple concept that we so often overlook.” – Walter Böhmer, Creative Lead

Many of our crew were part of the temple crews for previous AfrikaBurns including Metamorphosis (the butterfly), Awakening (the lotus) and the Grateful Heart. There are also some newcomers whose fiery optimism and enthusiasm suggests that they’ve always been Burners. We are all passionate about the Burn and have volunteered hundreds of hours already to make this project happen.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Workshop space

Due to unforeseen circumstances, we lost our workshop space just before we were scheduled to start building, a hiccup that had both practical and financial implications. However, in true Burner spirit, we made a plan, and we’re now building at two crew members’ homes as well as a warehouse. Johannesburg is a sprawling city and moving between our build locations takes some commitment. Fortunately, we’ve got plenty of that, we are well on track with our build schedule and are having heaps of fun in the process.

  • Safety

As the description suggests, the structure is complex, and since it involves two floors, safety is our primary concern. We have engaged with a structural engineer who has provided us with formal sign-off on structural safety and with whom we have discussed the temple’s design and build, taking into account the often difficult building conditions in the Karoo.

 

Other ways you can help

We understand that you might not be able to contribute financially, but we’d still appreciate you helping us in any other way you can. You might consider:

  • Liking our Facebook page and sharing our stories
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools to help us raise awareness
  • Volunteering at or attending our fundraiser events. More information can be found on the event’s Facebook page. Please contact us if you’re interested

 

 

Perks

This project wouldn't be possible without your support. Check out the incredible list of perks that we’ve put together as a token of our gratitude.

 

Please remember to share the campaign with your friends and family – every little bit helps.

 

With gratitude and love,

 

The Temple Crew

story:
The Śiṣya

The Śiṣya (pronounced Shi-shya) is an experiential art installation about loss and personal transformation. The name, "Śiṣya", is sanskrit for student, and is intended to remind us that our greatest losses can be our greatest teachers. 

The structure is composed of two mirrored winding passageways peeling away from a 16’ high spiraling core. Winding through the structure is like navigating the cyclical nature of our thoughts as we grieve. The peaks of the outer walls get higher and higher toward the center to reflect the increasing intensity of emotion as we approach our core truths. Standing in the center of the piece symbolizes the courage it takes to acknowledge our immeasurable capacity for growth, creativity, compassion, and renewal. 

In the center of the piece, people will be encouraged to write their own stories of transformation on the walls, leaving them behind for others. At the end of the week, The Śiṣya will be burned to memorialize the release of all our collected stories.



Our Team

Rob Bell has been building Burning Man art since 2004, and is the the creator of Zonotopia, a fantasy-like architectural system combining art, engineering and love. The zomes are not only beautiful, but also engineered to be pieced together by hand eliminating the potential for MOOP from nails or on-playa cutting.

Krista Sanders is a product and experience designer driven by a commitment to empathic and compassionate design in which a participant’s emotional well-being is the first consideration.

Our camp is Friendlandia, best known for its Friendgagement ceremonies in which friends exchange loving memories in a ceremony aimed at celebrating the magnitude of their friendship and the impact it’s had on their lives.



Thank you gifts!!!

Donate now to help us bring this healing installation to the playa.



Total Project Costs: $15,000

Build costs: $12,000

  • Structural wood, assembly, storage, studio fees, equipment rental: $7,000

  • 2,000 LEDs: $3,000

  • Transportation: $1,000

  • Burn supplies (fuel, kindling, safety equipment): $500

  • Leave No Trace supplies (shovels, metal trash cans, magnetic rakes): $500

Fees and reward fulfillment: $3,000

  • Indiegogo + credit card fees: $1,500

  • Reward shipping cost (estimated): $700

  • Reward materials cost (estimated): $800


Want to contribute in other ways?

Awesome! If this project speaks to you, there are many more ways you can help.

  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or email your friends!.

  • Invite your friends to our fundraising event on Wednesday July 6th in San Francisco.

  • If you’re an SF local, come help us cut and paint some wood!

  • Wanna help out on Playa? We’ll need help with construction, burn perimeter, and post-burn clean up.

Bottom line, give us a shout, if you want to take part and not sure how. :)
story_txt:
The ŚiṣyaThe Śiṣya (pronounced Shi-shya) is an experiential art installation about loss and personal transformation. The name, "Śiṣya", is sanskrit for student, and is intended to remind us that our greatest losses can be our greatest teachers. 
The structure is composed of two mirrored winding passageways peeling away from a 16’ high spiraling core. Winding through the structure is like navigating the cyclical nature of our thoughts as we grieve. The peaks of the outer walls get higher and higher toward the center to reflect the increasing intensity of emotion as we approach our core truths. Standing in the center of the piece symbolizes the courage it takes to acknowledge our immeasurable capacity for growth, creativity, compassion, and renewal. 
In the center of the piece, people will be encouraged to write their own stories of transformation on the walls, leaving them behind for others. At the end of the week, The Śiṣya will be burned to memorialize the release of all our collected stories.
Our TeamRob Bell has been building Burning Man art since 2004, and is the the creator of Zonotopia, a fantasy-like architectural system combining art, engineering and love. The zomes are not only beautiful, but also engineered to be pieced together by hand eliminating the potential for MOOP from nails or on-playa cutting.Krista Sanders is a product and experience designer driven by a commitment to empathic and compassionate design in which a participant’s emotional well-being is the first consideration.Our camp is Friendlandia, best known for its Friendgagement ceremonies in which friends exchange loving memories in a ceremony aimed at celebrating the magnitude of their friendship and the impact it’s had on their lives.
Thank you gifts!!!
Donate now to help us bring this healing installation to the playa.








Total Project Costs: $15,000Build costs: $12,000
Structural wood, assembly, storage, studio fees, equipment rental: $7,000
2,000 LEDs: $3,000
Transportation: $1,000
Burn supplies (fuel, kindling, safety equipment): $500
Leave No Trace supplies (shovels, metal trash cans, magnetic rakes): $500
Fees and reward fulfillment: $3,000
Indiegogo + credit card fees: $1,500
Reward shipping cost (estimated): $700
Reward materials cost (estimated): $800
Want to contribute in other ways?Awesome! If this project speaks to you, there are many more ways you can help.
Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or email your friends!.
Invite your friends to our fundraising event on Wednesday July 6th in San Francisco.
If you’re an SF local, come help us cut and paint some wood!
Wanna help out on Playa? We’ll need help with construction, burn perimeter, and post-burn clean up.
Bottom line, give us a shout, if you want to take part and not sure how. :)

story:
My campaign management consists of some top professionals in the field:

Patrick Davis, Political Consultant; Holly Villa, Director of Volunteers; Anne Marie Yanez, Treasurer; Jerry Grotkier, Research;  Susan Parr, Graphics Design;  Tom McClintock and Sherm Kempp, Social Marketing.

Our over-all goal is $150,000.  For the purposes of this campaign, the goal is $25,000.  Fund raising in a campaign is so important for various reasons.  The cost of printing and advertising to get my message out to those who need to know I'm their option in the State House of Representatives.  Our freedoms are being watered down like never before and we need to stop  government over-regulation!  Although, it won't be pleasant, I will be fighting a battle when we get closer to November 8th.  In order to answer claims which may be unfounded or exaggerated, I must be funded adequately.  The maximum allowable donation is $400 per individual/Limited Liability Corporation, only.  The law ensures that I am not able to raise large amounts of money from any individual.  If you have any questions,  Please feel free to contact me whenever you have a question.  Please go to my website to read more about the issues and where I stand.  I welcome discussion, always.  Thank you for your time, Sonya Rose

  • Discounts to planned events.
  • If we don't reach our goal, your funds will be used for this campaign according to Campaign Finance Laws of the State of Colorado.

More about Sonya Rose

Sonya will work hard to make the best use of your dollars.  Be assured that she is totally committed to serving you.  Until November 8th, she is walking local neighborhoods and introducing herself to everyone in the community.  Sonya's win will make all the difference in the House of Representatives.  The Old Establishment in Denver likes to keep the status-quo.  Sonya Rose, will work to change all of that.  Sonya Rose is accomplished, self-motivated, and performance-driven, experienced in negotiating contracts, initiating proposals, and cultivating productive relationships with clients. Possessing a broad-based background in supervising personnel, managing budgets and communicating with staff to ensure smooth flow of operations. Sonya Rose is recognized as an innovative thinker and team player, Sonya demonstrates strong communication and interpersonal skills.  Her great work ethic and refined business acumen will bring the Fresh Air of Change to the House of Representatives in Denver. 

  • My project is important for the whole state of Colorado.
  • Successes includes raising a thirteen year old with special needs while growing several businesses.
  • Having made money when the economy was good and lost money when the economy was bad gives Sonya insight to work hard on Colorado's economic needs.

Sonya Rose says:

It is very difficult to raise money for a campaign such as this one, but with the support of those who are like-minded and have the desire for change, we are able to accomplish what WE BELIEVE IN!  Others should not stand in the way of what is needed to be done, so lets not let that happen!   We need to prove to everyone that we are able to succeed with those would be naysayers left in the dust!

Keep these attributes on your mind as we work toward our goal!

  • Optimism and forward thinking.
  • Persistence and perseverance.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you can't help financially, and you know Sonya Rose, please feel free to post positive attributes that you know of about Sonya.
  • Post and forward this message to all of your friends by using  Indiegogo's sharing tools!

And that's all there is to it.  Have a happy day...

story:
Short Summary

The Galway Fringe Fest is running at the same time as the Galway Arts Festival and Galway Film Fleadh in Galway City. It has all the ingredients of an Arts Festival and offers many artists a chance to show their work to the thousands of those who will come to Galway for the Galway Arts Festival and Volvo Ocean Race. 'A Picture A Day from Galway Bay' is a collection of limited edition fine art prints of paintings and photography from Irish based artists. Four of the six represented stem from the same family. They range in age from 21 to 81. "A Picture A Day from Galway Bay" is part of the "Art of Galway"exhibit which will be showing in the Claddagh Hall, Galway. Over 50 artist will be represented in that show. Entry is free and it runs from July 12th through the 30th. Opening hours are from 11am until 6pm.We have been listed in the programme. We have the prints made, but are in desperate need of framing. It is a rare chance for the above artists to show their work to such a large audience. It is a project very dear to my heart as it is a family project along with two very close friends. Please help us achieve our goal. All donations are welcome, we need about 1,200 euro to frame all the works.
 
Each contributor will recieve a letter of contribution. Pledges of 15.00 USD/Euro will recieve a jpeg image from the exhibit to print whatever size they'd like. Pledges of $25.00 USD/Euro or more will recieve a print from one of the shows. The prints get larger with larger pledges.Any Pledge of 100.00 USD/Euro will recieve a framed print from the show. All Pledges of 500.00 USD/Euro or more will also recieve a framed print and enable contributor to share a night out in Galway whenever they come. Theresa will meet you for some great traditional music played all round Galway and fill you in on all the good stuff happening when you visit.
 
Participating Artists:
 
Theresa Daly, native New Yorker living in Galway since 1995. Painter,poet,photographer,videographer. Daughter of a Limerick man and Kerry woman. Has exhibited in New York and Galway. Worked as presenter,editor,director,camerawoman for Riverdale CATV and WNYE in New York. Her work focused on Irish artists practicing in New York.
 
Marjorie Daly, Limerick native and first cousin of Theresa. Marjorie has been the In House Artist for the Limerick Civic Trust for the past 13 years. Her work is in several private and corporate collections and she has been commissioned to create various pieces for prominent Limerick organisations. Marjorie also conducts an Art Course in the Limerick Civic Trust buildings.
 
Noel Daly, Limerick native and father of Marjorie,uncle of Theresa and grand uncle of David Rose. Noel has been painting for many decades. This is his first Fringe exhibit.
 
David Rose, Limerick native and cousin to Marjorie and Theresa, grand nephew of Noel.Painter and Sculptor with natural talent; David has just finished a portfolio course in L.C.F.E. This is his first Fringe exhibit. There will be much more to come from this man.
 
Brendan Carey, Galway native. Brendan has been writing for several years and has found a new passion for photography. This is his first Fringe exhibit.
 
Deirdre Mulvenna, from the Glens of Antrim, creates unique pen and ink works. They have a Celtic flair running through. This is her first Fringe exhibit.
 
If you are unable to contribute, you can still help by getting the word out-please share this campaign with others on Facebook,Twitter,MySpace,Linked-In. Thanks for any help.

story:
Featuring lectures by lumanaries such as Alex and Allyson Grey, Paul Stamets, Rick Doblin, Daniel Pinchbeck, and more! 

What is Palenque Norte? 

“It’s like TED talks for Psychedelics” 

The Palenque Norte Speaker Series is a series of lectures focused on altered states of consciousness, psychedelic medicines, and the mystical experience. We will be returning to the Burning Man festival for the first time since 2007, and need your help to make this happen. We’ve put together an amazing schedule of 22 speakers across 4 days. The talks will hosted by Camp Above the Limit and be located in the Crystal Cavern, a 40’ dome at 9:15 & B. 

Check out the full schedule and audio from past lectures at: http://www.matrixmasters.com/pn/

Why is this great for the world?

At the core, we’re about spreading information. There is so much mis-information in the world surrounding the use of Psychedelics, and we’re here to tell a different story. With your help we will produce what will be the best Psychedelic lecture series Burning Man has ever seen, and we will prepare recordings and videos to be distributed via the Psychedelic Salon podcast and the web to share the lectures. Tens of thousands of people will have access to these talks and videos over the years to come.

Why do we need money?

We need your help this year to bring Palenque Norte back to the playa. Your support will be used to purchase A/V equipment such as a PA system, a projector, a screen, and microphones. We also need funds for brochures, signage, posters, and décor, and any additional funding will be contributed to the Psychedelic Salon to help produce the podcasts.

After the event, not only will the A/V gear be used for future burns, it will be available for use in the community and partner organizations such as the Psychedelic Society of San Francisco. In this way we can continue to hold space for public discussion on psychedleics. 

If we don’t reach our goal, we’ll use what we have and what you’ve given us to pull things together. The show must go on!

What’s in it for you?

Besides helping a great cause to spread information about altered states of consciousness and psychedelic medicines around the globe, you’ll get some perks:

To start we’ll send you a personal thank you, commemorative postcard and a limited brochure. From there, donation levels go up to provide additonal collectibles such as DVDs of the lectures, signed copies of “The Terence McKenna Experience” movie, signed copies of Lorenzo Haggerty's "The Spirit of the Internet and invites to a private party in San Francisco. 

Why should you trust us?

The organizer of this year’s speaker series, Chris Pezza, successfully organized a similar lecture series at Burning Man 2011, called the Saraswati Speaker Series. Over 5 days the Saraswati Speaker Series brought together over twenty thought-leaders in the realms of digital rights & privacy and psychedelic research, drawing more than thousand attendees throughout the week.  The Saraswati Speaker Series was also featured on ReadWriteWeb: http://rww.to/vJHpm6

Chris is being supported by previous Palenque Norte organizers Lorenzo Hagerty and Bruce Damer. Their leadership is responsible for all the amazing Palenque Norte lectures that were produced on the playa between the years of 2002-2007. Lorenzo has worked for years to produce over 300 hours of psychedelic lectures, many of which by Terence Mckenna, which you can listen to at http://www.matrixmasters.com/pn/

Daniel Jabbour, the founder of the Psychedelic Society of San Franscisco, is helping to MC and run AV at this year's Palenque Norte series. Daniel's leadership has help grow the Psychedelic Society of SF to over 1500 members in less than six months. Find out more about the Psychedelic Society at http://www.psychedelicsf.org/

Palenque Norte History

The Palenque Norte journey began with the legendary Entheobotany Conferences held at the Chan Kah hotel near the ancient Mayan ruins just outside of Palenque, Mexico. There, Terence McKenna, Jonathan Ott, Ann & Sasha Shulgin, and a host of other psychedelic luminaries passed along many insights, discoveries, and wild tales to the fortunate Tribe members who were there. And it was at the end of the pool where Terence McKenna gave some of his last talks at the Chan Kah.

Years later, then in 2003, a few alumni from those conferences decided to have a "Palenque reunion" at the Burning Man Festival, and so we organized a theme camp and lecture series to continue the Palenque tradition. 

This Year's Schedule:

Tuesday, August 28th 

1pm-2pm – Amanda Sage -- "Vision Mapping for the Golden Age”
2pm-3pm – Music and Tea Break
3pm-4pm – Dr. Maddy
4pm-5pm -- Dr. Brian N. Hewlett 
"An Algorithm of Human Consciousness and Implications for
Artificial Intelligence"
5pm-6pm – Music and Tea Break 
6pm-7pm – Charles Shaw – “The War on Consciousness and Psychedelics”
7pm-8pm – Ken Adams – Producing “The Terence McKenna Experience”
8:30pm-10pm – Movie Screening: “The Terence McKenna Experience”
*additional late-night showings TBA

Wednesday, August 29th

Noon-1pm – Brian Wallace –“ The Entheobotany of Cacao” 
1pm-2pm – Doctuh Naughtilee N.D. – “Entheogens and Plant Medicines”
2pm-3pm – Music and Tea Break 
3pm-4pm – Daniel Pinchbeck, author of "2012: The Return of Quetzalcoatl"
4pm-5pm – John Allen and Tango Parrish Snyder – “Visions of Biospheres”
5pm-6pm – Music and Tea Break
6pm-7pm – John Gilmore and special guests
7pm-8pm – Rick Doblin, PhD - Executive Director of MAPS

Thursday, August 30th

Noon-1pm – Troy Dayton and Steve Bearman PhD
"The most Potent Psychedelic: the Person sitting next to You"
1pm-2pm – Zavier Phoenix – “Psychedelic Lifestyle Design”
2pm-3pm – Music and Tea Break 
3pm-4pm – James Oroc – “The Importance of the 2nd Psychedelic Revolution”
4pm-5pm – Robert Forte
7pm-6pm – Music and Tea Break 
6pm – 7pm – Dr. Bruce Damer – “Manifesting the Golden Universe”
7pm-8pm – Panel Discussion: "Have psychedelics helped to build better lives and stronger communities, or have they had more of the opposite effect?"
featuring Dr. Bruce Damer, Tomas Manning, and more TBA
8pm-8:30pm – Martina Hoffman's video tribute to Robert Venosa
8:30pm-10pm – Paul Stamets 

Friday, August 31st

Noon-1pm – Hamilton Souther – “Healing through Sound and Ayahuasca”
1pm-2pm – Annie Oak – “Developing a Community Tea House Model”
2pm-3pm – Alex and Allyson Grey – “Psychedelic Family Business”
3:00-3:15pm – Closing Ritual

For bios and descriptions join the Palenque Norte Group and download the full detailed schedule at https://www.facebook.com/groups/323403901087802/

Listen to previous Palenque Norte Lectures at: http://www.matrixmasters.com/pn/

Other Ways to Particpate

If you can’t contribute funds, you can help us out by sharing this campaign on Facebook or Twitter! You can use the buttons right on this page.

Check out our Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/323403901087802/

Please visit us on the playa this year at the Crystal Cavern, located at 9:15 and B. We can’t wait to see you in the dust!

Please visit us on the playa this year at the Crystal Cavern, located at 9:15 and B. We can’t wait to see you in the dust!

story:
Short Summary

My name Is Richard Wendel. I have always helped people get around and taking care of my friends 

the funds will go directly to repairing the engine of my car so I wont spend 6 hours traveling back and forth to work on the train.

Your contributions will help me take care of my ailing dog and able to spend more time taking care of her

If you know anyone who can help it would be greatly appreciated

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
As an emerging textile artist opportunities present themselves very quickly. They do not stay long. I was recently given such an opportunity to travel to Canada to participate in an art show opening. The four pieces pictured are the works of mine that have been accepted to the Kimiwan Zine Art Show Regeneration in Saskatoon Saskatchewan. This is my first international show and to be able to see my work in another country would be a honor that many artists do not get to have. By attending this show opening I will have the opportunity to network with other artists and members of my field. 

The funds raised with this campaign will go solely to getting buddy passes for my sister and I. We are both seasoned travelers and do it the cheapest way possible. Last summer I took a bus to San Antonio from Atlanta in order to attend a conference. For this show we are able to get buddy passes from an aunt who works as a flight attendant. We have asked the curators of the show if they know of anyone who we can stay with. We are trying to spend as little money as possible but even that requires that we have a little help.

This is where you guys come in. Please help me get to Canada so that I can see my work and so I can meet all the amazing people that have made this show possible!

***All perks will include a hand written thank you card from yours truly and a business card.
