story:
Keep up to date with this project, follow our journey and see how NightArt changes the world of Art! 

Follow us on Facebook:  www.facebook.com/nightartproject     
or Twitter:   www.twitter.com/nightartproject


NightArt is a revolutionary new product that is sure to be a hit for the children (and adults) in your life!  It is a stunning electronic Art screen that illuminates up your artwork, making it look even more amazing.


Combing Technology and Artwork

NightArt combines technology with artwork.  It allows you to be creative without the mess.  Using the special Neon paint pens, your child will spend hours creating the perfect picture.  Can you imagine their faces when the light illuminates their drawings?

Our NightArt screens use the best technology.  We use super bright 5050 LED strips so they will not need to be replaced for 50,000 hours.  That might not mean much but that is 7 years of continuous use! 

NightArt also does not take up much room.  The screens are the size of an ultra slim LED television.  Unless your child is using it, it will not take up much room. 

We are proud of our NightArt screen. It is attractive, simple, and classic looking.


Who needs NightArt?

Everybody! 

NightArt allows children to be creative without the mess of crayons, markers, paint, or play doh.  Children simply draw their design with the special NightArt neon paint pens.  Each NightArt comes with a special cloth to erase any mistakes or to start over.

Looking for a way to bond with your child?  Support NightArt.  Do things together that everyone enjoys.  You can spend hours with your child making the perfect drawing.  Then, pick out the lighting together!

Imagine rainy days when you have a few things to do.  What if your child spent a few hours on a rainy day designing the perfect picture? 

Maybe you can save NightArt for those special times when your children are bored. 

What if your child was autistic?  Studies are showing that allowing children to be creative helps with expression and healing.  Would you want to give your child a gift that allows him to create masterpieces without the mess?  Could you imagine how his face would light up when you turned on the lights? 


Many people are finding out that art therapy is helping many types of children (and adults).  It can help children who have mental health problems.  It shows great improvement with children of abuse. 

Art helps children who are dealing with death, grief, and loss.  It helps children who are anxious and depressed.  Art therapy is making a huge difference in the lives of children (and adults).  How about supporting NightArt so that we can help make a difference in the world?  People can focus on being creative without making a mess everywhere. 

Is your child struggling with learning?  Often, people are visual learners.  They learn by watching and trying.  Young children also learn fine motor skills by holding pencils, crayons, and more.  They learn that there are many ways to do things which helps with their thinking.  Studies even show that children who are artistic do better in school.  Want to help your child in school?  NightArt will be perfect for your child. 

Children learn to express themselves through art.  They will learn that they are not judged and are free to draw what they want.  They also are so proud of their work and love showing it off.  Imagine if it is hanging on the wall on a beautiful screen and lit up beautifully.  How proud would your child be?  NightArt wants to help children feel proud of their work. 

We are dedicating to getting children away from video games by allowing them to use our high tech screens to design their artwork.  It combines the best of both worlds.  Children will think that they are enjoying technology while also expressing themselves.  They will also get themselves off of the couch and away from the violence of video games and television.   

NightArt is truly a PERFECT Gift!

If you want to give the gift of creativity, without the mess, you NEED to give NightArt as a gift.  Children will spend hours creating a masterpiece.  Watching their face light up with the lights will be simply priceless!

We are dedicated to getting NightArt into the hands of people that it can help.  We would love to have it in the classrooms to help with learning.  It needs to be in therapists’ office so that children can work through their problems by creating beautiful pieces of artwork. 

We feel that children with learning disabilities and autism will show great improvement with NightArt.  Have a special needs child?  Think about giving them the gift of magic (without the mess).   

  

How the Boards Work?

Paint directly onto the screen using our special NightArt neon paint pens.

Once you are satisfied, turn on the screen and watch your artwork illuminate into multiple vibrant colors. 

Change the illuminating mode to match your artwork!

Dampen one of our cloths (which come with your NightArt) and simply wipe away.  Your artwork will come off easily, regardless of how long it has been on the screen! 



Interested? We need your help!

We have been developing NightArt for over two years.  We are proud of our revolutionary product that can be used by both children and adults.  We want to be able to share NightArt with everyone that can benefit from unleashing their artistic side, without the mess. 

We need to get NightArt into the hands of children that it can help.  Parents of children with special needs, learning disabilities, and autism need this product!  It can help so many children but without your help, we can’t get it to them!

Your funds will go to help us make NightArt the best product that it can be.  We will work on:

  • Manufacturing setup.
  • Branding and packaging.
  • Our first production run.
  • Creation of an Online NightArt world.
  • Further development for our screens, along with amazing features.

Contribute today so that NightArt can be the gift to get for Christmas 2014.  Children need to be allowed to be creative but many parents do not want to deal with the mess.  NightArt can be the perfect product for them!

Children will shine brightly showing off their illuminated drawing.  Support children and artwork today!  Support NightArt!  Help us bring the world NightArt today!

Thank you!

story:
Long Story Short

I want to get more stickers made.  Lots more.  So that they're cheaper and I can sell them for less.  If I order 5000 of them, the price drops dramatically, and if you help me crowdfund this, um, "unique" venture, I will pass these savings along to you.  

If you're interested in ordering just a couple, you can email me any time at vandalexpressionism@gmail.com, but if you're looking to get a bunch, like 50, 100 or more, here is an opportunity to help fund their creation, while giving you access to deeply discounted, wholesale pricing.

The stickers are a fun and cheap way to add a little pizzazz to your cell phone, laptop, notebook, or just about anything else.  

-----------------------------

Dimensions: 6 cm x 8 cm

story:
Did the LEAP year bring you Doom or Boom? Has Berlin become a post apocalyptic centre inhabited by hybrid beings, glamour mutants, robotic queens? Whether the last year was filled with Conquest, War, Famine, or Death - Something went wrong with the apocalypse, we’re still here...


As we survived 2012 and look forward to welcoming 2013 LEAP is throwing a fundraiser new years party.

2012 has been a very successful one and we hope with your support to continue our project at least until the next LEAP year.

 
LEAP - Monday, December 31, 2012 – 10:00pm

Dress code: white, red, black, grey, the colors of the apocalypse!

Come early for a the spectacular terrace view over Alexanderplatz at midnight

with...

URBAN MUTATIONS DJ MFK & DJ WEN
with projections by: Harm van den Dorpel
http://www.urbanmutations.com/
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Urban-Mutations/325397670828238
http://soundcloud.com/shrednock
http://www.mixcloud.com/koennutters/

Andre Wakko
http://soundcloud.com/andrewakko

Thomas Azier and Sander Houtkruijer (DJ-Set)
http://thomasazier.com/
http://www.spex.de/2012/10/28/thomas-azier/?search=thomas+azier#hide

Bearcat
http://soundcloud.com/bearcats_mixtapes

Hellraiser
Voin de Voin

_______________________________________________________

LEAP SILVESTER FUNDRAISING PARTY

Tickets:

After Purchase LEAP will then be in contact with a confirmation email.  The Purchaser will be issued with a number which is his/her ticket for the event.
  • You will not be issued with a physical ticket.
  • After payment is made you will receive a confirmation email from LEAP with all relevant information  and a Ticket Number.
  • Please print the confirmation email with the Ticket Number and present at the entrance on the 31.12.2012
  • Please note should you purchase more than one ticket please answer our confirmation email with the names of the other ticket holders.
_______________________________________________________

LEAP
Lab for Electronic Arts and Performance
(Berlin Carré 1. Stock)
Karl-Liebknecht-Str. 13
10178 Berlin

www.leapknecht.de
info@leapknecht.de

subscribe to newsletter: http://bit.ly/NSf7VL

Twitter: http://twitter.com/leapberlin
Flickr: www.flickr.com/photos/leapberlin/sets/

Vimeo Channel www.vimeo.com/channels/leap

story:
UPDATE DEC31: PERKS CANNOT BE FULFILLED IF $17000 GOAL IS NOT REACHED. YOU WILL BE REFUNDED IF YOU CONTRIBUTED AND THE GOAL IS NOT REACHED.

What's this?

A fundraiser to give me the ability to make metal art that people have asked me to make.

Who are you?

My name is Andres Avelar and I live in Gilbert Arizona. Over at the east valley institute of technology(EVIT), I have been working with a TorchmateX plasma table to make parts and signs for the welding program and for those who get approval from the instructors. Because EVIT is a vocational school that is separated into two sections, AM and PM, I am only working with it for two hours. Two hours is a short amount of time and is devoted to the projects for the program and some art projects for the instructors. Whenever people see the art that I do with the machine they ask if I can make something for them. While I really want to make their art in metal, two hours is not enough time to make projects for both the program and other people. So that's what this is, just an effort to make metal art for people.

What's the money going too?

The total $17000 comes from price quotes from; Torchmate, Hypertherm, and looking around on the internet, rounded.

$12000: Torchmate2x2 growth series 

$3000: Hypertherm powermax45

$800: Air Compressor

$1200: subpanel installation, plasma consumables, and sheet metal for your perk

the price is not locked to the category, if I can get the equipment at a lower price the money saved will go to subpanel installation, plasma consumables, and sheet metal.

Why do you need a subpanel? 

Even though it is possible to run this equipment from the standard power box on the side of the house, it is much easier to add more equipment in the future with a subpanel.

How much sheet metal are you getting?

As much as it takes to fulfill the perks I have promised.

If more than $17000 is raised does it all go to more sheet metal/consumables?

No, there is more equipment and a brief description of what it can add to make more intricate projects. here are the stretch goals.

$17400: Sandblasting, this is a cabinet and a sandblasting gun to add another texture to projects.

$21000: Platemarker, the ability to engrave pictures. while it is possible to get an "engraved" image with a plasma torch, this can only be done with thick material and has a high chance of warping the metal. Projects that use the plate marker will be brought down to a maximum of 24"x20" due to how it is mounted to the track.

The image on the left is with plasma gouging and the image on the right is the plate marker from Torchmate.

$24000: Roller, this can give projects a curved look like this

$30000: Tube cutting attachment, the ability to cut designs into pipe up to 8" diameter for lamp projects. I will admit I have never used this attachment but after seeing a picture of what the g-code looks like for the attachment, it will be no harder than cutting on flat plate.

 Tube cutter image from Torchmate

How come you are not upgrading the plasma table to the 4x4 or even the 2x4?

You see the problem is space, I know I have room for the extra equipment listed above, which brings me to the last stretch goal

$80000: I will upgrade the plasma table to a 4x4 and move it all to a separate house I will live in and work to make your art projects.
Any additional money will be used to buy sheet metal, consumables, and pipe.

Perks (These CANNOT be fulfilled until $17000 is raised)

I will be updating this section with example images when I am able to make them. I will be back working with the table January 5 so keep checking back after then to see what the perks look like. All of these perks are at a discount from what normal price would be.

Sparkler

thank you email as well as your name being listed as a contributor on my youtube page at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCHaBs7UxQlCI5zuje-Y3KA/feed

Thank you plate

Image coming soon

Rose

The blue color on this rose comes from a oxy-acetylene torch but the same color can be created with a propane torch.

1'x1'

An image for this is really up to you it's just that the size is limited to 1foot by 1foot.

2'x2'

Same as the 1'x1' its just that the project can now be 2feet by 2feet.

Combination(s)

As the name implies this category just makes it faster to bundle projects to one person. Be sure to check which perks are in the combination.

25%off

Sparkler,rose,1'x1',2'x2' perks are in this as well as free shipping US an international for those perks. Those who claim this perk will get 25%off any order from now on.
25 available

50%off 

The same perks as 25%off but instead of 25%off you will get 50%off any order from now on.
10 available 

Entrepreneur 

This perk will get you sparkler perk, thankyouplate perk, a dozen roses, 1'x1' and 2'x2' perk. those perks will get free shipping to US and international. Anything you order from me will only have the price of the sheet metal that is used
2 available

Feel free to email me at avelarsarts@gmail.com to answer any questions you may have.Thank you for your time, I'll see you later.

$30000: Tube cutting attachment, the ability to cut designs into pipe up to 8" diameter for lamp projects. I will admit I have never used this attachment but after seeing a picture of what the g-code looks like for the attachment, it will be no harder than cutting on flat plate.
 Tube cutter image from Torchmate
How come you are not upgrading the plasma table to the 4x4 or even the 2x4?
    You see the problem is space, I know I have room for the extra equipment listed above, which brings me to the last stretch goal
$80000: I will upgrade the plasma table to a 4x4 and move it all to a separate house I will live in and work to make your art projects.
Any additional money will be used to buy sheet metal, consumables, and pipe.

Perks (These CANNOT be fulfilled until $17000 is raised)
I will be updating this section with example images when I am able to make them. I will be back working with the table January 5 so keep checking back after then to see what the perks look like. All of these perks are at a discount from what normal price would be.
Sparkler
thank you email as well as your name being listed as a contributor on my youtube page at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCHaBs7UxQlCI5zuje-Y3KA/feed


Thank you plate
Image coming soon

Rose

The blue color on this rose comes from a oxy-acetylene torch but the same color can be created with a propane torch.
1'x1'
An image for this is really up to you it's just that the size is limited to 1foot by 1foot.
2'x2'
Same as the 1'x1' its just that the project can now be 2feet by 2feet.
Combination(s)
As the name implies this category just makes it faster to bundle projects to one person. Be sure to check which perks are in the combination.

25%offSparkler,rose,1'x1',2'x2' perks are in this as well as free shipping US an international for those perks. Those who claim this perk will get 25%off any order from now on.
25 available

50%off 

The same perks as 25%off but instead of 25%off you will get 50%off any order from now on.
10 available 
Entrepreneur 
This perk will get you sparkler perk, thankyouplate perk, a dozen roses, 1'x1' and 2'x2' perk. those perks will get free shipping to US and international. Anything you order from me will only have the price of the sheet metal that is used
2 available

Feel free to email me at avelarsarts@gmail.com to answer any questions you may have.Thank you for your time, I'll see you later.

story:
India or BUST!!!

I have been pursuing a career in Ceramics for about 10 years now. I have moved all over the country chasing my ceramic endeavors. Most recently Ive been in New York doing a ceramic art residency and teaching.

Ive been wanting an international experience for a long time, and its funny how sometimes life just puts the right things in the right places. I was lucky enough to be invited to move to Pondicherry, India for 6 months to teach ceramics and make my own work as well. 

I couldn't have searched for such an opportunity at a better time. Ray Meeker, (who is a substantial figure in the world of ceramics) has been teaching a ceramics course to indians for 35 years at Golden Bridge Pottery. When I inquired about opportunities in South India he offered me to teach the ceramics course in his place this year. Room, board, and my studio are to be covered, but this is not a paid positon.

My fundraiser is to get myself to, from, and around Pondicherry so I can teach this course. 

Plane tickets  $2000, Vaccines $750, Visa $250, India transportation  $1000

story:
Hi Everyone!

 My name is Caitlin Tschanz, and I currently attend Moore College of Art and Design in Philadelphia as a Fine Arts major. I have grown exponentially through my time at Moore as both an artist and person, and I have decided for myself that traveling abroad is something that I would strongly like to incorporate into my life and art practice at this time.

 That being said, I have applied and been accepted into Arcadia University's Summer in Rome program, which is a 3-credit course aimed at evaluating the historical and contemporary aspects of the Italian culture, and I am excited to learn about local customs regarding language, traditional studio practice, and overall wellness. I believe that going to Rome will present a unique challenge for me to face— how will I fight my own habits in order to embrace new ones? Direct observation and engagement with the Italian way of living will conquer this, because I will center myself in one of the most artistically inclined cities in the world.

 With your help, I will literally be able to study the work of the Masters, and hone my artistic capabilities and process. I expect to have a more definitive understanding as to what inspired these astute artists, and I know that this study will lend me a richer understanding of what about Rome shapes the mindset of such talented people. By studying the land and resources, I hope to place myself in their shoes and to absorb their mode of communication and thinking.

 Overall, I will embrace a new way of living and I will dedicate myself to a regiment of expanding and examining the diverse and new imagery that Rome offers. My overall goal is to consume as much of what life’s travels might provide for me so that I will become infinitely more aware of myself as a woman, aspiring artist and informed student.

 

How Can You Contribute?

 Below I have listed the cost of necessities for this trip, and I would greatly appreciate any donations you can make!

Flight

$1,400.00

Local Travel

$50.00

Meals

$500.00

Personal Expenses

$350.00

Books & Supplies

$80.00

 

 

 

 

Total: $2,380

I would like to leave you on a positive note, so I want to thank you for taking the time to read this, and I implore you to please help me by donating any amount that you are able to-- it is much appreciated! Your help will directly shape my practice as an aspiring artist, and it will impact my career and education for years to come!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute a monetary donation- take heart! Any help spreading the word about this cause would be greatly appreciated, and you help make this process much easier.

If you have any further questions, feel free to email me: caitlintschanz@comcast.net

Grazie mille,
Caitlin :)

Kaleidoscope Eyes Coloring Book Project

As an artist, I have found much comfort in doodling and coloring through stressful times, and it became a peaceful refuge as I went through harsh treatments from Chronic Lyme Disease. Still battling for my health, I crafted a coloring book of my doodles for my nephews who I miss like crazy.  And from this project came to realize that there is a demand for coloring books that can be enjoyed by adults as well as kids.

Your Contribution

For every $10, you will receive one 20-page, 8.5x11 book filled with my original artwork. The black and white doodles are waiting for you to fill in with color.  Crayons, colored pencils and markers work well on the coloring pages.

Other Ways You Can Help

In order to get the coloring books printed, I need your help selling 500 copies.  Please share this campaign and help me make a little noise.  Indiegogo has share tools that make spreading the word super convenient.

Thank you to all who contribute and help share this campaign.  All profits will go towards this starving artist's medical bills.  Thank you, thank you, thank you.

Perks and Payment

Sorry about the confusion with payment.  To order, please select the perk that reflects the number of coloring books you would like.   Make sure to enter your mailing address.  You must continue to PayPal to complete your purchase, but you do not need a paypal account.  

Letter to Family & Friends

Hello my dear friends and family. 
As many of you know, I have been getting progressively ill.  After countless doctors and treatments, I was finally diagnosed with Lyme Disease In addition to the Crohn's Disease. Even though I celebrated a diagnosis that explains the insanely disparate symptoms, Lyme Disease is extremely complicated to treat because of the numerous co-infections and parasites involved.  For over a year, I have been working with doctor in Denver who treats Lyme with both conventional and alternative medicine. My health is improving, but way slower than expected.  I have been unable to work for the year of treatment, and insurance does not cover the extremely expensive treatment (doctor's visits, testing, prescriptions, and homeopathic medicines etc.). Which means that my husband has been working several jobs, and my parents have been paying most of my medical bills. Blessed!
So, I'm trying to raise money towards the next couple months of treatment... and a new pair of yoga pants. Encouraged by friends, I started a crowdfunding campaign to get coloring books printed with pictures of my art doodles. If I can get enough people to order 500 copies of the coloring book at $10 a copy, I will reach my goal and be able to get the coloring books printed.  
The Kaleidoscope Eyes Coloring Book will be 20-pages of my original art doodles, fun to color for both kids and adults!  $10 a copy.  
If you can and feel the inclination, please reserve a copy for yourself or for a gift. I finally figured out the payment process.  To order, please go to the Indiegogo page (link below). Select a perk that designates the number of coloring books you would like.  If you would like more than 10 copies, simply "contribute" $10 for each additional copy.  To pay, it will make you go through PayPal, but you do not need an account. 
And please share the campaign!  Fifteen days in, we are half-way through the campaign. I could really use your help to reach the goal, which is $5000. If I don't get enough people to reserve copies of the coloring book, you will be refunded at the end the campaign. So there's no risk!  
Thank you to everybody who contributed already, to everyone who purchases a coloring book, and to all you special folks who have encouraged and supported me during this difficult time. Even if I don't meet the goal, I am sincerely overwhelmed by the love and concern. 
Best! 
Allison

story:
Diorama Magazine!
An independent, self-financed and seasonal cultural magazine, a free press in italian that will be distributed in independent project spaces, galleries, art universities and academies selected from the territory of Milan.

What's a DIORAMA?
The first Diorama was opened in Paris by Daguerre and Bouton in 1822: an antique mechanism that has been one of the most visionary attraction of the nineteenth-century.
It was a mobile theatre device with two or more painted landscape views, that if illuminated in such particular way could look totally different due to prospective plays: depending on the direction and intensity of the light, the scene would appear to change, leaving the audience astonished by the unexpected effect.

Diorama Magazine presents an editorial politic which is supposed to make it looks more like a conceptual album or diary, rather than an art news magazine.
Every issue, instead of regular update articles, will offer a thematic collection.
Every issue contains three months of research which, like a anthology of visual inspiration, is meant to be collected and consulted when needed.
Every issue is developed around a topic according to which we are going to choose artists, artworks, spaces and events to review, in order to propose an overview of how different disciplines approach to that content, always trying our best to fan out refined examples, underground or classics they may be.

The topic of the fourth issue of Diorama will be 'INTERFERENCES', and it will be published in October 2012.

 

Help us celebrating our first year of Diorama with a edition that breaks 500 copies!!

While our goal of raising $500 through IndieGoGo will be a great help, it is still just a tenth of what it will cost to print this issue..


So we are also looking for advertisers to promote their work in both web and printed versions of the magazine, and help us to bring in the rest!


Check out Diorama Issue/00, /01 and /02 HERE!
www.dioramamag.com

story:
Our Story

I am involved with the 33 Contemporary Gallery in Chicago, IL with a bunch of great artists.  We have the opportunity to exhibit in Turin Italy this year during the summer time!  This exhibition at the Museo Regionale Di Scienze Naturali Di Torino,  is part of the 2012 International Year of Sustainable Energy.  It allows us to reflect on this big event and share our creative vision in our unique way.  This exhibition is curated by Sergio Gomez, the director of the gallery and we are looking at shipping costs.  Shipping overseas takes a lot and anything you can donate will help out the gallery a lot.  


The Impact

 It is a great opportunity for us to showcase our creative insight towards sustainable energy and share our art for all.  


What We Need & What You Get

Our gallery has about 30 members and each of us are hoping to raise $100.  I would love to raise above this.  I know it is a short time, but anything will help.  All of the proceeds go to the 33 Contemporary Gallery.  I am also offering Perks.


Other Ways You Can Help

Unleash your voice! -- Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise. There should be tools below for advertising via Twitter or your Facebook account.  Anything will help! :)

story:
Our Story.

We are The Crow and The Wolf, an artist duo dedicated to furthering human sustainability by reconnecting society with it’s primal form of communication, art-making. 

Since receiving our bachelors from The Maryland Institute College of Art in 07' and 08', we have collaborated on the development of a new medium, one that combines installation art, film-making, expressive therapy, civic involvement, and anthropology. Our passion for social reform coupled with our belief that art is a powerful tool for communicating and maintaining mental health, inspired us to launch The Crow and The Wolf Project. 




What's the Project?!

 Community building. Artist and community collaboration. Reformatting what a "documentary" is.

The Crow and The Wolf Project is a mixed-media documentary focused on the current state of Art in America and how it is being devalued in our school systems. Our goal is to visit communities that have found creative solutions and those who are devastated by these cuts to stimulate a productive conversation in order to collaborate on solutions.


It is time to take matters into our own hands! Arts education should NEVER be compromised as it provides a base for critical thinking and problem solving skills necessary in a child’s developmental stages. By eliminating arts education, we are severely handicapping our future generations.

We, as artists, educators and community members have an obligation to maintain Arts Education inside and out of the classroom. If our schools can’t provide sufficient art programs, then is our responsibility as a nation to supplement:
  • reformatting school curriculum to incorporate creative activities in academic classes
  • providing after school programs
  • empowering youth to express themselves creatively
  • Educating about alternative options for art supplies: using recycled materials, developing a second-hand art supply organization in your town, etc.



More than just documenting!


The documentary will combine film, photography, writing, audio, installation, book-making and so on) that will be presented in an alternative format upon completion. By conducting collaborations with like-minded young artists, we will host experimental installation projects & impromptu happenings in order to research how collaborative and expressive art can shift the mental well being of a community and induce national unification in this country. The projects also allows us to fully engage with community members in a artistic fashion, pushing the concept of an "interview" to a new level.

This is our art.


We intend on finding those voices amongst the deserts of Wyoming to the underground establishments of NYC and everything in between, and build a family across the states, of thinkers, leaders and creators.

Our final presentation of our documentary will be in an installation format somewhere unknown to us at this point.

The location will find us.

Those we meet and collaborate with along the way will be invited to participate it's construction and have the opportunity to collaborate and converse with fellow artists of all mediums in recreating this experience.


 Our goal as creative communicators is to promote self-education, social reform through collaboration, and communal empowerment.  In addition to completing a final documentary experience, we want to share with YOU what we learn and experience along the way via our website and blog.

Please follow at: The Crow & The Wolf Project Blog


As a diverse country, we have TONS to share with each other. [ and we do cuz' we think creatively :)!! ] and we want to help facilitate this sharing! Of course we are excited to share our findings with viewers everywhere in the final presentation of a documentary, but we are not just making a documentary about whats going on and how people feel about it, we are facilitating a community building process! The communities we engage with, through our help and website, will be able to connect with others around the country to exchange ideas, solutions, and support on this subject.

We happily take on the responsibility of unifying. Through our website, we will build a database, or as we would like to call it, an "online family" for the communities we visit to stay in touch with us, and meet their neighbors.



What We Need & What You Get


Every dollar counts!!!  The more money donated, the more projects we can do and the more communities we can visit. We are aiming to to travel West to East and back again, visiting as many states as possible!


The money donated will go to:

  • Materials for community projects & installations! (paint, brushes, paper, wood, hardware, permit fees we may be faced with for public art opportunities).

  • Documentary: film, film processing, editing, printing, book-making materials, batteries, sound equipment

The artists!:

  • Staying healthy in order to work on this for as long as possible! We intend on maintaining a local and sustainable diet and fuel the local economies we enter by being patrons of their farms and local businesses. 


  • Other travel expenses & safety. ( We will be sharing homes with welcoming friends and using the lovely CouchSurfing.org network, as well as camping ), but donations will help us to get from point A to B to C and so on (we ain't gonna fool, we need help with fuel!)



Other Ways You Can Help:

Spread the word about our campaign!!!! 

Collaborate with us!! Do you live in a community or work in a school that is faced with cuts to the Arts? We would be more than happy to include your community in our creation, work on a collaborative project with you, or simply  have a conversation.

Offer us a modest meal if we are in your area!
Not a lot of room, but have some land or a yard? We have a tent, we can camp!

The money donated will go to:
Materials for community projects & installations! (paint, brushes, paper, wood, hardware, permit fees we may be faced with for public art opportunities).
Documentary: film, film processing, editing, printing, book-making materials, batteries, sound equipment
The artists!:
Staying healthy in order to work on this for as long as possible! We intend on maintaining a local and sustainable diet and fuel the local economies we enter by being patrons of their farms and local businesses. 

Other travel expenses & safety. ( We will be sharing homes with welcoming friends and using the lovely CouchSurfing.org network, as well as camping ), but donations will help us to get from point A to B to C and so on (we ain't gonna fool, we need 
help with fuel!)



Other Ways You Can Help:Spread the word about our campaign!!!!  Collaborate with us!! Do you live in a community or work in a school that is faced with cuts to the Arts? We would be more than happy to include your community in our creation, work on a collaborative project with you, or simply  have a conversation.Offer us a modest meal if we are in your area!Not a lot of room, but have some land or a yard? We have a tent, we can camp!

story:
The Black Artë Society is a collective of graphic artists that utilize hand drawn Black and White imagery and modern technologies to bring the world artwork that is new, interactive, and amazing!

Recently we have decided that we would love to share our works around the country and we need a little bit of help getting there. Many of you have watched us over the years grow and expand on our abilities and now is the time for us to put our best foot forward and see what doors we can open and take that next step.

We realize that believing in your dreams is not always enough and sometimes it takes a little bit of money to get there. We will be going on tour this summer with our artwork to several exhibitions around the country. To us this is a siginificant step to being able to continue on with our journey.

You can take a more detailed look at some of our work here

Any amount of support is greatly appreciated!

Thanks a million from all of us at the BA Society

 

What it's going to take to get there:

-Application Fees / Booth Space: $350

-Canopy Tent: $450

-Transportation: $1500

-GAS: Probably a Bazillion $

-Food and Shelter: at least $500

-Hard Work, Long Hours & Dedication to making it happen!


Dates Tentatively On the Artë Tour:

-KC 5th Annual Downtown Art Fair: May 18-20

-Downtown Olathe Arts Festival: June 9&10

-Crown Valley Art Fair, St. Genivive, MO: June 16 & 17

-51st Annual Grand Haven Art Fest: June 23 & 24

-5th Annual Boulder Festival of Arts: June 30 & July 1

-4th Annual Downtown Frisco Arts Fair: July 7 & 8

-Grandjunction Art Fest & Wine Affair: July 14 & 15

story:
Short Summary

 

Hey everyone,

James Creative Shields here. I'm trying to raise $2500 for a solo show I'm having in October. I've been busy in 2012 promoting the Hip Hop Coloring Book and working on a slew of design projects, but this year would not be complete without me presenting a new body of creative works to my audience. This will be my first month long showing in New York. It will be at the Rebar Walkway Gallery in Dumbo, Brooklyn (145 front st.) for the First Thursday's Art Walk. Please help me deliver another great showing complimented by kool merchandise and great people.

What We Need & What You Get

As you may already know I try to make each show my best show. I want this experience to be just as special for me as it is for those who are able to attend

The money raised will go completely to the production of the show. Your support will allow me to create and you to take part of my creations with you through original artwork and various forms of affordable merchandise.

While i've already started painting I do have a long way to go. Here's the budget:

~30% Supplies (brushes, paints, spray paints, canvas, etc)

~20% Prepping (photographing paintings, framing, promo items)

~30% Merchandise (stickers, buttons, prints, postcards, posters, etc.)

~20% Studio space for the month of september

 

The Impact

It should be of no surprise but your support (financially and spiritually) is keeping my dream alive and allowing me to continue to develop as a creator. Without your ongoing contributions I would not be this far along in my career. Thank you for believing in me and allowing me to continue on this creative journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. Tell a friend. Much Love!

story:
WE BURNT THE SOUP

On Friday, September 1st at 12:30 AM, we burn the soup box and celebrate three unphogetable years shared with all of you beautiful nincomsoups. But first, we need your help returning to Burning Man's deep playa for one last time. Shh, it's...

STORY TIME

The SFB story stems from a brief moment many, many years ago, far beyond Black Rock City's Esplanade, on a frigid deep playa evening. There, gazing at the brothtaking sky and discussing the soupernatural, sat our founder, Noodles and his brother, Max. Although initially vibrant and jovial, their topic of discussion soon shifted to the bitter cold air and a desire for simple pleasures.

"I could sure go for a blanket right now. You know, warm me up from the outside in." Max remarked as he shivered in the deepest of deep playa.

"I could go for a bowl of soup to warm me up from the inside out!" Noodles replied.

Now what followed may be the worst idea ever uttered as Max suggested: "How about a bowl of blanket flavored soup?"

In a harsh tone, Noodles replied: "That's sounds disgusting! Who want's to eat soup that tastes like blankets!?"

Hours passed and their situation worsened. But suddenly, a dusty thought shot out of the Man's neon head, blew across the playa, swirled around the temple walls and shot directly into Noodles's noggin as an idea of spectacular brilliance.

"Some Soup Flavored Blankets, now that would be warmly delicious!" He proclaimed.

Max agreed! And the two brothers jumped to their feet, crossed the cold desert floor and returned to camp to procrastinate for seven years.

As veteran burners we understand the significance of your trash fence quest and the sometimes difficult elements you encounter. Soup Flavored Blankets is a warm soupy refuge and our gift to the many wandering souls of Burning Man.

EXPERIENTIAL SOUP FLAVORED BLANKETS

The jumbo-sized inflatable SFB can emits light and serves as a navigational aid for all the weary travelers. Directly across from the soup can exists an equally huge SFB Premium Cracker box. Inside, participants will find an assortment of delicious ready-made soup and hot beverage mixes as well as access to boiling water.

After treating yourself to the hottest soup in Black Rock City, choose a blanket and carefully place your mug of soup into the provided pouch. Begin to wrap your shivering body inside the insulating blanket. You are now comfortably snuggled inside a Soup Flavored Blanket, slurp on wandering souls!

PLEASE, HELP US

Your tax-deductible donation goes 100% to our transportation, repairs, materials, storage and of course, soup! The Soup Flavored Blankets staff is all-volunteer with a commitment to enhancing your deep playa adventures. You can also help us spread the SFB campaign! Follow us on Facebook and Instagram. And please, find your way to Soup Flavored Blankets during Burning Man and say hi. Your participation is the greatest support you can offer.

EXPENSES

Soup - $2,500

Transportation - $1,500

Burn Supplies - $500

Repairs - $500

Thank you so much for all of your continued soupport. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram and share your stories on Yelp (1 star rating ONLY). Soup you soon!

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi I’m Vedric Jordan, I am a self-taught oil painter/artist, who has never had any formal lessons. I am senior businessat major Troy University. Art is my passion I have drawn since i was a small child but at 17 i drew my first person and at 18 I did my first oil painting. My family thought a business degree would be best so i pursued that goal, but art was always on my mind/heart.

My reason for funding is to be able to supply retail distributors and wholesalers with Lightway art products at the correct quantities for retail distribution, advertising, better storage and decrease manufacturing cost of art products.

 

I am looking to move forward with my artwork and custom art products I have over 110 original oil paintings  that I have done since age 18.

 

 

 

I came from nowhere and started with nothing but by God's grace I am pressing forward. I want to move the vision of Lightway Products forward and also help and inspire other entrepreneurs a chance to succeed. I am happy to be able to share some of my original oil paintings with you.

 

I’m the creator of  Lightway Products which is an online store to sell my artwork and used electronics dropshipping.

 

Lightway Products LLC

 

 

 

Here is how funding will be invested:

 

1. Retail Supply Quota and distribution: In order to supply the correct order quota to distributors we need your help, funding will go directly to supplying retails with the correct quotas and wholesale prices that are required. In order to effectively work with distributors for gift shops and stores we have to work with them on prices. With your generous contributions we will be able to lower our production cost and intern lower the wholesale prices to distributors.

 

 

2. Cut production cost and lower prices:  By outsourcing production Lightway Products can lower production cost and intern lower our retail prices so that more people can purchase Lightway Products at an affordable price. This would also make it easier to work with more wholesalers and retail distributors.

 

4. Product development; funds will be to make quality lower cost products through specialized outsourcing. Barcodes, metal, fabric, materials, will be purchased for all our Lightway production.

 

5. Secure Storage and work space: Lightway Products will gain have a more appropriate secure venue for storage of items and orders that need to be shipped. Business insurance will be purchased as well.

 

 

 

Personal Thanks to You!!

 I want to say thank you by offering Several of Lightway Products art gifts, I know you, will enjoy. Any donation is appreciated as every little bit helps; there is no donation too small. I am forever grateful for your kindness.

 

Stretch Goal

Rest assured if Lightway products entire goal is not reached funding will still go toward retail product distribution, more efficient product manufacturing and safer business and storage space. However in the event we exceed our goal funding will be used for brand new product development and expansion of distribution, retail bar codes, insurance and art supplies.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

    I ask that you tell all your friends and neighbors about Lightway Product which is original artwork and art products. I appreciate your help. Anything is appreciated as every little bit helps; there is nothing too small I am grateful for your generosity.

please share this across social media as well.

 

  Please use the Indiegogo share tools, to spread the word over the internet. Anything you can do is greatly appreciated! Thank you

 

 

 Lightway Products was launched October 15, 2010, in the living room of my apartment. I would like to take it forward from solely being on the internet and my home into in retail stores via distribution channels, decrease production cost by outsourcing our brand and a new storage area. I am looking for the opportunity to turn my business into something great that can plant inspiration back into the world. Over 80 custom Lightway Products to choose from

Some of of original Framed Art Prints I am honored to share with you!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Daily Planners

 

Lightway Key Chains

 

 

Peace Pillows

Thoughts of Insiration 12 Month Wall Calendars

 

 

Lightway Custom Sky Skateboard Board

 

iPhone Cases

 

Decorative Magnets                                                                                                  

 

My original oil paintings are the foundation of 'thoughts of inspiration' which is my product line that centers around God's hope and inspiration

 

'Thoughts of Inspiration' is a product line that was developed based on my original artwork.

 

 As Mentioned In the  $100 $300 Perks Get you very own custom hand drawing or original oil painting from an up and coming artist which will be worth a fortune one day soon.
